story:
A Historically & Culturally Important Building

In 1960, the American Institute of Architects designated seventeen buildings designed by Frank Lloyd Wright for preservation as examples of Wright’s architectural contribution to American culture. The list included Fallingwater, the Guggenheim Museum, and Madison’s own Unitarian Meeting House—home of the First Unitarian Society of Madison. The building is known worldwide as a seminal work of mid-century modern architecture and is visited by thousands of visitors from the US and around the world every year.

National & Global Significance

Before the Unitarian Meeting House was built, church architecture primarily consisted of rectangular boxes with steeples. Frank Lloyd Wright created an absolutely new approach to religious building design by incorporating the steeple, sanctuary, and parish hall into one coherent structure.

Significance in Madison

Wisconsin Historical Society’s State Historic Preservation Officer, Jim Draeger, recently said there are places that are seminal in our understanding of who we are—they give us a sense of place and belonging. These places tell important stories that connect us to our past, present, and future. “There are special places that help define Madison and by extension, they define us.” The Unitarian Meeting House is such a seminal place.

Unitarian Universalist religious activities are only a part of the Unitarian Meeting House’s everyday use. For more than 50 years, it has been home to the Meeting House Nursery School. Shaarei Shamayim, a Jewish Reconstructionist community, maintains offices and holds services and other religious activities in the building. Other faiths, as diverse as a Buddhist meditation group, a Taoist Tai-Chi society, and Faith Leaders of Wisconsin, regularly meet here. Numerous musical events, including performances from the Madison Bach Musicians, are offered regularly and provide important cultural activities for the Madison community. Other non-religious groups meet here, either weekly or occasionally, including Goodwill Employment, Girl Scouts, the Madison Literary Club, Physicians for Social Responsibility, and the Wisconsin Council for the Blind and Visually Impaired.

What's Happening? Its Age is Showing

Last summer the Unitarian Meeting House roof started leaking, again. Structural engineers determined the truss work supporting the 67–year–old roof has reached the end of its useful life. Detailed studies of Wright’s initial drawings have revealed that his design adjustments during construction have seriously compromised the integrity of the trusses over time.

Our Goal is to Secure the Long-Term Viability

of this Iconic Structure

Members of the First Unitarian Society and Friends of the Meeting House have raised $1.35 million, which will fund a significant portion of the required work. Our goal is to ensure this designated National Historic Landmark remains an important part of Madison’s cultural legacy. Several generous grants have been received to fund this project, including a $25,000 gift from the Pleasant T. Rowland Foundation and a $100,000 gift from the Evjue Foundation (the charitable arm of The Capital Times).

What Work is Most Urgent?

  • Reinforcement of the 10 wooden trusses with light-weight steel and/or gusset plates.
  • Replacement of failing nails with modern fasteners.
  • Addition of an impermeable membrane.
  • Replacement of the failing copper roof and decking.
  • Replacement of the wood and glass in the iconic prow. (The Evjue Foundation grant has fully funded this portion of the Unitarian Meeting House restoration project.)

The total costs to fund this critical remedial work is projected to be $2.1 million.

Please Join Us in Making Sure this Building

is Retained for Posterity

If you share our pride of place or simply appreciate Frank Lloyd Wright and his architectural achievements and want to do your part in helping to ensure the integrity of this historic building into the future, please consider making a contribution to the Wright the Roof Campaign.

story:
Deeply influenced by the power of plants, animals and natural elements, the Shipibo are an indigenous community in the Amazon Rainforest of Peru, who are fighting to protect their culture and maintain their ancestral knowledge, despite years of invasion and colonisation.

This is a story we are all too familiar with — an indigenous community breaking down and now their knowledge and traditions threatened.

The story of the Shipibo and their Onanyas has never be told in such detail and depth.

The Shipibo culture is at risk of extinction. The last generations to speak Shipibo are dying out. With that comes the loss of thousands of years of knowledge, art and medicine. By supporting this project, we have the opportunity, as a collective, to help preserve and strengthen this very special culture.

This documentary will help the Shipibo people by stimulating a more conscious and direct economic growth to local people, help support cultural and educational programmes that have been created by the family featured in the documentary. This will keep their culture strong by keeping local children in the local area rather than migrating to larger cities.

 

 

This is an impact campaign that will help the Shipibo people needs $30,000 to generate enough funds to complete post-production and promotion of this documentary. 

  • Preserve their culture through a documentary which creates historical content for the children and future generations to identify their culture.
  • Protect the knowledge and traditions by supporting an educational program across Pucallpa, Peru, to teach Shipibo and English in the Amazon rainforest. A first of its kind.
  • Provide prosperity for the Shipibo by lighting up a culture, offering a more conscious economic growth to help their people survive and build their cultural and educational programmes.

 

 

How will it be split:

$10,000 (33.3%) - Motion Graphics 

$8,000 (26.7%) - For Sound Design and Musical Score

$4,000 (13.3%) - Archive Footage and Additional Content

$2,500 (8.3%) - Subtitles and Voiceover in English, Spanish and Shipibo

$2,500 (8.3%) - Film Festival Fees and Publicity 

$1,500 - (5%) - Marketing and Promotion

$1,500 (5%) - Fees to use Indiegogo Platform

No donation is too small. Any and every amount counts. 

 

Become a Producer or Executive Producer on this documentary! The producer and executive producer will have the chance to meet the Shipibo Onanyas featured in the documentary. You will also have contact with the director, Paris Tume. where you can offer your creative support and have a say in the final product. You can really help make a huge difference to the Shipibo people this way.

Please contact Paris at: onanyathefilm@gmail.com

 

     

    Onanyas

     

    Maestra Rosa Pinedo Vasquez, more affectionately known as “Mama Rosa”, has 31 years of experience in the practice of plant medicine. Her Shipibo name is Pesin Rate which means beautiful and admirable woman with long hair. Rosa has four children, Adelina, Feliciano, Luis and Genaro, who are all part of the team at the Pachamama Temple.

     

    Maestro Feliciano Marquez Pinedo is the eldest Son of Mama Rosa. Feliciano’s Shipibo name is Kanan Betsa which means a man with a good profile and talented in business. Feliciano became very ill when he was 39. He sought out a local plant healer named Wakapoko who was able to treat him and who imparted significant knowledge of plant medicines to Feliciano. When he was recovered, he furthered his studies by completing a 9 year apprenticeship with shaman Daniel Ramos. Prior to working at the Pachamama Temple, Feliciano worked in multiple centers in the city of Tarapoto and other parts of Peru.

     

    Luis Piñedo aka Soi Sani, in Shipibo, which means wonderful, sociable and friendly man. Luis is an influential healer and a teacher in Pucallpa, Peru. With 10 years of training as an Onanya, Luis has also spent 25 years teaching in schools and universities. Luis has served as Principal in Santa Elisa, Pedagogic Director of the public Bilingual Institute in Yarinacocha, and as a Teacher Training Specialist at the University of the Peruvian Amazon.

     

    Genaro aka Ronin Mano in Shipibo, which means, “invisible man with the strength and power of the anaconda.” Having almost lost his leg due to a bike accident, and told by doctors his leg would have to be amputated, Mama Rosa and his brother Feliciano wouldn’t allow it, and decided they would heal him instead. A doctor told them that Genaro would die this way, therefore leaving Mama Rosa and Feliciano responsible for his death. They spent over one year healing Genaro’s leg through ceremonies and rituals that would put Mama Rosa’s mastery to the test. Genaro had to go through many master plant diets himself to engage with the healing process. Through this process, he became a trainee Onanya and healer, passing on his gratitude and healing hundreds of people since.

     

    Maestro Gilberto Picota Lopez is is married to Maestra Rosa’s only daughter Adeline. Maestro Gilberto’s Shipibo name is Sina Nima, which means a serious and positive man. Gilberto’s father was a healer since the age of 12 and practiced the ways of the Onanya for over 66 years, healing many people of numerous different diseases.

     

    Director

     

      Paris Tume has been filming for over 10 years, working across a spectrum of productions in television, documentaries, commercials and short films. Paris has an eye for delivering the message at hand, giving others the opportunity to express real stories and real issues in creating a new awareness and perspective. Paris’ work has earned accolades for his short films at film festivals. He has also worked on programs for the BBC, Channel 4, ITV and MTV.  After spending four years travelling across five continents in search of new experiences and projects; his journey took him to the Amazon Rainforest where he would discover the story of the Marquez-Piñedo Family. It was clear that this was the project he had been looking for. A project that protects the past, present and future of an indigenous community whose knowledge can help people around the world.

      Please like and share the social media pages to spread this campaign to as many people as possible:

      https://www.facebook.com/onanyathefilm

      https://www.instagram.com/onanyathefilm

      Whilst we have secured quotes from many contractors, if you would like to offer your services voluntarily, or discounted in the areas of Sound Design, Music Score, Visual effects, Marketing or Distribution please email us: onanyathefilm@gmail.com

story:
ANTINO-WHO?

Antinous was the lover of the Roman Emperor Hadrian, and -upon his death by drowning in the Nile- was deified, as was custom in Egypt in those days.  The cultus started by his beloved Hadrian lasted for centuries.  We of the Náos Antínoou: A Temple of Antinous are a syncretist reconstructionist community, and we revived the cultus to Antinous as He relates to our LGBTQ+ community in these modern times. 

The Náos provides space for practicing devotion to Antinous, participation in His Sacred Mysteries, and together we seek the promotion of social and spiritual justice.

Visit our website or our Náos FB Page for more information.

ANTINO-WHAT?

We offer this dedicated Temple space at Pantheacon to the larger community, where we will practice regular Devotionals to the Gods, provide a safe space for LGBTQ+ people to meet in friendship and kinship, and will offer opportunities for participating in Rites of Passage for Transformation, Affirmation, and Healing.  

We invite folks to bring statues and images of their Queer and Queer-friendly Gods, and of their Beloved and Mighty Dead, to share in the cultus during the weekend.  ALL GODS AND DIVINE BEINGS ARE WELCOME TO PARTY WITH ANTINOUS!  All personal items must be picked up by Sunday night.  

Schedule of rites and devotionals to be announced at the convention. The Naos is open to devotees of all genders and sexualities.  Check out the FAQ for more information on all this.

ANTINO-WHY? 

As part of our regular practice, during our Rituals we always do a Divination, and sometimes we even engage in Oracular / Possession Work.  In the past year, a few of us have received strong, unmistakable, and repeated instructions from our Beautiful Boy (Antinous) to make His blessings, divine healing, and acceptance available to more people in the Pagan / Polytheist LGBTQ+  world.  To this end, we decided to begin with the largest gathering of our kin at PantheaCon 2019.  We are grateful to the organizers for accepting our proposal.

We are a small Temple, and do not seek to profit from any of our events and rituals.  We intend to offer this Temple as a labour of love and devotion to Antinous.  Alas, as a small group who never charges for rituals and does not receive tithes, our resources are limited. Hence, we seek the assistance of our LGBTQ+ kin, and of all Polytheists who might be inclined to support this all-inclusive space.

ANTINO-GOAL $1500

  • Our goal of $1500 is to offset as much as possible the costs we expect to incur for the Hospitality Temple.
  • Your donations will go to the cost of the room; the food and other supplies for sacred offerings; the welcome snacks and beverages for our visitors; the pamphlets and other informational materials; the badge ribbons; the mailing costs for some of the perks;  the gas for the extra car we are bringing to carry the Temple furnishings; as well as take into consideration Indiegogo's fees and 6 month reserve. 
  • All the perks are made / donated by us, or by our friends and supporters.  We want to provide healthy snacks, offerings to the Gods for visitors to worship and devote to the Gods, as well as a nurturing atmosphere.

ANTINO-STRETCH $ 2000

  • This stretch goal would enable the Temple to purchase official stoles for our Mystai, Mystagogue, and Temple Assistants (our Priesthood titles), with Antinous' symbols on it, embroidered by a friendly local Pagan merchant. The cost for these will be around $35-45 each, and we currently need ten.
  • Our stretch goal would also help cover some of our Temple Initiates' travel costs from WA to CA, and lighten their burden if possible.  As most people, we are all on fairly limited income, and anything helps.

ANTINO-PERKS

We want to make sure that you, our contributing Temple-Raiser, feels appreciated.  We have sourced some small perks from our merry band of Temple members and friends, and we hope they will feed your soul as you feed Antinous with your offerings. 

  • Each item will be charged by Temple Initiates with Antinous' blessings of Healing and Acceptance at one of our local PNW Temple Rituals in the upcoming weeks
  • Items can be picked-up at PantheaCon, locally, or will be mailed right after the fundraiser closes, so end of March 2019, except for custom paintings (April 2019)
  • Here is the full list, with a bit more info about specific ones:
  • ANTINOUS' BLESSINGS CHANT - $1 & UP- unlimited  (included in all other perks) 
  • WEBSITE / FB PAGE THANK YOU - $ 1 & UP - unlimited (included in all other perks)
  • POETRY BOOKMARKS by Owenuma - $ 2 - 26 available
    Owenuma (own-yu-may) 'Walks with The Thunder Spirits', is a Canadian Indigenouos (Plains Cree) artist and writer / poet. He has earned a Bachelor Degree of Fine Arts at University of Lethbridge, Alberta, and is currently pursuing his Master's.  His art has been exhibited in Indigenous museums & art galleries, and he was the recipient of the Provincial Fine Arts & Language award, British Columbia, 2012.
    His writings are heavily influenced by his experience being raised by his mother in their nurturing Native culture, with all that THAT entails, and his love of Nature and the Universe.  Owenuma is now the 8th generation Medicinekeeper in his lineage.
    He believes in the resilience of his People and all humans, and hopes to influence younger people to continue to grow, fight for what is right, and to honor all life on earth.  These bookmarks showcase a bit of his wordsmithing and his inspiring beliefs.  
    His work is sold at the Muskwa Gallery, owned by his mother Che Che in Hope, B.C., and you can find Owenuma here on Instagram, & Wordpress.  We are grateful for his participation and generosity in our fundraiser. 
  • LOTUS LINOCUT PRINT - $5 - 10 available
    These are printed individually by Mystagogue Jay, from a linocut designed & consecrated to Antinous.  Black ink on linen-coloured thick cardstock, approximately 5" x 5" 
  • EXCLUSIVE TEMPLE BACKER RIBBON - $5 - 5 available (included with all $10+ perks)
    Yes, we fully intended the innuendo with this one, of course!  #BeautifulBoyBacker on line 1, and "I Helped Erect HIs Temple" on line 2.  Limited edition, so they go to the FIRST 90 backers who donate $10+ (plus the 5 who purchase this perk only)
  • PERSONALIZED CHANTED ROSARY - $5 - unlimited available
    According to the Náos' practice, we shall chant a rosary with blessings for you & yours / for a specific Intent, as you wish.  We will contact you for that info.  More information on the specifics HERE, including a sample recording.  If you wish, we can digitally record & send you our session for you. 
  • COMMUNAL CHANTED NOVENA - $10 - unlimited available
    According to the Náos' practice, we shall chant a rosary with blessings for you & yours / for a specific Intent, as you wish.  We will contact you for that info.  Specifically, a NOVENA is a rosary /prayer chanting performed on nine consecutive days, to strengthen the message and our requests to the Gods.   While each Backer shall be mentioned individually, the Novena for Backers at this Perk Level  shall be chanted for all at the same time.  More information on the specifics HERE, including a sample recording.  If you wish, we can digitally record & send you our session for you. 
  • LOTUS / APIS BULL LINOCUT PRINT - $10 - 3 available
    Titled "Apis Bull & Lotus Rising", these are printed individually by Mystagogue Jay, from a linocut designed & consecrated to Antinous for the Megala Antinoeia, His Sacred Games, in 2017.  Black ink on linen-coloured thick cardstock, approximately 5" x 7", suitable for framing.  A stylish addition to any Apis or Antinous shrine / altar.
  • "OUR TRUTH" POETRY BOOK by Owenuma - signed - $10 - 1 available
    For more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk .  
    This prose is written to inspire & encourage thinking minds to work harder on saving the planet, while anchoring themselves with the truth & light that the Earth is a sacred & beautiful place.  Accolades to all of the Warriors strong of heart who fight the noble battle of cleaning up & preserving the Earth!  Owenuma wishes to challenge the youth of today to honour all life on Earth, especially to honour themselves as a sacred part of the life on Earth.  In doing that, there is hope for the generations to come.
  • "TRIPTEK POETRY" BOOK by Owenuma, Che Che, & Whistling Wind - signed by all authors - $10 - 2 available.  For more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk.
    This  book combines the inspired writings of 3 unique Cree Native authors, related by blood & bonded in Spirit.  Traditionally, Cree are taught many 'Triads of Power'.  This is a triad of Vision, Love, and Passion.  It is their desire to change the world around us by sharing inspired thoughts which provoke action for a more secure and healthful future.  Dedicated in honor to past, present, and future Warrior Poets.
  • "OPEN THE DOOR" POETRY BOOK by Owenuma - signed - $10 - 2 available
    For more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk. 
    With "Open The Door", Owenuma furthered his poetry skills, allowing his poems to register their individual messages & meaning more effectively.  This was an exercise about self-positivity, and coming into his Higher Light, while finding a balance between a healthy ego and self-confidence. 
  • ANTINOUS RITUAL OIL, BLESSED, AMBER BOTTLES 0.7 OZ - $12 - 7 available
    This is crafted exclusively for the Náos by our Mystai Ceinan, a PNW Clinical Herbalist, Aromatherapist, and Wildcrafter.  An Antinous-inspired devotional blended oil of organic, fairly-traded, ethically-sourced Essential Oils in EVOO base. 0.7 OZ in amber glass bottles with Euro-dropper.  We use this oil for anointing ourselves, Antinous' statue, & sacred items during our Rituals & Devotionals. Lightly scented enough to be worn as a delicate divine perfume, it is powerful enough for any Magical / Ritual use where you wish to invoke Love of and for Self, the blessings of Antinous and your Queer Ancestors, and the Spirit of all that is Divine in your particular Practice.
  • "STILL I RISE" LOTUS BRACELETS - $15 - 11 available
  • HAND DIPPED 6" PURE BAYBERRY WAX CANDLE PAIRS - $15 - 15 available
    These pairs of hand-dipped 6" tapers are crafted by our Mystai Ceinan from ethically harvested East Coast berries.  Pure Bayberry wax candles produce a bright light, minimal smoke, and a delicate hearbal aroma owing to their finest quality.   It takes 15 pounds of berries to produce a single pound of wax, making bayberry wax one of the costliests and cherished waxes. Traditionally, Bayberry candles have been used since Colonial times as harbingers of success, good luck, full pantries, and health.  A traditional rhyme says "A bayberry candle burned to the socket, will bring joy to the heart, food to the larder, and gold to the pocket."   Use for any ritual where you call for success and positive outcomes.
    More on Bayberry candles HERE.
  • NEW - ADDED 5 Feb - BOOK "QUEER MAGIC - BEYOND POWER BOUNDARIES" - $20 - 10 Available

  • From the Publishers: "A rare text highlighting intersectional LGBTQIA+ spirituality 
    In a wide variety of pagan paths, many forms of modern magic and mystery hold an expectation that all parties are heterosexual, cisgender, and, in many cases, white. In Queer Magic: Power Beyond Boundaries, Lee Harrington and Tai Fenix Kulystin bring together a diverse and passionate collection of authors and artists who break out beyond that belief and explore how being LGBT+ is not just acceptable when exploring magic, but powerful. Using the diverse tools of queer activism, education, and storytelling, through academic essays and first-person narratives to comics and poster-style art, this intersectional group exposes a world beyond what so many magical practitioners have presumed is "normal."
    And here is a REVIEW on Gods & Radicals.  Don't miss a chance to get this fabulous compilation book, while helping a good cause! 


     
  • CHANTED NOVENA, INDIVIDUALIZED - $25 - unlimited available
    According to the Náos' practice, we shall chant a rosary with blessings for you & yours / for a specific Intent, as you wish.  We will contact you for that info.  Specifically, a NOVENA is a rosary /prayer chanting performed on nine consecutive days, to strengthen the message and our requests to the Gods.  At this Perk Level, the Novena will be chanted with full Intent and Focus on you and your desired blessing alone.  More information on the specifics HERE, including a sample recording.  If you wish, we can digitally record & send you our session for you. 
  • ROMANIAN CRYSTAL & GOLD BOWL - $25 - 1 AVAILABLE
  • ANTINOUS RITUAL OIL, RED HEART BOTTLE, 2 OZ - $30 - 1 available
    A larger size of the oi offered above.     This is crafted exclusively for the Náos by our Mystai Ceinan, a PNW Clinical Herbalist, Aromatherapist, and Wildcrafter.  An Antinous-inspired devotional blended oil of organic, fairly-traded, ethically-sourced Essential Oils in EVOO base. 0.7 OZ in amber glass bottles with Euro-dropper.  We use this oil for anointing ourselves, Antinous' statue, & sacred items during our Rituals & Devotionals. Lightly scented enough to be worn as a delicate divine perfume, it is powerful enough for any Magical / Ritual use where you wish to invoke Love of and for Self, the blessings of Antinous and your Queer Ancestors, and the Spirit of all that is Divine in your particular Practice.
  • EGYPTIAN-STYLE CUSTOM PAINTED WOOD PANEL - 23.5" x 5.5" - $40 - 1 available Mystai Ceinan will paint you a panel on very smooth poplar plywood, suitable for framing.  The actual wood panel is 24.5" x 6.25". You will be contacted & offered a nice variety of designs to choose from, all from extant tombs or temples.   If you have a specific tomb or temple paintings or components from a few different ones (to create your own personal design), we can work with that - as long as they are from the early dynasties, where the representations were in the Egyptian figure convention, with the torso shown frontally, the head and legs from the side, such as in this example. If you wish specific hieroglyphs other than historical ones from the original (such as your name), we can do that as well, as well as  Greek & Latin, as in the example pictured in the Diorama Box Perk below.  Delivery will be by end of April 2019, or sooner, if we can begin to talk about a design soon after you purchase the perk. 
       .
     
  • ANTINOUS DAMIANA & ROSE ELIXIR, RED BOTTLE, 4 OZ - $40 - 1 available
     This exquisit elixir has been crafted exclusively for this perk by our Mystai Ceinan, a PNW Clinical Herbalist & Wildcrafter, and Melissa (Bee Priestess) of Potnia, with full magical Intent.  Yours will be the only bottle in the world!  With each sip, you will be filled with the Spirit of Antinous, Aphrodite, Demeter, Dionysus, and Potnia, the Minoan-Mycenaean "Mistress of Bees", also referred to as "The Pure Mother Bee".  Damiana to invoke your own Sacred Sexuality and Power; PNW wild roses for the sensuality modern culture so often suppresses; and local raw honey for the love of Mother Demeter for all Her human children, all infused in organic preservative grape extract.  21+ and over, local delivery only or at P-Con. 
  • ROSARY BEADS FOR THE DEAD, CONSECRATED - $50 - 1 available
    Crafted by Mystagogue Jay, these consecrated rosary beads are dedicated to prayers on behalf of our Queer Ancestors, our own Mighty & Beloved Dead. The beads are obsidian & garnet, with bone skulls & ceramic scarab spacers, red jasper finiall, & a red cotton tassel, individually knotted on waxed thread. A rosary is an ancient practice found in many religions, using beads to count prayers.
  • EGYPTIAN STYLE DIORAMA BOX - $50 - 1 available
    This 14" x 10" x 3" diorama box was crafted by Mystai Ceinan on the occasion of the 2017 Megala Antinoeia, and dedicated devotionally to Antinous at the Megala Ritual.  Painted in metallic acrylics from a repurposed wooden box, the top shows a copy of a lotus motif from a Temple, with the original blue replaced by Antinous' Red Lotus on the center triad.  Antinous' name is written in Greek & latin on the side, and in Hieroglyphs in the center, copied from His Cartouche on the Obelisk of Antinous .  Opened, the side chains keep the lid vertical, and you will find a mixed-media, three-dimensional depiction of the river Nile and the desert to the North. Local plants were used for the reeds and palms, glass tiles for stylized waves, and a glass bauble for the sun;  the sand is from her own stash of Mediterranean sand, while small accents of real clay pottery, painted lotus & fish floating and hippo wading in the water, local mosses for shrubs, and other careful details complete this devotional piece dedicated to Antinous.  This piece was one of the winners of the 2017 Megal Games contest, and has been part of many of the Festivals and Devotionals of the  Náos' PNW branch.  May it bring the blessings of Antinous and all His divine Love to they who graciously choose this Perk!
       
  • "ANTINOUS RISING" CALLIGRAPHY ARTWORK by Owenuma - $60 - 1 available
    For more info on Owenuma, please check description above under     POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk .  
    Owenuma created this custom piece exclusively for us.  The idea was to use the word 'Antinous', and transform it into a symbolic flowing river Nile, where our Beautiful Boy drowned.  Floating on the waves, is the Red Lotus, symbol of the blood spilled during the Lion Hunt.  This is the 'miracle flower' that was said to bloom from the blood of the defeated lion.   This red lotus flower represents the strength of the lion that has become the power of Antinous, and the potential for failures to transform and blossom into something more beautiful and more powerful.  The red lotus has also become one of the main symbols used by Antinoans to represent devotion to our God.
  • EGYPTIAN-STYLE CUSTOM PAINTED WOOD PANEL - 23.5" x 13.5" - $80 - 1 available
    Same as smaller panel offered above, but more than double the heighth.  Actual wood panel is 24.5" x 13.75".  For options and delivery, see above description.
  • "OPHIOLATREIA" LIMITED EDITION BOOK - $200 - 1 available
    Information from the Publisher HERE  This is a stunning offering, copy # 43 of a limited 200 run edition, found now  rarely for sale on line from $400 to over $900.  New artwork illuminating the original plates by Pacific North West artist Lis Wright-Ivec, real snakeskin spine binding, the cloth covers, and the beautiful red foil cover stamping make this a stunning example of book-binding art, enhancing this occult-classic (with added content to the original) on snake worship.  This is a rare chance to get this book at a very low cost, while supporting a great cause. 

ANTINO-RISKS

There are no risks of the Temple not happening, as a couple of us have already agreed to carry the full cost of all needed, even if we do not reach the full goal, and the room is already paid for.  Hence, we are doing this as a Flexible Funding goal, meaning we will take whatever you generously donate and use it towards the costs listed, and pay for the rest ourselves.
However, that would be a heavy responsibility and strain on our personal finances.  
Any amount we get will be helpful to offset our personal gift to Antinous and the mandate He entrusted us with.  

ANTINO-HELP!

How can YOU help?

  • CONTRIBUTE TO THE FUND, if you can and are called to, and be a modern-day Temple-builder.  Antinous' blessings on you and yours!
  • SHARE THIS FUNDRAISER on all your Social Media:  Twitter, FB, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.
    Each Share brings a few dollars more, and we appreciate your assistance in getting the word out.
  • CONTRIBUTE AT PANTHEACON: We will have a QR-code active at the Con, in case you want to contribute at the Temple directly.  We will also have a jar for those who prefer to drop a couple dollars in cash.  

  • CAN'T CONTRIBUTE NOW?  We are leaving the fundraiser up for 60 days, so it will be active for a while after PantheaCon, as we know funds are often tight as we all get ready for this grand Pagan Party.  Perhaps you will benefit from Antinous' blessings, and you might be able to help after the Con.

ANTINO-THANKS!

The members of the Náos Antínoou: A Temple of Antinous thank you, and bless all of you in the name of the Beautiful Boy:  may He bring you healing dreams, peaceful days, and loving acceptance of your magnificent selves in this world of ours.

In service to Antinous and the Gods, we remain truly grateful to you all.
Jay & Ceinan, with Merri-Todd, Duffi, Sister Krissy, Gabriel, and Otter, and all our local PNW Temple friends.
story_txt:
ANTINO-WHO?
Antinous was the lover of the Roman Emperor Hadrian, and -upon his death by drowning in the Nile- was deified, as was custom in Egypt in those days.  The cultus started by his beloved Hadrian lasted for centuries.  We of the Náos Antínoou: A Temple of Antinous are a syncretist reconstructionist community, and we revived the cultus to Antinous as He relates to our LGBTQ+ community in these modern times. 
The Náos provides space for practicing devotion to Antinous, participation in His Sacred Mysteries, and together we seek the promotion of social and spiritual justice.
Visit our website or our Náos FB Page for more information.
ANTINO-WHAT?
We offer this dedicated Temple space at Pantheacon to the larger community, where we will practice regular Devotionals to the Gods, provide a safe space for LGBTQ+ people to meet in friendship and kinship, and will offer opportunities for participating in Rites of Passage for Transformation, Affirmation, and Healing.  
We invite folks to bring statues and images of their Queer and Queer-friendly Gods, and of their Beloved and Mighty Dead, to share in the cultus during the weekend.  ALL GODS AND DIVINE BEINGS ARE WELCOME TO PARTY WITH ANTINOUS!  All personal items must be picked up by Sunday night.  
Schedule of rites and devotionals to be announced at the convention. The Naos is open to devotees of all genders and sexualities.  Check out the FAQ for more information on all this.

ANTINO-WHY? 
As part of our regular practice, during our Rituals we always do a Divination, and sometimes we even engage in Oracular / Possession Work.  In the past year, a few of us have received strong, unmistakable, and repeated instructions from our Beautiful Boy (Antinous) to make His blessings, divine healing, and acceptance available to more people in the Pagan / Polytheist LGBTQ+  world.  To this end, we decided to begin with the largest gathering of our kin at PantheaCon 2019.  We are grateful to the organizers for accepting our proposal.We are a small Temple, and do not seek to profit from any of our events and rituals.  We intend to offer this Temple as a labour of love and devotion to Antinous.  Alas, as a small group who never charges for rituals and does not receive tithes, our resources are limited. Hence, we seek the assistance of our LGBTQ+ kin, and of all Polytheists who might be inclined to support this all-inclusive space.
ANTINO-GOAL $1500

Our goal of $1500 is to offset as much as possible the costs we expect to incur for the Hospitality Temple.
Your donations will go to the cost of the room; the food and other supplies for sacred offerings; the welcome snacks and beverages for our visitors; the pamphlets and other informational materials; the badge ribbons; the mailing costs for some of the perks;  the gas for the extra car we are bringing to carry the Temple furnishings; as well as take into consideration Indiegogo's fees and 6 month reserve. 
All the perks are made / donated by us, or by our friends and supporters.  We want to provide healthy snacks, offerings to the Gods for visitors to worship and devote to the Gods, as well as a nurturing atmosphere.

ANTINO-STRETCH $ 2000

This stretch goal would enable the Temple to purchase official stoles for our Mystai, Mystagogue, and Temple Assistants (our Priesthood titles), with Antinous' symbols on it, embroidered by a friendly local Pagan merchant. The cost for these will be around $35-45 each, and we currently need ten.
Our stretch goal would also help cover some of our Temple Initiates' travel costs from WA to CA, and lighten their burden if possible.  As most people, we are all on fairly limited income, and anything helps.

ANTINO-PERKS
We want to make sure that you, our contributing Temple-Raiser, feels appreciated.  We have sourced some small perks from our merry band of Temple members and friends, and we hope they will feed your soul as you feed Antinous with your offerings. 

Each item will be charged by Temple Initiates with Antinous' blessings of Healing and Acceptance at one of our local PNW Temple Rituals in the upcoming weeks
Items can be picked-up at PantheaCon, locally, or will be mailed right after the fundraiser closes, so end of March 2019, except for custom paintings (April 2019)
Here is the full list, with a bit more info about specific ones:
ANTINOUS' BLESSINGS CHANT - $1 & UP- unlimited  (included in all other perks) 
WEBSITE / FB PAGE THANK YOU - $ 1 & UP - unlimited (included in all other perks)

POETRY BOOKMARKS by Owenuma - $ 2 - 26 availableOwenuma (own-yu-may) 'Walks with The Thunder Spirits', is a Canadian Indigenouos (Plains Cree) artist and writer / poet. He has earned a Bachelor Degree of Fine Arts at University of Lethbridge, Alberta, and is currently pursuing his Master's.  His art has been exhibited in Indigenous museums & art galleries, and he was the recipient of the Provincial Fine Arts & Language award, British Columbia, 2012.His writings are heavily influenced by his experience being raised by his mother in their nurturing Native culture, with all that THAT entails, and his love of Nature and the Universe.  Owenuma is now the 8th generation Medicinekeeper in his lineage.He believes in the resilience of his People and all humans, and hopes to influence younger people to continue to grow, fight for what is right, and to honor all life on earth.  These bookmarks showcase a bit of his wordsmithing and his inspiring beliefs.  His work is sold at the Muskwa Gallery, owned by his mother Che Che in Hope, B.C., and you can find Owenuma here on Instagram, & Wordpress.  We are grateful for his participation and generosity in our fundraiser. 

LOTUS LINOCUT PRINT - $5 - 10 availableThese are printed individually by Mystagogue Jay, from a linocut designed & consecrated to Antinous.  Black ink on linen-coloured thick cardstock, approximately 5" x 5" 

EXCLUSIVE TEMPLE BACKER RIBBON - $5 - 5 available (included with all $10+ perks)Yes, we fully intended the innuendo with this one, of course!  #BeautifulBoyBacker on line 1, and "I Helped Erect HIs Temple" on line 2.  Limited edition, so they go to the FIRST 90 backers who donate $10+ (plus the 5 who purchase this perk only)

PERSONALIZED CHANTED ROSARY - $5 - unlimited availableAccording to the Náos' practice, we shall chant a rosary with blessings for you & yours / for a specific Intent, as you wish.  We will contact you for that info.  More information on the specifics HERE, including a sample recording.  If you wish, we can digitally record & send you our session for you. 

COMMUNAL CHANTED NOVENA - $10 - unlimited availableAccording to the Náos' practice, we shall chant a rosary with blessings for you & yours / for a specific Intent, as you wish.  We will contact you for that info.  Specifically, a NOVENA is a rosary /prayer chanting performed on nine consecutive days, to strengthen the message and our requests to the Gods.   While each Backer shall be mentioned individually, the Novena for Backers at this Perk Level  shall be chanted for all at the same time.  More information on the specifics HERE, including a sample recording.  If you wish, we can digitally record & send you our session for you. 

LOTUS / APIS BULL LINOCUT PRINT - $10 - 3 availableTitled "Apis Bull & Lotus Rising", these are printed individually by Mystagogue Jay, from a linocut designed & consecrated to Antinous for the Megala Antinoeia, His Sacred Games, in 2017.  Black ink on linen-coloured thick cardstock, approximately 5" x 7", suitable for framing.  A stylish addition to any Apis or Antinous shrine / altar.

"OUR TRUTH" POETRY BOOK by Owenuma - signed - $10 - 1 availableFor more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk .  This prose is written to inspire & encourage thinking minds to work harder on saving the planet, while anchoring themselves with the truth & light that the Earth is a sacred & beautiful place.  Accolades to all of the Warriors strong of heart who fight the noble battle of cleaning up & preserving the Earth!  Owenuma wishes to challenge the youth of today to honour all life on Earth, especially to honour themselves as a sacred part of the life on Earth.  In doing that, there is hope for the generations to come.

"TRIPTEK POETRY" BOOK by Owenuma, Che Che, & Whistling Wind - signed by all authors - $10 - 2 available.  For more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk.This  book combines the inspired writings of 3 unique Cree Native authors, related by blood & bonded in Spirit.  Traditionally, Cree are taught many 'Triads of Power'.  This is a triad of Vision, Love, and Passion.  It is their desire to change the world around us by sharing inspired thoughts which provoke action for a more secure and healthful future.  Dedicated in honor to past, present, and future Warrior Poets.

"OPEN THE DOOR" POETRY BOOK by Owenuma - signed - $10 - 2 availableFor more info on Owenuma, please check description above under POETRY BOOKMARKS Perk. With "Open The Door", Owenuma furthered his poetry skills, allowing his poems to register their individual messages & meaning more effectively.  This was an exercise about self-positivity, and coming into his Higher Light, while finding a balance between a healthy ego and self-confidence. 

ANTINOUS RITUAL OIL, BLESSED, AMBER BOTTLES 0.7 OZ - $12 - 7 availableThis is crafted exclusively for the Náos by our Mystai Ceinan, a PNW Clinical Herbalist, Aromatherapist, and Wildcrafter.  An Antinous-inspired devotional blended oil of organic, fairly-traded, ethically-sourced Essential Oils in EVOO base. 0.7 OZ in amber glass bottles with Euro-dropper.  We use this oil for anointing ourselves, Antinous' statue, & sacred items during our Rituals & Devotionals. Lightly scented enough to be worn as a delicate divine perfume, it is powerful enough for any Magical / Ritual use where you wish to invoke Love of and for Self, the blessings of Antinous and your Queer Ancestors, and the Spirit of all that is Divine in your particular Practice.
"STILL I RISE" LOTUS BRACELETS - $15 - 11 available

HAND DIPPED 6" PURE BAYBERRY WAX CANDLE PAIRS - $15 - 15 availableThese pairs of hand-dipped 6" tapers are crafted by our Mystai Ceinan from ethically harvested East Coast berries.  Pure Bayberry wax candles produce a bright light, minimal smoke, and a delicate hearbal aroma owing to their finest quality.   It takes 15 pounds of berries to produce a single pound of wax, making bayberry wax one of the costliests and cherished waxes. Traditionally, Bayberry candles have been used since Colonial times as harbingers of success, good luck, full pantries, and health.  A traditional rhyme says "A bayberry candle burned to the socket, will bring joy to the heart, food to the larder, and gold to the pocket."   Use for any ritual where you call for success and positive outcomes.More on Bayberry candles HERE.

NEW - ADDED 5 Feb - BOOK "QUEER MAGIC - BEYOND POWER BOUNDARIES" - $20 - 10 Available

From the Publishers: "A rare text highlighting intersectional LGBTQIA+ spirituality In a wide variety of pagan paths, many forms of modern magic and mystery hold an expectation that all parties are heterosexual, cisgender, and, in many cases, white. In Queer Magic: Power Beyond Boundaries, Lee Harrington and Tai Fenix Kulystin bring together a diverse and passionate collection of authors and artists who break out beyond that belief and explore how being LGBT+ is not just acceptable when exploring magic, but powerful. Using the diverse tools of queer activism, education, and storytelling, through academic essays and first-person narratives to comics and poster-style art, this intersectional group exposes a world beyond what so many magical practitioners have presumed is "normal."And here is a REVIEW on Gods & Radicals.  Don't miss a chance to get this fabulous compilation book, while helping a good cause!

ROMANIAN CRYSTAL & GOLD BOWL - $25 - 1 AVAILABLE

ANTINOUS RITUAL OIL, RED HEART BOTTLE, 2 OZ - $30 - 1 availableA larger size of the oi offered above. This is crafted exclusively for the Náos by our Mystai Ceinan, a PNW Clinical Herbalist, Aromatherapist, and Wildcrafter.  An Antinous-inspired devotional blended oil of organic, fairly-traded, ethically-sourced Essential Oils in EVOO base. 0.7 OZ in amber glass bottles with Euro-dropper.  We use this oil for anointing ourselves, Antinous' statue, & sacred items during our Rituals & Devotionals. story:
The Fundación Red de Escuelas de Música del Caribe, is a non-governmental organization (NGO) that promotes the teaching of music as a tool for the creation of protective environments for children and youth of the Colombian Caribbean.


We are convinced that music can transform lives through artistic processes framed in references of healthy coexistence between us and the environment.


This campaign is focused on acquiring the basic elements for the initiation process of a group of 50 children of limited resources, who will continue in the process of formation for the creation of symphony orchestras. In addition to this, children and young people will have psychosocial support, exchange with other positive experiences, spaces for the formation of values and care for the environment.


With this USD 5,000, we will be able to adapt the spaces for teaching and acquisition of the initial instruments such as: Guitars, keyboards, flutes, tambourines, trinkets, guacharacas, maracas, Chinese boxes, keys, bells, among others.

The musical initiation is the basis on which students build the fundamental elements of music, children and young people have the opportunity to develop their gross motor skills based on rhythm, tuning and teamwork, element of coexistence and mutual help.

Our music schools offer the unique opportunity to start the path of music with a view to belonging to a youth symphony orchestra, all step by step, with teachers who seek to make children and young artists integral, all under an environment of protective environments that we achieved with the help of a team of social psychologists, who integrate the processes of children and youth with the community.


The Red de Escuelas de Música del Caribe is an instrument of life, peace and protection.
 

The advantage of this process is that regardless of the money raised, the first phase of the process will begin with the initiation fund and the human resource - teachers committed to the children and youth of the Colombian Caribbean.


The Foundation has different alliances that accompany the process as well as excellent professionals at its management, which ensures that the process will be carried out with great professionalism and commitment on the part of all those who are part of this cause. Reason why the obstacles that are presented will be able to be overcome with the support of all.
Because it is a social process, the community is integrated to this, adding to the fulfillment of the objectives of the Network. In addition, the program is designed to carry out the process in phases, which facilitates us to obtain the resources for the execution of each one of them. you are step by step and without careers.


In the construction of these spaces we can transform lives, environments and support in the construction of a country.


If you do not have the financial resources to support us in this campaign, you can contribute by spreading the word so that the information reaches all corners of the planet earth. Additionally you can visit us on our website: www.redemusicaribe.org and donate instruments, teaching materials, equipment, ideas, knowledge, etc.
story_txt:
The Fundación Red de Escuelas de Música del Caribe, is a non-governmental organization (NGO) that promotes the teaching of music as a tool for the creation of protective environments for children and youth of the Colombian Caribbean.

We are convinced that music can transform lives through artistic processes framed in references of healthy coexistence between us and the environment.

This campaign is focused on acquiring the basic elements for the initiation process of a group of 50 children of limited resources, who will continue in the process of formation for the creation of symphony orchestras. In addition to this, children and young people will have psychosocial support, exchange with other positive experiences, spaces for the formation of values and care for the environment.
With this USD 5,000, we will be able to adapt the spaces for teaching and acquisition of the initial instruments such as: Guitars, keyboards, flutes, tambourines, trinkets, guacharacas, maracas, Chinese boxes, keys, bells, among others.
The musical initiation is the basis on which students build the fundamental elements of music, children and young people have the opportunity to develop their gross motor skills based on rhythm, tuning and teamwork, element of coexistence and mutual help.
Our music schools offer the unique opportunity to start the path of music with a view to belonging to a youth symphony orchestra, all step by step, with teachers who seek to make children and young artists integral, all under an environment of protective environments that we achieved with the help of a team of social psychologists, who integrate the processes of children and youth with the community.

The Red de Escuelas de Música del Caribe is an instrument of life, peace and protection. 
The advantage of this process is that regardless of the money raised, the first phase of the process will begin with the initiation fund and the human resource - teachers committed to the children and youth of the Colombian Caribbean.
The Foundation has different alliances that accompany the process as well as excellent professionals at its management, which ensures that the process will be carried out with great professionalism and commitment on the part of all those who are part of this cause. Reason why the obstacles that are presented will be able to be overcome with the support of all.Because it is a social process, the community is integrated to this, adding to the fulfillment of the objectives of the Network. story:
The Emerald Temple

Subject to evolve, The Emerald Temple is the loving nickname we have given to the new PeerAmid Creative Studios Headquarters. This 1940s Phoenix home turned office space features 10 rooms, including a basement, a classroom, a recording studio, and a kitchenette.

We will be transforming this space to play host to a storefront, a community co-working and learning center, healing space, and a production studio.

The building was updated in 2017, so most of the changes we need to make will just be to build some workspaces and add on to the studio and kitchenette.

We need your help.

With a powerful concept comes a diverse set of needs. We serve multiple communities, and wish to do our absolute best to facilitate their absolute best.

PeerAmid Creative Studios is a community business, a social enterprise. As such, we feel it is absolutely essential to get our community involved right from the start.

Rather than taking on an investment team that becomes a board of directors seeking to elevate our profit margins, our goal is to keep the interests of the members we serve as our focal point, with the understanding that we will all prosper together.

The more we raise through this campaign, the more value we can offer right off the bat to our community members.

story:
Liberation Route Europe's Hiking Trail 

A sustainable, transnational memorial for future generations

Stretching from London to Berlin, the Liberation Route Europe's hiking trail will cross five countries with connecting branch trails, including future components in Canada and the United States. The trail will pass numerous historical locations that were important during the last phase of World War II, tracing the footsteps of the troops and telling their stories.

Developed by the Liberation Route Europe Foundation, the trail will promote awareness, reflection, and most importantly will inspire a new generation to keep alive the history and sacrifice of the WWII veterans who liberated Europe. It will leave an important legacy for younger generations to use the lessons of the past and to help remember how vulnerable our freedom continues to be. Our aim is to officiallyopen this trail in May 2020, the 75th anniversary of the end of World War II. 

The creation of such a trail, which has long been a goal of the Liberation Route Europe Foundation, is becoming a reality thanks to the cooperation of our international partners, notably the Dutch hiking organization, Wandelnet, and the support of other British, French, Belgian and German hiking associations. For this trail, our foundation has collaborated with the renowned architect Daniel Libeskind and Studio Libeskind, who has designed a symbolic family of markers: the ‘VECTORS’.

The Physical Trail

Facts about the hiking trail:

  • 3000 km total length
  • 5 countries linked along the main route 
  • 250 remembrance sites
  • 3 branch routes with more in development
  • 6 main regions and storylines 

Based on historical data, the Liberation Route Europe Hiking Trail uses and connects existing long-distance hiking trails and links them together into one route. 

The route will be recognizable through special trail markers called 'Vectors', developed in collaboration with hiking associations and architect/artist Daniel Libeskind (see below).

Regions & Proposed Principal Storylines

There are six main regions and storylines along the hiking trail following the western allies advance during the final two years of the war (1944-45):

  1. Southern England:  from London to Portsmouth, where in 1944 the allies prepared for the large-scale invasion of continental Europe that became known as D-Day.
  2. Northern France:  from Normandy to Paris, where the D-Day landings and the subsequent Battle of Normandy were some of the most intense battles of the war.
  3. Belgium:  including the major cities of Mons, Brussels, and Antwerp - an important location during the crucial Battle of the Scheldt. A branch route will connect to the Ardennes, home of the infamous Battle of the Bulge during the winter of 1944-1945.
  4. The Netherlands:  passing through North-Brabant and Gelderland, locations of one of the largest airborne operations of the war - Operation Market Garden. A branch route will connect to the Dutch provinces of Zeeland and Limburg. 
  5. Western Germany:  winding through the Hürtgen Forest & the Rhineland, where the allies made the decisive push into Germany heading towards Berlin. 
  6. Berlin:  the final battle of the war in Europe where the Soviet Red Army captured the city in May 1945.

The Vectors 

We are proud of our partnership with renowned architect Daniel Libeskind for this project, who designed a special family of markers called the Vectors. Our aim is that within the next five years a Vector can be found at least every 5 kilometers of the trail. In total, there are four types of Vectors that will indicate key regions, provide directions along the trail, and detail information about places of interest.

Type #1: Remembrance Site Vector

This remembrance site Vector will introduce a region and an important story line with background information along the trail. This also marks important remembrance sites along the trail. 

​Type #​2: Crossroad Vector

The crossroad Vector will be placed at crossroads around remembrance sites to point in the direction of information spots and places of interest as well as providing background information on regions and sites. 

​Type #3: Wall Vector

The wall Vector will mark important buildings denoting details of historical interest. This could be displayed at certain partners along the trail such as museums.

Type #4: Floor Vector

The floor Vector serves as a plaque marking the direction of the trail. 

​The Online Trail

In addition to the development of the physical infrastructure including the Vectors, we are striving to create robust online tools, such as a website and mobile application (4+ languages) with four different levels of content:  

  1. General storyline: Main introduction to a region with the necessary historical background to understand the sites along the trail.
  2. Itineraries: Suggested routes based on historical themes, regions, and interests including key POI's and historical locations. 
  3. Anchor locations: POI’s or historical locations found directly on the route of the hiking trail
  4. Additional POI’s and Spots: Locations not on the actual route but able to be visited via a small detour.
  5. Biographies: Unit or personal biographies providing additional interesting information about men/women/units that were active in a specific area of the trail. 

We are also planning a series of physical travel guides and books to promote the hiking trail. 

Budget and Timeline

Though we are working closely with organizations, countries, regions, and cities to “adopt” and sponsor part of the trail, a storyline, and dedicate it to a specific country, region, veteran or organization, we are seeking your support to make this route a reality. 

Our aim is to raise the €30.000 during the course of this initial crowdfunding campaign – which breaks down to €10/kilometer of the total length of the hiking trail.

Though our target budget for this two-year program is over €3 million, this first €30.000 will ensure that we can launch this unique project in time for the 75th anniversary celebrations of the end of WWII in May 2020.

The funds raised from this campaign will go towards the project development of the route, including:

  • historical content development
  • website
  • mobile application
  • travel guides

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to help us with a financial contribution, please help us get the word out by sharing our campaign on Facebook or other social media using the Indiegogo share tools.

    For news and updates about the trail, be sure to follow us on social media @LiberationRoute

website
mobile application
travel guides


Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Popular dance has played a key role in many of the Black Lives Matter protests since June 2020, highlighting its importance in embodying expressions of grief, memory, community, hope, and social change. At the same time, many popular dance practitioners and researchers have been severely affected by the Covid-19 pandemic: forced to pivot in response to limits on physical gathering, proximity, and touch in public performance spaces.

PoP Moves, an international research network for popular dance, is crowdfunding to support popular dance artists and researchers in responding to this shifting landscape. The money you help us raise will fund a webinar on popular dance and anti-racism, a series of online workshops helping popular dance artists to develop now-necessary skills in screendance practice, and a 2022 conference about the convergence of popular dance and social justice movements.

 The webinar discussion, Popular Dance and Protest: Methodologies towards Anti-Racism, will bring together dance practitioners and scholars who are committed to social justice and anti-racism with a goal of exploring how social and popular dance movements, research, and practices can forge sustainable contributions to the formidable work on anti-racism being undertaken globally, both within and outside of academia. Thanks to the School of Arts, Media, Performance and Design at York University (Toronto, CA) for agreeing to co-sponsor this event. 

The peer-support subcommittee, consisting of PoP Moves members from across the nodes, is leading a new initiative to support screendance practice. The upcoming online series will include workshops focused on networking and skills-sharing for self-producing/DIY-makers as well as feature panels with "experts" in the field offering practical advice and considerations. 

Our 2022 conference will engage themes from preceding events and initiatives; the conference will foster discussion between scholars, dancers, and activists about the convergences of popular dance, social justice movements, and screen media in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries. If you donate over $100, you will receive a discounted registration rate for our upcoming conference.  

Lastly, a small portion of funds raised will contribute to website development and maintenance, so that the events can be publicised and archived to benefit as many practitioners and researchers as possible, both now and in the future. 

Please visit PoP Moves' website, www.popmoves.com, for more information about the network's history, development as an international group, our commitments, including our Black Lives Matter statement (https://popmoves.com/black-lives-matter/), and the many events and initiatives we've led that support popular dance research.

story:
You’re invited to the most powerful martial arts event of 2020! Join us for three-days of amazing martial arts  panel discussions and workshops that will help accelerate your martial arts training, increase your self-defense efficacy and even help grow your martial arts business.

Learn traditional, but cutting edge, indigenous tactics and techniques from Africa, the Caribbean, South America and North America. Join martial artists from around the world for unparalleled workshops and panel discussions with some of the best instructors from across the globe!

What to expect during your 3 full days at WarriorCon:

  • Workshops: Amazing on-mat training sessions with martial arts legends and experienced experts!
  • Panel Discussions: Learn from the industry’s best. Topics will cover how to grow your school, instructor teaching tactics, how to deal with human trafficking, women in the indigenous martial arts, and more!
  • Vendors: Pick up a good book on self-defense; purchase a much-needed training weapon, or DVD; enjoy some great food, or get a cool new uniform. There will be several vendors at WarriorCon with something you are sure to want, need, or love.
  • Networking: You will have a great opportunity to network with many vendors, instructor,  peers, and speakers throughout the weekend and expand your reach within the martial arts community.
  • Cultural Enrichment: Learn the customs, standards, techniques, tactics and experiences of warriors from indigenous cultures around the world to which you may not have ever been exposed.

Needs

In order to give you the best conference possible, we will need $25,000.00, broken down as follows:

  • $800.00 for rental of the venue—Courtyard Marriot; 2 meeting rooms.
  • $3600.00 for room rental for Guests of Honor and Special Guests.
  • $3000.00 for travel expenses for Guests of Honor and Special Guests.
  • $1200.00 for design and printing of flyers, schedules and souvenir books.
  • $1800.00 for eating expenses for Guests of Honor and Special Guests.
  • $2000.00 for 2 Massage Therapists.
  • $2200.00 for event caterer.
  • $1500.00 for website.
  • $600.00 for photographer.
  • $900.00 for videographer.
  • $300.00 Wi-Fi booster.
  • $1000.00 audio rental.
  • $500.00 insurance.
  • $2500.00 marketing and advertising.
  • $1830.00 rental of three 15-passenger vans.
  • 1,270 for miscellaneous and incidentals.

However, if we do not make all our funds, we will still allocate the money that we do make using the same percentages as above and work hard to make up for the shortage through soliciting loans from friends and family. WarriorCon 2020 IS happening and this is your chance to be a part of helping us make history.

For twenty years, the Afrikan Martial Arts Institute has been bringing unique, exciting and informative martial arts classes, workshops and panel discussions to Atlanta, Georgia. Hundreds of men, women and children from around the world have been privileged to learn indigenous African martial arts, Filipino and Indonesian martial arts, Tai Chi, Jujitsu, Gun Safety, Parking Lot Safety, Self-Defense and much more from some of the best masters and experts that the Afrikan Martial Arts Institute has brought in from around the world.

On October 9-11, 2020, the Afrikan Martial Arts Institute continues - and expands on - this tradition by bringing you WarriorCon, three-days of martial arts training and cultural enrichment in a safe and serene environment.

And you won't miss any of the training due to a workshop or panel you want to participate in going on at the same time as the workshop or panel you have to participate in. WarriorCon is going to be done symposium-style, with all panels and workshops happening in one room, back-to-back, so you can participate in all panels, in all workshops and in all the fun!

Many of you will come to WarriorCon to find out what specific strategies or tactics you can implement for their protection or the protection of their loved ones. Many of you will come to learn the martial history and culture of Tire Machet, or Capoeira, or Laamb, or Kapu Kuialua. Whatever the reason,  you will find so much more. You will find inspiration. You will find community, and you will find a renewed sense of meaning in your martial arts, in your work and even your life.

Risks & Challenges

Like any major endeavor, there are always potential obstacles, like unforseen expenses and programming changes and cancellations.

As experienced program directors and producers, the team has seen these challenges before from running previous large events and know how to deal with each one head on. We have a team of veteran directors, managers, and volunteers with over 50 years of combined experience of running other large events. We do our best to forecast any and all problems and run "worst case scenarios."

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word - WarriorCon 2020 is coming to Atlanta Friday, October 9 through Sunday, October 11 and it is going to be one of the best things to happen in the martial arts world.

Shout us out on social media. Use the hashtags #WarriorCon or #WarriorCon2020. See you there!

story:
The Isle of Wight is, in spite of - or possibly as a result of its location - a place bustling with artists, writers, and musicians, in a community with many unique and often surprising facets informed by its geography and sense of displacement from the rest of the UK.

Wolverton Manor, in Shorwell, has long been a centre of cultural activity on the island, accommodating artists and musicians, from its concerts of world-class classical music to the annual Folk & Blues Festival, fostering an atmosphere of creativity that has also seen the births of locally legendary Isle of Wight punk, avant-garde and hip-hop projects.

Wolverton FM, a new community arts radio station based in the grounds of The Manor, celebrates the island's creative heritage and provides a platform for experiment and expression for the Isle of Wight, through DJ radio shows, documentaries, radioplays, sound installations, field recordings, live sessions and talk radio. We aim to bring the best of international underground culture to the Isle of Wight, and bring the work of Isle of Wight artists, activists and writers to the world.

Since launching on October 1st Wolverton FM has featured programmes by artists from the Isle of Wight and all around the world. Regular audio treats include shows on the international songwriting underground by Pete Murphy & David Graham, magical transmissions from Australia from sound-artist Jon Panther,  Isle of Wight Walks with Pauline Stirling, sound-collage and mashed-up mambo from Albuquerque's great collagist The Superfools, USA collage author Tom Comitta's "The Nature Book", Portsmouth's Cantando Female Voice Choir, and a feature on the island's legendary magician David Randini. 

Our station is unusual in that we have a particular focus on radio drama, poetry and hoerspiel. Productions in the last fortnight have included an adaptation of an 1854 Punch & Judy script, Rotterdam's Dr Klangendum Radio failing at Beckett's At That Fall, an Oulipo N+13 version of Shakespeare, experimental durational radioplays made from Youtube comments and Amazon reviews, and a KAOS Pad version of Kurt Schwitter's Ursonate.

We have also been running regular programming using experimental radio techniques to reflect on the history of the Isle of Wight, with ambient-historical radio collages about the poet David Gascoyne, Lewis Carroll's visits to Sandown Beach, Alfred Lord Tennyson, and the community that centred around Julia Margaret Cameron at Dimbola Lodge. Also coming soon is the entirety of the audio recordings of the 2016 full, continuous 12-day, 1445-person reading of the Chilcot Report at Edinburgh Fringe.

Wolverton FM is run by autistic and trans artists, and is developing a large body of programming dedicated to neurodiversity advocacy. The station is home to activist and political content that reflects upon the current socio-economic climate, through an attitude that is inclusive, and is challenging to the status quo.

The project is headed by AVANTHARDCOLLECTIVE, which is comprised of island native Lottie Depresstival Bowater - a classical pianist, accordionist and songwriter, multidisciplinary artist/filmmaker and philosophy nerd. Lottie was part of the winning team of the Edinburgh Festival Panel Prize 2016 for "Iraq out and Loud", and is curator of the long running London avant-garde multidisciplinary arts event "Depresstival Presents". Also running the project is Ergo Phizmiz - an artist, radio playwright, composer and opera maker, who has a long association with the Isle of Wight. Both artists recently collaborated with the Cleveland Symphony Orchestra on their production of R. Strauss' opera "Ariadne auf Naxos", which received Critic's Pick in the New York Times.

Wolverton FM are looking for funds to help with running costs, insurance, data storage, and spreading-the-word. Although we have the basic equipment to run the station, much of it has been professionally used for years and is old and in need of some TLC.

We are setting up a series of regular Radio Clubs around the island in which the public can join in high-quality workshops of experimental approaches to making radio, in collaboration with local artists and visiting practitioners, so consequently need to cover venue costs, marketing and travel-costs for these.

Wolverton FM is also home to a lovely family of analogue synthesisers and electronic music making machines, and we aim to become a centre for the development of new electronic and computer composition.

As shortwave and ham-radio enthusiasts we intend to run a series of workshops in building shortwave radios for island residents. We would like to, within the next year and a half, be able to transmit broadcasts on shortwave. Since shortwave is the original means for broadcasting, and the science and art of radio communication was actually BORN in the west-wight, with the first ever radio experiment being broadcast by Guglieimo Marconi from Alum Bay, naturally, we feel we want to continue the lineage of experimental radio broadcasting.  This basically makes us Marconi and YOU Queen Victoria. How about that? 

Also, in a time when vast swathes of media and art are diluted through restrictions from corporate interests and commodification of absolutely everything, we believe that radio is potentially the last surviving means of broadcasting that is unfiltered and untarnished by the limitations of mainstream communications languages and media industries.  

Radio is the medium in which the imagination has no limits. There is no reason why one scene of your drama should not take place in Bradford and the next scene on the moon: the budget is the same to go to either of these places on radio, making radio a truly democratic medium that, in a time when a large section of people have access to some kind of recording and editing equipment, we should be using to try to reshape our world and reimagine a better one.

Wolverton FM are a not-for-profit Community Interest Company. We are open to all proposals for radio material and collaborations. 

In return for your support we have lots of perks, ranging from badges and stickers, a quarterly fanzine-and-cd compilation of choice cuts of our programming; music releases, artwork, cartooning and original collages; to private gigs, and full audio-productions on subjects of your choosing. 

Listen to Wolverton FM at http://wolvertonfm.hotglue.me

Catch up on a selection of our previous broadcasts at http://www.mixcloud.com/wolvertonfm

story:
The Grand Lady

A space that combines history, nature, and beauty to offer couples an unforgettable setting for celebrating their devotion with those they love. 

www.grandladyaustin.com

About: 

Ever since my own wedding, it has been a dream of mine to create a unique and beautiful space for couples to share their love with each other and those around them. The Grand Lady will offer that and more by immersing guests in beauty, nature, and love to make their special moment truly unforgettable. 

The mansion on the property, named The Grand Lady, has a rich history that has all the qualities of a love story. Originally built in 1881, The Grand Lady was a wedding present to Mr. and Mrs. William Wallace Walton from her father. The original mansion was Victorian in style featuring beautiful stained glass windows throughout and a signature keyhole stained glass window -- all of which still exist today. In 1912, the family renovated the mansion to welcome their first child and added a second story and many of its current colonial elements, including solid oak woodwork with beautiful, eye-catching custom-milled details. With so many joy-filled memories already embedded into its history, the mansion radiates a presence of love and grandeur to any guest that enters. 

The 20-acre property is located just 30 minutes east of Austin and will feature sprawling oak trees, beautiful Texas scenery, a 4,500 sq. ft. event space and the freshly renovated Grand Lady herself. These elements will combine to provide guests with a private, yet spacious setting to bring all their loved ones together and make the memories that will last a lifetime. 

Currently, the site has great potential. The mansion sits at the center of the property surrounded by lush oak trees, but there’s still a lot of work to be done for the The Grand Lady to fully realize its vision. Once renovated, the mansion will have four bedrooms and include a bridal suite and grooms lounge. There are also plans to build the 4,500 sq. ft. venue by fall of 2020 to offer guests a uniquely beautiful space for the reception and ceremony. 

Your investment will help us with the following:

Following the green standard: During every phase of renovation and construction, we’ll be aiming to adhere to and uphold sustainable, green design principles. This will include using native plants that require less water and planning for solar panels to conserve energy among various other things. While more expensive in the short-term, we are passionate about reducing the carbon footprint of our establishment to do our part in maintaining the environment. Your donations will ensure we can be as green as possible every step of the way. 

Fulfilling the Landscaping Vision: Franny Peterson and Kevin Sullivan are currently working as the project’s interior and landscape designers. Not only are they great friends, they are talented designers, we are fully committed to fulfilling their vision for the property. Supporting this project means supporting the work of talented designers who you know and love.

Restoration of the mansion: The mansion needs a lot of work to get to where it needs to be - including fresh coats of paint, floor restoration, bringing the upstairs balcony up to code and extending the downstairs balcony, among other things. To maintain the love and care that it has been shown over the years, but also breathe new life into the space, we have been working through a massive restoration of the space that will modernize and maintain The Grand Lady for years to come. 

Risks and Challenges

Anyone who has known katie in the last 10 years, knows full well her commitment and dream to build a place exactly like The Grand Lady. And while she’s modeled every possible scenario, and run every situation through excel twice, any business venture is a risk. Any support of this project makes it’s fulfillment that much more possible. At the end of the day, renovating the mansion, maintaining the grounds, and launching the business require an extraordinary amount of effort and money.

story:
FRANÇAIS

 

Bref résumé

  •  La convention est organisée par notre association à but non-lucratif, Brolvétique.
  •  La Suisse Pony's Con 2 est notre projet phare et surtout un travail colossal mais qui nous donne beaucoup de plaisir.
  • En nous aidant avec quelques dons, vous nous donnerez l'occasion d'offrir un résultat de meilleur qualité.

 

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 

  •  Avec le montant fixé, qui s'élève à 1500 euros, nous pourrons louer du matériel, des installations pour un concert animé par un DJ, des bannières ou tout autre stuff exclusif à la convention.
  •  Les contreparties du financement sont uniques, vous ne les trouverez jamais ailleurs.

 

L'impact

 

  •  Notre première édition et nos nombreux meets-up (des rencontres) nous donnent l'occasion de mettre en avant notre expérience pour faire de cette deuxième année un moment inoubliable.

 Risques et défis

 

    • Nous avons réussi l'année passée, cette année nous nous donnons encore plus pour que ce projet soit digne des attentes. Le défi est grand mais en vaut la chandelle.
    •  Notre groupe est habitué aux imprévus, nous nous sommes souvent faits remarquer par notre débrouillardise et notre inventivité dans les situations les plus difficiles.

     

    D'autres façons d'aider

     

    •  Chaque action compte, parlez-en à vos amis, partagez-le site sur vos réseaux sociaux et dites vous que grâce à ça, vous nous aurez aidé :
      - Twitter
      - Site officiel

     

    ENGLISH

    short summary

     

    •  The convention is organised by the non-profit association Brolvetique.
    •  The Suisse Pony's Con 2 is our biggest project. It needs work and a lot of energy but it's lot of pleasure too.
    • By helping us with some donation, you will give us the opportunity to offer a result of higher quality.

     

    What do we need and what do you get?

     

    •  With the fixed amount of 1,500 Euros, we will be able to rent equipment, installations for a DJ showc, banners or any other stuff exclusive to the convention.
    •  The financing counterparts are unique, you will never find them somewhere else.

     

     The impact

     

    •  Our first edition and our numerous meets-up give us the opportunity to highlight our experience and make this second year an unforgettable moment.

    Risks and challenges

     

    •  We succeeded last year, this year we are getting even more involved so we can meet all expectations. The challenge is great but well worth the effort.
    •  Our group is accustomed to the unexpected, we have often been remarked by our resourcefulness and our inventiveness in the most difficult situations.

     

    Other ways to help

     

    •  Every action counts, talk to your friends, share the site on your social networks and tell yourself that thanks to this, you will have helped us.
      - Twitter
      - Site officiel
