story:
Shoofly Liberty is one of my iconic paintings expressing the concept of liberty for all. The background shoofly pattern is based on quilts used to signal safe passage on the Underground Railroad for escaping slaves. It is the image I will be using for the fine art prints offered in my perks for this campaign.
Part of my goals for a professional studio space open to the public will be to share my passion for liberty and story telling through the arts. I want to help others find their creative voice and their personal creative expressions. My apprenticeship program and workshop goals will expose more people in my community to their own creative abilities.

Short Summary

I am a stay-at-home mom actively participating in community-based and public art projects. I am a self-taught painter with a degree in illustration. Combining these talents has enabled me to tell a story through my art.

When I purchase a building, if space allows, I want to offer a common area where artists can collaborate and share ideas while they work on individual projects. I would like this public space to be central to the building with my personal studio space on one side and the artist’s individual spaces wrapping around at least two sides. The collaborative workspace would also be conducive to community art classes, cultural lectures, and artists' workshops.

I have worked with several groups over the years on a scaled-down concept of this kind. In art groups with weekly meetings, artists worked on their current projects, reserving time at the end of each session for critiques. In this way, ideas are exchanged and personal obstacles are overcome. It is always helpful to have an outside view of your art, even if you disagree with the changes suggested. Personal growth comes from understanding other points of view.

Learn more on my blog: https://libertasamericanaart.wordpress.com/2017...

What I Need & What You Get

*I am asking for $200,000 dollars with a goal of purchasing and renovating a historic building to use as a professional studio. In addition to allowing me to expand my business as an artist, I will be able to offer more events and programs in my community.

*The perks for this campaign are based on an original piece of art from my studio. The original painting is 30 x 40” and is offered at the first donation of $5000 or more, up to $10,000. Perks start at $25 a digital download of the featured painting, Shoofly Liberty. Fine art prints are offered in several sizes at different investment levels and commissions are available at the $10,000 level and above.

*If I do not reach the full goal of $200,000, I will seek a rental property within the budget determined by money raised during this campaign. If possible, I would use this space to enact some of the community-based initiatives listed above. I would also use a physical presence in the community to continue building partnerships with local businesses. It is my hope that these goals would generate the income necessary to save for the purchase of a building or expand my marketing capabilities and run a second campaign to raise the remaining funds.

The Impact

As an investor in this campaign, you will receive a signed reproduction of one of my iconic Liberty paintings. One donor will receive the original piece of art, and the highest level donors will have the opportunity to work directly with me on an original commissioned piece of art. On a personal level, full funding of this campaign will allow me to partner with other businesses and community leaders to increase cultural opportunities in our rural community.

This is my first crowdfunding campaign as well as my first effort to raise support for a personal goal. However, for 3 years, I have worked closely with my local Arts Council to help them raise money for community projects, hosting art shows for the local schools, and offering scholarships to students entering colleges with a focus on cultural education.

Art is a passion for me but I am limited by inadequate space in my home studio and an inability to meet with clients in a professional setting. Although I volunteer as much as possible in my community, having a physical presence downtown would allow me to expand my contributions there as well. It would certainly enable me to offer open studio events and coordinate with other merchants and artists to determine the next step in cultural growth in our community.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge will be finding a building that can be purchased and renovated within the budget set by money raised during my campaign. I have already discussed my plans and looked at property with a local Realtor and a consultant in the contracting/development industries. I am aware of the challenges of bringing a historic property up to code and will not purchase one without full inspection and a reasonable understanding of the costs involved.
If there are no suitable properties for purchase, I have several rental options in the same area that will allow for most or all of my goals. I have run a thorough cost analysis on the project to determine all foreseeable costs, including business licensing and permits, utilities, overhead, etc. I believe the strong work ethic that has carried me to the point of outgrowing my home studio will see me through any additional obstacles that may arise.
In addition, I am confident in the support of my local community, existing patrons, and partnering businesses who have helped me through the planning stages of this campaign, including their willingness to host events to showcase my art and increase my reach within the local community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand. It's a huge favor to ask. There are other ways you can help with a few minutes of your time. Please share my campaign and follow me on my web page, blog, and social media. The more you share any of these platforms with your networks, the more exposure I get, allowing me to appeal to more investors.
I am already humbled by all of the support I have received from friends who have put in hours helping me shoot and edit videos, make campaign perks and incentives for people to come out to local events, and manage the daunting task of social media promotion for the campaign.

I am extremely grateful to local businesses who have hosted trunk shows so I can show people my art first hand and explain how I want to contribute directly to the community with this project. I will also be asking a lot of favors locally when the time comes to ship out the perks that the investors in this campaign have earned.
Thank you so much for taking time to read my story and for any help you are able to give me.

https://vimeo.com/libertasamericanaart

The collaborative workspace would also be conducive to community art classes, cultural lectures, and artists' workshops.
I have worked with several groups over the years on a scaled-down concept of this kind. In art groups with weekly meetings, artists worked on their current projects, reserving time at the end of each session for critiques. In this way, ideas are exchanged and personal obstacles are overcome. It is always helpful to have an outside view of your art, even if you disagree with the changes suggested. Personal growth comes from understanding other points of view.
Learn more on my blog: https://libertasamericanaart.wordpress.com/2017...

What I Need & What You Get
*I am asking for $200,000 dollars with a goal of purchasing and renovating a historic building to use as a professional studio. In addition to allowing me to expand my business as an artist, I will be able to offer more events and programs in my community.
*The perks for this campaign are based on an original piece of art from my studio. The original painting is 30 x 40” and is offered at the first donation of $5000 or more, up to $10,000. Perks start at $25 a digital download of the featured painting, Shoofly Liberty. Fine art prints are offered in several sizes at different investment levels and commissions are available at the $10,000 level and above.
*If I do not reach the full goal of $200,000, I will seek a rental property within the budget determined by money raised during this campaign. If possible, I would use this space to enact some of the community-based initiatives listed above. I would also use a physical presence in the community to continue building partnerships with local businesses. It is my hope that these goals would generate the income necessary to save for the purchase of a building or expand my marketing capabilities and run a second campaign to raise the remaining funds.

The Impact
As an investor in this campaign, you will receive a signed reproduction of one of my iconic Liberty paintings. One donor will receive the original piece of art, and the highest level donors will have the opportunity to work directly with me on an original commissioned piece of art. On a personal level, full funding of this campaign will allow me to partner with other businesses and community leaders to increase cultural opportunities in our rural community.
This is my first crowdfunding campaign as well as my first effort to raise support for a personal goal. However, for 3 years, I have worked closely with my local Arts Council to help them raise money for community projects, hosting art shows for the local schools, and offering scholarships to students entering colleges with a focus on cultural education.
Art is a passion for me but I am limited by inadequate space in my home studio and an inability to meet with clients in a professional setting. Although I volunteer as much as possible in my community, having a physical presence downtown would allow me to expand my contributions there as well. It would certainly enable me to offer open studio events and coordinate with other merchants and artists to determine the next step in cultural growth in our community.

Risks & Challenges
My biggest challenge will be finding a building that can be purchased and renovated within the budget set by money raised during my campaign. I have already discussed my plans and looked at property with a local Realtor and a consultant in the contracting/development industries. I am aware of the challenges of bringing a historic property up to code and will not purchase one without full inspection and a reasonable understanding of the costs involved.If there are no suitable properties for purchase, I have several rental options in the same area that will allow for most or all of my goals. I have run a thorough cost analysis on the project to determine all foreseeable costs, including business licensing and permits, utilities, overhead, etc. I believe the strong work ethic that has carried me to the point of outgrowing my home studio will see me through any additional obstacles that may arise.In addition, I am confident in the support of my local community, existing patrons, and partnering businesses who have helped me through the planning stages of this campaign, including their willingness to host events to showcase my art and increase my reach within the local community.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand. It's a huge favor to ask. There are other ways you can help with a few minutes of your time. Please share my campaign and follow me on my web page, blog, and social media. The more you share any of these platforms with your networks, the more exposure I get, allowing me to appeal to more investors.I am already humbled by all of the support I have received from friends who have put in hours helping me shoot and edit videos, make campaign perks and incentives for people to come out to local events, and manage the daunting task of social media promotion for the campaign.
I am extremely grateful to local businesses who have hosted trunk shows so I can show people my art first hand and explain how I want to contribute directly to the community with this project. I will also be asking a lot of favors locally when the time comes to ship out the perks that the investors in this campaign have earned.Thank you so much for taking time to read my story and for any help you are able to give me.
https://vimeo.com/libertasamericanaart

story:
Music on Main presents Winter Music Series - Who we are:

We are passionate about bringing together our community of residents and the season's visitors with live music and music performances. The cooler weather that keeps us from gathering at outdoor venues brings us closer together indoors at 3 local restaurants with live music at dinner time,  then a headliner on the VFW stage. These events will continue to feed and nourish us as a community and inspire our hearts with amazing soulful live music. Make a donation to help us make these events happen. And then come join us for the events.

First event! JANUARY 19th  William Massey opening/TIME SAWYER headlining. Doors open at 6PM. 

  • The quality of music that this town and its visitors have come to expect from Music on Main needs a winter edition to continue into. It will be different in some respects and take on its own flavor but the integrity of great music from this summer's events will carry through. 
  • It is important that our community has access to a wide range of live music- we see the Winter Music Series as an opportunity to bring in bands making music in genres including, but not limited to, blues, americana, folk, soul, classic rock, indie rock, and roots. 
  • Contributing to this fund in any amount will help us carry Music on Main into and through the winter. Donate what you feel you can, we deeply appreciate your support in any amount and will use it directly to plan and put on these events. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

For a little more detail:

  • We are planning and booking live music for the third Friday of each month January through May. Imagine the high energy performances of Music on Main condensed into a couple of indoor (and warmer) venues on Main Street. Additionally, each headliner event at the VFW will host one or more food and beer/wine vendors. 
  • It is important to us that the events remain free of cost and open to the public. As a contributor you will have first access to the listing of shows and calendar of events. 
  • Ideally, our entire goal will allow for 5 shows budgeted at ~$750 dollars for band and performance costs, marketing, venue costs, and any incidentals. *If our entire goal is not met we will use the funds we do raise to put on as many of these shows as possible.

 

The Impact

Your contribution makes a difference:

  • Your contribution goes directly to making this community and culture building and supporting program possible.
  • Music on Main was so wildly successful because of the detailed planning and integrity of the bands and performers invited to be a part, as well as the focus on providing family friendly events- we will carry on with this same integrity.
  • It is our desire that Music on Main presents Winter Music Series events will encourage a more lively downtown throughout the winter and bring together our diverse community of residents and visitors. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • As you might imagine, events like these do require funding to take place, bands need to be paid for their performances and travel costs. We feel confident that we can raise the funds here to keep these events free and open to the public. 
  • If you enjoyed the events this summer and plan to join again next year, use this campaign as your way to help give back for the good times had. Thank you for your support!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute monetarily, you can help us spread the word and please come join us for the music:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family that may be interested in helping to fund or attend our events.
  • Indiegogo has a variety of share tools for social media platforms like Facebook, twitter etc.
  • Check out the summer's events here.

story:
Thank You To All Contributors * THIS CAMPAIGN HAS BEEN EXTENDED! *

Copy & Paste the link to be redirected: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/earn-an-urn-for-kennington-park-extended#/ 

 

OUR PROJECT

I'm Heather Griffith, a stone mason in training right here at the City and Guilds
College in Kennington - I spend every lunch break walking through the gorgeous
park at the heart of Kennington - but I always find myself looking at the empty
granite basin at its entrance where the solid bronze Slade Urn once sat before
it was stolen... and then stolen again. 

As part of my course I've been tasked with imaging a project and thought to myself "what a perfect opportunity to give back to Kennington." 

I propose to carve a faithful replica of the original bronze urn from limestone. It will then be given into the care of the ‘Friends of Kennington Park’ on behalf of the people of this London borough as a thank you for the work they do to maintain this much loved green space in the heart of the city.

 

What We Need

To recreate this urn I'll need: 

  • To order stone to be dug in quarry in France.
  • For it to be shipped to the UK.
  • For the stone to be put on a lathe.
  • For the bronze elements to be cast.
  • 1 years tuition fees.

What You'll Get

Any contribution here will be massively appreciated and any amount given will be gifted an invitation to the unveiling. We also have some super special rewards such as two VIP tickets to The Angel Comedy Club for guaranteed entry or A bronze replica of the acorn that sits at the top of the urn. 

The Impact

By recreating this urn you'll be supporting in the restoring of some of the historical pride to one of London's oldest parks for those that enjoy the park now on a daily basis and for generation to come. 

Other Ways You Can Support The Project

I totally understand that you may not have the funds to help but there are others ways you can support. If you know anyone who you believe would be interesting in supporting the project be them: Park lovers; joggers; dog walkers; friends in Kennington; fellow stone masons or history lovers, then please share this page with them. It will be a huge help.

story:
• My name is Chad Minnes and I am a local Event Promoter and Producer. Father of 2 boys.  I created Boardwalk Budz approximately 2 years ago and based on current laws decided to launch now.
  • We launched this campaign as our event is a celebration of the passage of Cannabis Laws and rights.
  • Running an event of this magnitude during these times is difficult enough. An event of this lifestyle is something of an entire other level. From Security Costs to the Insurance and the rooming of Talents and Speakers with the intention of being a traveling event as well as giving back to a non profit is a fun but challenging task.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for small funding for Insurance, Rooming, and Security Costs. We have gifts like T-shirts, Non-Profit Donations, and Sponsorships for yourself or your brand. Even shout outs from talents and roasts from comedians.

The Impact

Having a successful event ensures we can give back in a greater form to our non-profit partners as well as bring the show on the Road so we can produce more excellent Cannabis related Lifestyle Events.

  • I have produced successful events from small scale shows to large scale conventions and adding this concept is a great asset to any city it runs in.

Risks & Challenges

  • Insurance costs for an event of this type. 
  • Security Costs for an event of this type.
  • Rooming costs for guests.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our socials super easy all Boardwalk Budz

Our Ticket Link boardwalkbudz.eventbrite.com

story:
A 350-year-old former sugar plantation house in Antigua, one of a few stone plantation houses' which are habitable in the Caribbean. 

We hope to restore the sugar mill, store houses and rum distillery to enable the historical development of the estate to be presented to future generations, providing them with the opportunity to explore and learn about the origins of the house and the trauma of slavery. 

 We are also aiming to continue our research of the estates history and create an on-site museum.

story:
The Idea

 My name is Miroslav, I am 25 years old and passionate about art in its many diverse forms - drawing, calligraphy, photography, graphic design, silk screen printing, street art. I have always been driven by the need to make art, to experiment and to find new ways of applying different techniques. For the last three years, my dream has been to build a place that would allow artists to gather, work together, get motivated and expand their scope of interests. 

I’ve discovered for myself that remoteness from the fast-paced and consumerist lifestyle of the city stimulates my creative urges. And I believe that there are many other artists around the world who would benefit from having a tranquil, close-to-nature environment to use as a studio. This has been my main objective for establishing NoPoint Atelier Art Residency. 

 

The NoPoint Project

This project has started three years ago as an idea and since then many steps on the way of making it a reality has been made. 

  • We bought the house
  • We laid a concrete floor in the atelier
  • We found professionals to create a plan for the atelier (you can see below)
  • We renovated the common spaces - bathroom, bedrooms, living room
  • We maintained the yard and built a small garden for growing vegetables
  • Now we're working on the kitchen

All of this so far I have funded with personal finances. What is now ahead is the repair of the old barn - the future atelier. Unfortunately, it needs major renovations before it can run as a residency and welcome artists, including construction strengthening, wet and heat insulation instalment, setting up electricity and water supply, coating and painting of the walls and the roof, as well as the floor, which will need an additional coating.

And although I am dedicated to doing everything myself, this huge renovation requires way more than I could provide alone. That's the reason why I decided to run this Indiegogo campaign. Right now, simultaneously with it, I am organizing an exhibition in Sofia, also dedicated to the project. All the money earned from it are going to add up to this project and would be used for equipment and fundamental art supplies, such as a table, a sink, chairs, stands, lights and others. 

The Believers

Many have already believed in the idea - my parents who were very supportive and played a huge role in finding the house; my friends who are with me on this project; my graphics professor Rosen Andreev, who donated to the future art residency a lithography and etching graphics presses with all their supplementary equipment. Right now they are situated in a garage, waiting to be put to use into the atelier. His gesture gave a strong push to the project, as this equipment is a highly valued rarity in Bulgaria and holds strong potential.

All these people and their support during the last years make me confident that I am on the right path. And right now, facing this huge challenge, I need more people to believe in it and help us with the final step. All of you can help and any help would be of great importance to this project!

 

The Atelier renovation

The future atelier needs serious and precise repair works that we cannot do alone and without a special equipment. That's why we have already found professionals to execute the whole renovation. A freshly graduated architect with several years of experience in this field has already created a project with all the needed measurements and calculations, including a concept visualization. 

The total cost for the project amounts to $12,000. The funds raised during the campaign are going to be used, as it goes, for:

  • Strengthening of the main structure with steel - $3,900
  • New cross-beams and rafters - $1100 
  • Polymer floor coating - $1,400
  • Wet and heat roof insulation - $900
  • Window panes - $1,600
  • The needed materials for the walls (bricks, thermal insulation sheets, ground coat, paint, brushes, rollers, and other materials) - $1,200
  • Work (Setting up the woodwork of the building; thermal insulation and ground coat applying, building a wall on the west side of the building, that is now made only by wooden planks, wall putty, setting up the windows) - $1,900
  • All funds raised above this amount would add up to equipment and supplies that would allow more artist to visit and work here.

The support

I fully understand the scale of this project and the amount of support needed. That's why I have put a serious thought into figuring how to say "Thanks" to all of you, who would decide to become part of it and donate for our campaign. As I am working on starting an art residency, I found it best to give back a personal gift of a handmade silkscreen work, that I made here in Balani village. 

 

Of course, I have taken into consideration the possibility of not reaching our goal with this Indiegogo campaign. In case this happens, I would use the raised funds for the most demanding improvement: the roof.

The Potential 

Once the atelier is ready and set, NoPoint is going to become a member of the Worldwide Network of Artist Residencies (www.resartis.org). This way, artists from all over the world would be able to find out about it and come to work here throughout the year. I am going to organize one main event with several artists, applying with portfolios, who are going to work on a specifically picked subject. The main point of this event would be to provoke artists to work with the surrounding environment (in the village, or in the town) on solving different sociology, psychology, communicational or other issues.

At the same time, NoPoint will stimulate a cultural exchange and mutual education between the locals and the visiting artists. While the artists can submerge in the authentic local culture, the locals will get familiar with the artists’ pieces and methodology. Gabrovo residents could observe the working process of the creators during “Open Door Days” of the atelier, open lectures and workshops. 

The past winter I organised a calligraphy workshop for beginners that was visited by about 15 Gabrovo residents. All of them got involved in a collaborative process to focus on calligraphy-related problems that do not bother them in their day-to-day life. Familiarising people with the peculiarities of a creative process in a cosy, friendly environment encourages them to follow their creative impulses and build on their skills. Educational events hosted in the NoPoint Atelier can enrich the culture and aesthetic critique in certain artistic fields that can nurture long-term improvements in common visual culture.

How can you help? 

 

There are many ways for you to contribute to this project and each of the possibilities would be of great help!

  • BACK our campaign - You could choose to donate to this campaign by clicking the BACK IT button at the top of the page and become part of making it reality!
  • Share it - You could also share this page by using the Indiegogo share tools and help the project to reach more people!

If you like the campaign and some questions emerge, don't hesitate to contact us.
We would be more than happy to talk with you about the process, the past and mostly about the future of the NoPoint Art Residency.

The main point of this event would be to provoke artists to work with the surrounding environment (in the village, or in the town) on solving different sociology, psychology, communicational or other issues.
At the same time, NoPoint will stimulate a cultural exchange and mutual education between the locals and the visiting artists. While the artists can submerge in the authentic local culture, the locals will get familiar with the artists’ pieces and methodology. Gabrovo residents could observe the working process of the creators during “Open Door Days” of the atelier, open lectures and workshops. 

The past winter I organised a calligraphy workshop for beginners that was visited by about 15 Gabrovo residents. All of them got involved in a collaborative process to focus on calligraphy-related problems that do not bother them in their day-to-day life. Familiarising people with the peculiarities of a creative process in a cosy, friendly environment encourages them to follow their creative impulses and build on their skills. Educational events hosted in the NoPoint Atelier can enrich the culture and aesthetic critique in certain artistic fields that can nurture long-term improvements in common visual culture.
How can you help? 
 
There are many ways for you to contribute to this project and each of the possibilities would be of great help!


BACK our campaign - You could choose to donate to this campaign by clicking the BACK IT button at the top of the page and become part of making it reality!

Share it - You could also share this page by using the Indiegogo share tools and help the project to reach more people!

If you like the campaign and some questions emerge, don't hesitate to contact us.We would be more than happy to talk with you about the process, the past and mostly about the future of the NoPoint Art Residency.

story:
About the founders: 

Allen Ferguson is a filmmaker from Texas. 
Andrea Spaziani is a choreographer from Toronto. 

We met in Berlin studying art. Having collaborated on several multimedia works (SUCCULENTA, THIS DESIRING PONY) across the world we've been working together for the last year and a half to bring this event to fruition.

Archaeology of the Frivolous is a continuation of the wide ranging relationships we made in the past years in the Berlin and New York City art scenes. We want to bring together thinkers and artists from around the world to a remote location to disconnect from technology and present their ideas in an immersive, performative lecture series that goes beyond the academic presentation and into a warm, personal space.  We want participants to experience geological space and time by immersing ourselves in themes & landscapes that are so enormous they inspire awe. 

By contributing to our campaign, you can help us establish this space, and support its continuation. We hope to grow it into an ongoing lecture series, which will be documented and disseminated. We want to learn from each other by crossing boundaries of knowledge and geography.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000. This is going towards the purchase of a small tract of remote land, some basic improvements to it, and travel expenses for the speakers at our first residency. If we raise more, it will go towards a bigger experience. Things we'll be building on the property include: a screen for projecting films and presentations, basic amenities, an outdoor kitchen, tents (eventually we will be build several small adobe dwellings for glamping). 
 

  • By donating, you will be invited to attend some of our unique events over the next year in Marfa, TX, and New York City. You will be joining a unique club of artists, lecturers, scientists, chefs, musicians, and thinkers. You will get to come to one of the most remote parts of the continental USA, and camp under the stars in the high desert at a curated event with great food and stimulating conversation. 
  • Being able to come to our events is the biggest perk. If you are not able to come to our preliminary event, we will be doing a residency at least every season, with longer, less intensive residencies in between. This means an initial residency from May 9th-14th, another in August, and another in the Fall, with longer, more carefree times in between when we will focus on building sustainable adobe houses on the Marfa land, and working on personal, durational art projects. A donation now can get you a discounted ticket to future events, which will increase in price. Tickets include food and shelter for 3-6 days. We'll be having large home cooked meals, with an emphasis on vegetarian food and smoked BBQ. I will be cooking meat on request as well and making my famous smoked softboiled eggs and some other delicacies. Mostly we'll be camping but there will actually be a few trailers as well with bedrooms. 
  • If we do not reach our entire goal here on Indiegogo, the funds allocated will still go towards the project, which is going forward with all of our energy (and money) either way. This is a way for you to get in before we sell tickets at a higher price. You have the flexibility to choose which event you'll come and participate in. We are also working with some local sponsors, which will help offset the cost of the event.

The Impact

  • Archaeology of the Frivolous is a celebration of art and culture outside the austere environment of a university or a detached art world conference. There will be big group meals, interactive hikes, lectures in hot springs, spontaneous cold springs, etc. You'll be living with, meeting, and interacting with people over a shared experience. 
     
  • The ability to disconnect from your phone, laptop, work email, and other endless holes of infotainment is going to be the one of the biggest commodities of the 21st century. Come enjoy a week off, and take time for introspection and a new (ancient) kind of stimulation. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Marfa, TX is a remote location, and a long travel distance for some of the guest speakers we would like to invite. Accessibility to this landscape is one of the biggest challenges, but also one of the most rewarding outcomes, that we will encounter in establishing Archaeology of the Frivolous. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate now, you can always spread the word to people who may be interested in attending, or presenting at, an event, and to businesses that might want their products featured at our events. There will be events in New York City as well. We will also need a few volunteers at each of our events. Shoot us an email for more information.

story:
What We Need

 Our goal of $3000 will help us:

-pay performers

-pay stage crew

-build stages

-provide artist materials

 

The Impact

 The WSAF wild bring attention to the arts with public celebrations of music, dance, poetry, film and visual art. Throughout the festival, musicians and dancers will perform in unassuming venues such as lake fronts and parks, the community will come together for an art parade, a film festival and an interactive art bazaar.   

Risks & Challenges

Due to the nature of our mostly outdoor community festival, we have come to expect the unexpected. Each festival brings on new unforeseeable challenges.

Past challenges have included:

-relocation due to inclement weather

-electrical & technical outages

-staff shortage

-budget constraints

.. and our personal favorite, the bat that got trapped in the theater during tech rehearsal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 -Spread the word on social media! Share our posts on Facebook & Instagram.

-Good old word of mouth! Talk us up!

-Attend our events and bring friends.

story:
Short Summary

 

Ekran Toronto Polish Film Festival is a prominent cultural event in the city of Toronto, Canada. This year is going to celebrate its 9th Anniversary. The festival will take place on November 6th and will run for a week.

 

To help our team in selecting the best Polish film productions we are sending our programming and social media crew to Poland’s most important film event this year. It's called the Polish Feature Films Festival in Gdynia and it is the biggest film festival in Poland. This year they are celebrating its 42nd anniversary. You can say it’s Poland’s equivalent to Sundance.

We will be broadcasting to you LIVE plus blogging EVERYDAY so you can feel like you are there!

Also, we will be networking and working hard to bring the best pictures and filmmakers to Toronto for the 9th edition of Ekran.  The benefit of having Ekran representatives attend Gdynia is that not only will we have more eyes on the latest and hottest film trends in Poland (which will help get the best films to Toronto) but also we will be bringing to you all the glitz, glam and stories of a major European Film Festival through our website and social media platforms.

Ekran is a volunteer based organization and a passion project for those involved.  We don't make a profit from this festival and that's why we are counting on the funding from a platform like IndieGoGo to help raise the money to send our Social Media Team to Gdynia.   

WHO IS GOING:

 

Marta Pozniakowski (CEO & Founder)

Jasia Kiersnowski (Social Media Producer & Q&A Host)

Adam Wojtkowiak (Video Producer)

 

AMOUNT WE NEED TO RAISE:

 

$3000

 

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE SPENT?

 

The money will cover the airfare for the three of us

 

WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURN?

 

Over $20 A “Thank You” in the Ekran 2017 program

Over $100 Free Pass For Ekran and “Thank You” in the Ekran 2017 program

Over $300 Thank you in the 2017 program, a free pass and an invitation to the opening gala and wrap party.

Over $500 You get all of the above and you will get a chance to personally meet our special guests during the Ekran 2017 festival.

 

 

WHAT IS EKRAN?

 

Ekran literally translates as “screen” in the Polish language.

Founded in Toronto by a group of individuals who are passionate about showcasing new media arts and films with both a Polish and multicultural focus. Last year marked the eighth year of the Toronto Polish Film Festival, a true success in terms of audience growth. Ekran is supported by the Consulate General of the Republic of Poland in Toronto, the Polish Filmmakers Association, the Polish Film Institute, and City of Toronto. The films showcased by Ekran represent significant and recent contributions of Polish filmmakers to film culture, with the festival being a noteworthy event for both Polish-Canadian and GTA communities.

 

We want to thank you advance for your generosity!

 

There are other ways you can help besides donating money:

 

Please like and share our video with your social networks. Just getting the word out will help!

 

Thanks!

 

Ekran Toronto Polish Film Festival jest z jednym z najważniejszych wydarzeń kulturalnych w Toronto i jednym z wiodących festiwali filmowych promującym polskie kino w Ameryce Północnej. W tym roku, w dniach 6-12 listopada, odbędzie się 9 już edycja festiwalu Ekran.

Co roku w Gdyni odbywa się Festiwal Filmów Fabularnych, największe święto dla kina w Polsce. Festiwal w Gdyni można porównać do wydarzenia tak znaczącego jak Sundance Film Festiwal w Ameryce. W tym roku Ekran wysyła z Toronto swoją ekipę, która zajmie się selekcją filmów na festiwal, networkingiem i promocją festiwalu.

Nasza ekipa ekranowa będzie blogowała, instagromowała i video-blogowała prosto z Gdyni codziennie, tak że możesz się poczuć że jesteś częścią festiwalu w Gdyni. Poza tym, nasz team będzie miał dostęp do najświeższych wiadomości świata filmowego oraz najnowszych polskich produkcji, które później publiczność w Toronto będzie miała okazję obejrzeć.

KTO JEST W EKRANOWEJ EKIPIE?

Marta Pozniakowski (CEO & Founder)

Jasia Kiersnowski (Social Media Producer & Q&A Host)

Adam Wojtkowiak (Video Producer)

 

SUMA KTÓRA POTRZEBNA JEST NA TEN PROJEKT?

 

$3000 CAD

 

W JAKI SPOSÓB BĘDĄ WYDANE PIENIĄDZE?

 

Zebrane pieniądze pokryją koszty związane z zakupem biletów lotniczych dla członków ekipy

 

CO DOSTANIESZ W ZAMIAN?

 

Ponad $20 “Podziękowanie” w programie festiwalu

Ponad $100 Karnet na Festiwal i “Podziękowanie” w programie festiwalu

Ponad $300 “Podziękowanie” w programie festiwalu, Karnet na Festiwal, Zaproszenie na Otwarcie Festiwalu i Zakończenie Festiwalu

Ponad $500 Otrzymasz wszystko co powyżej plus będziesz miał możliwość osobiście poznać naszych gości specjalnych podczas festiwalu w listopadzie.

 

CO TO JEST EKRAN?

Ekran został powołany do życia w 2009 roku poprzez grupę pasjonatów filmowych, którzy chcieli szerzyć kulturę i sztukę filmową, w szczególności Polską, ale też i wielokulturową. W zeszłym roku Ekran celebrował 8 lat, który był ogromnym sukcesem pod względem frekwencji widowni. Ekran dział pod patronatem Konsulatu Polskiego w Toronto. Współproducentami Ekranu są Stowarzyszenie Filmowców Polskich i Polski Instytut Sztuki Filmowej oraz Miasto Toronto. Ekran jest znaczącym wydarzeniem kulturalnym dla mieszkańców Toronto oraz dla Polonii mieszkającej w Toronto.

Dziękujemy z góry za Twoje wsparcie!

Jest wiele innych sposobów w jaki można nam pomóc.

Polub naszą kampanię i roześlij ją do przyjaciół i znajomych. Wsparcie w postaci promocji jest bardzo pomocne. Dziękujemy!

story:
“Home Movie Day is the perfect opportunity for people to connect with our past and to move the conversation about preserving our cultural heritage into the future.” — Ken Burns

We are an independent group of archivists and archival enthusiasts and small formats with experience in revision, restoration, projection and promotion of analog cinema and since 2014 we have celebrated Home Movie Day.

So far we have used the materials and equipment that each could provide but it is necessary to equip ourselves better so that the work of reviewing films is done in a more professional way.

In 2013 I was Director of the Archivo Memoria Project of the National Cineteca de México and confirmed the importance of family cinema for Mexicans, promoting and presenting family films is also fundamental for the creation of new contents and that is where my personal interest is in focus.

This year's edition will be held at a cultural center north of the city that was founded by the government of Mexico City in an abandoned cinema, FARO Aragon. This will allow us to expand our diffusion and reach because we have the center impulse and its activities focused on the cinema and the film culture.

Your collaboration will help us buy materials and equipment and will make a difference in this important initiative for Mexican cinema. The help of our friends for this goal is fundamental.

  

 

 

What we need and what you get

We need a list of materials and equipment including Regular 8, Super 8 and 16mm leader, Super 8 and 16mm splicers, paper tape, rewinders for small gauge film, splicing tape for 8 and 16mm, Super 8 and 16mm viewers, 16mm split reels and plus. The money that we put together will be entirely destined for the purchase of these materials in the United States because it is no longer possible to obtain them in Mexico.

We need at least $ 4,000 but for now our goal is less because we believe it will be more feasible to put it together. Urbanski Film, Illinois, will be our main supplier and has fair prices and variety of materials that we need.

If you support us you will get unique rewards and the satisfaction of supporting a citizen initiative that aims to highlight the importance of home cinema in Mexico.

In case we do not reach the goal, the money collected will be used to buy the most urgent materials and equipment. If you are an archivist and want to support us by donating material or equipment please contact us. We welcome your donations in kind.

 

 

Impact

As John Waters says "There's no such thing as a bad home movie". And indeed, home movies are filled with the magic of the past. Families have the opportunity to relive moments that they may never have lived and they do it with a heart full of joy. This experience is unique and is only provided by home movies.

Our previous editions have been a resounding success since the attendees can not only see their movies again, but those of the others. We have also collaborated to begin to make researches and even documentaries from these materials disdained by the conventional film archives.

Your participation will be historical. 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Actually the only risk we have with this project is not reaching the goal because we could not buy everything we need, we trust that our friends in the world will help us professionalize our work.

Other ways you can help

We remind you that if for now you can not help us with a donation, you can share our campaign in your social networks using the buttons that Indiegogo provides, thus we will reach more people!
Remember that we also accept donations in kind, please contact us if this is the case.

Thank you very much!

We need a list of materials and equipment including Regular 8, Super 8 and 16mm leader, Super 8 and 16mm splicers, paper tape, rewinders for small gauge film, splicing tape for 8 and 16mm, Super 8 and 16mm viewers, 16mm split reels and plus. The money that we put together will be entirely destined for the purchase of these materials in the United States because it is no longer possible to obtain them in Mexico.We need at least $ 4,000 but for now our goal is less because we believe it will be more feasible to put it together. Urbanski Film, Illinois, will be our main supplier and has fair prices and variety of materials that we need.If you support us you will get unique rewards and the satisfaction of supporting a citizen initiative that aims to highlight the importance of home cinema in Mexico.In case we do not reach the goal, the money collected will be used to buy the most urgent materials and equipment. If you are an archivist and want to support us by donating material or equipment please contact us. We welcome your donations in kind.
  Impact
As John Waters says "There's no such thing as a bad home movie". And indeed, home movies are filled with the magic of the past. Families have the opportunity to relive moments that they may never have lived and they do it with a heart full of joy. This experience is unique and is only provided by home movies.Our previous editions have been a resounding success since the attendees can not only see their movies again, but those of the others. We have also collaborated to begin to make researches and even documentaries from these materials disdained by the conventional film archives.Your participation will be historical. 
  Risks and challenges
Actually the only risk we have with this project is not reaching the goal because we could not buy everything we need, we trust that our friends in the world will help us professionalize our work.Other ways you can helpWe remind you that if for now you can not help us with a donation, you can share our campaign in your social networks using the buttons that Indiegogo provides, thus we will reach more people!Remember that we also accept donations in kind, please contact us if this is the case.Thank you very much!

story:
Short Summary

We began as a small contemporary art project in Sarajevo and now we have transitioned into a platform that is generating an incredible intercultural conversation. AP published the first Think Freedom photograph as the Global Image of the Day from the Sarajevo City Hall. That photograph proved that art has the power to connect and to reach so many. 

First Think Freedom sculpture to leave Sarajevo went straight to the Vatican in the hands of His Holiness pope Francis…how cool is that. And just like that Think Freedom was no longer a small project. We got the call from New York to present the installation on 47th Street but I wanted to travel with the installation and to bring messages of kids from all over the world to New York. It’s not just Sarajevo that needs to stand up. We all do.

 

 

At its core, Think Freedom is an installation that is composed of thousands of sculptures. Each one carries a message of high school kids about what art and culture mean to them, what freedom means to them, and how they see their future.

Young architecture students in each city work with us to design the installation authentic to that city.  Young artists contribute to the installation with their own ideas adding light, sound, video, and new media making the installation their own.

So, Think Freedom began its global journey connecting young people from all over the world, and giving them a platform that unites their voice. Sculptures with their messages continue their life travelling to future host cities with united sculptures from all previous ones.

International Association of Peace Messenger Cities has invited all its city members to be our hosts. So far, we have travelled to six cities with leading institutions and organisations as our partners but more importantly with so many young people becoming part of the Think Freedom family. More and more cities are joining in.

 

 

We hope that you will join us on our journey. We agreed to present the installation in 30 cities globally in order to reach New York City in 2020 with messages from all the kids together and with ideas of local audience travelling with us.

Your contribution would mean that our journey will continue and it will prove to the young people that anything is possible. We want you to be a part of Think Freedom and to send us your thoughts that would travel with us.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Think Freedom is beautiful but logistically complicated project. So many have supported us so far and continue to do so. We need your help to cover the costs of transport, installation, promotion, and documentation of the work. In each city we organise workshops with high school students, architecture and art students. We bring together our partners and open the conversation that will lead to future partnerships. We ask local community leaders and audience for their ideas and their messages. In each city we, suspend the installation at a prominent location in public space with the team of professional installers and volunteers. We also work on connecting these cities by bringing together mayors and head of their cultural sectors.

 

 

We find support in many different ways. Local partners and institutions help us each time, but in order to Think Freedom to grow we need support from you. On our journey, we have been asked by many who have witnessed this beautiful installation how can they help. This campaign is our answer to that question. It is an opportunity for everyone to be a part of something much greater than ourselves.

 

 

We hope that you will support us but that you will contribute with your messages in order to have your ideas travel with the installation. This way we want you to be an active participant and an integral part of the project.

The Impact

The greatest reward for all this work to me is when these high school kids call me to ask me where we are going to next…. because they know that their ideas are travelling with us and thus reaching places that they have not been to, connecting with their peers all over the world.

 

 

In the world where we are bombarded with horrific images I hope to give something beautiful to the world that would connect us and generate a conversation about the future with a more positive perspective and open mind.

If you join us, by the time our journey is completed we will have an installation of 10000 sculptures with 10000 messages in different languages, with different ideas, but with a common hope. Our audience will have 30 000 000 people.

We sincerely appreciate your support in any way that you can. We hope that you will stay connected and that like us you believe that borders and limitations are only as great as we imagine them to be and that anything is possible.

 

 

 

Thank you.

story:
Hi all,

So the thing about New Orleans is that no matter what you're doing , you leave with a story and song in your heart. I want to provide that room for those stories and hearts.

    Im Darold Alexander. An American Swing dancer born and raised in New Orleans, Louisiana. My campaign is to fund a battle of jazz bands in New Orleans,the birthplace of jazz. The battle of bands date back to 1930's Savoy ballroom where the house band would take on traveling bands or bands that would be competition at other places on other nights. Battles such as those are still talked about in the jazz community. Benny Goodman versus the house band of Chic Webb and Duke Ellington or Count Baise battling the house. Many names became big at these events. My simple goal I hope to achieve is that the musicians of today will step up in their music and be pushed by their peers to be history makers. If done right the first time then it could be annual or semi annual. 

As far as funding goes, I want to be able to rent a great piano, buy or make large banners to decorate. I will do most of the footwork when it comes to promotion, flyers, social media, and so on. The largest part is Guaranteeing that every musician walks out with 100 dollars for their time. get in contact with me to donate bigger objects such as services and pianos. 

16 musicians and mc= 1700

decor and piano= 500

venue=150

vendors(hiring or supplies) =250

event staff=400

All proceeds go toward the next Jazz Band Brawl. For every contribution of 20 or more you get two free tickets to the event that are transferable if you cannot attend. Just leave your name 

If my goal is not met then the show must still go on. I will put everything towards the bands then towards food then towards promotion. You can bring back this tradition.  

I have been wrestling and doing martial arts for close to a decade and was a collegic competitor, when I broke my ribs. Not long after I healed I started swing dancing or for the proper term doing the Lindy hop. I've been planning events and weekly swing dances for two years and this is going to be my biggest idea since I've learned what Lindy hopping was. Being from this city and being here when it was at its lowest I've become a believer in dreams not dying. 

The impact of the buzz alone has gotten over 30 musicians and countless dancers buzzing. I believe it could be just as big as it was at the Savoy.Nothing will ever be greater than that. In a time where people were taking up arms and disagreeing with the governments polices, this ballroom in Harlem, changed not only a neighborhood but they influenced generations of dancers, musicians, fighters, actors, singers, and films.

SHARE THE WORD and SAVE THE DATE. using indiegogo tools. Its easy and for a great cause.

Tuesday April 2, 2019

Happyland Theater 3126 Burgundy Street

The only risk is that we might do it again!

 

ALL of you are appreciated. Come dance with me y'all!

story:
DANSK BESKRIVELSE NEDERST I DENNE TEKST!

The primary objective of Fremad Folket is to support the functioning of Aarhus Fremad as a football club, with its core elements being presence and diversity in people and culture. Through co-creation Fremad Folket guards the principles and objectives that the club is driven by. Fremad Folket is an important voice in the decision making processes in and about the club, because we believe participation is a decisive part of a modern football club.

If you are a part of Fremad Folket you will participate in the making of one annual project, be invited to two annual community-meetings and get discounts at Riisvangen as well as with some of the sponsors.

Fremad Folket er et fællesskab, hvis primære formål er at støtte Aarhus Fremads virke som en fodboldklub, hvor de bærende elementer er mangfoldighed og nærvær. Fremad Folket vogter gennem samskabelse om de principper og mål, som klubben drives efter. Fremad Folket er altså en vigtig stemme i beslutningsprocesserne i og omkring klubben, da vi tror på medindflydelse som et afgørende element i den moderne fodboldklub.

Er du en del af Fremad Folket får du direkte medindflydelse på minimum 1 årligt projekt. Du inviteres til to årlige folkemøder, og får rabatter på Riisvangen og hos nogle af Aarhus Fremads sponsorer.

Som medlem af Fremad Folket er du med til at sikre, at der fortsat er gratis entré til alle hjemmekampe på Riisvangen Stadion.  Derudover støtter du op om udviklingen af Aarhus Fremad. Det første projekt du får medindflydelse på er valg af spillertrøje-design, til 2018/2019-sæsonen. Næste års projekt igangsættes ved en workshop på første folkemøde, der afholdes i sommeren 2018.

story:
Od 27. do 29. jula 2018. godine, u Stocu će biti održan festival kulture “Slovo Gorčina”, koji je uspostavljen 1971. godine u čast pjesnika Maka Dizdara. U sklopu festivala bit će organiziran niz književnih, muzičkih, dramskih i likovnih događanja, između ostalih i solistički koncert Miroslava Tadića, predstava dubrovačkog Kazališta Marina Držića “Orfej sluša radio” autorice Pavlice Bajšić Brazzoduro i večer poezije ovogodišnjeg gosta-pjesnika Ota Tolnaia. U sklopu “Slovo Gorčina” tradicionalno će se dodijeliti i nagrada “Mak Dizdar” za najbolju prvu neobjavljenu knjigu poezije iz Bosne i Hercegovine, Crne Gore, Hrvatske i Srbije. Novi program ovogodišnjeg festivala jeste Stolački ljetni univerzitet, na kojem će učestvovati 10 studenata humanstičkih nauka iz Bosne i Hercegovine i regiona. Po prvi put nakon 1991. godine, programi festivala će se održavati unutar zidina srednjovjekovnog grada Vidoškog u centru Stoca.

 

Cilj organizatora “Slovo Gorčina” jeste održavanja kontinuiteta s gotovo pedesetogodišnjom tradicijom ovog festivala, uz nastojanje da on povrati nešto od izuzetno visokog statusa koji je uživao u prvih dvadeset godina svog postojanja, od 1971. do 1991. godine. Na ovaj način, “Slovo Gorčina” nastoji realizirati viziju koju je Mak Dizdar spomenuo u jednom razgovoru iz 1970. godine: “…Stolac bi, prema mojoj zamisli, trebalo da bude domaćin Orfejevih dana, jer je ovo mediteransko područje, a priča o Orfeju i Euridiki je mediteranska. To bi bio skup eminentnih jugoslovenskih kulturnih radnika i književnika i to bi bila kulturno-turistička manifestacija…”

Festival je tradicionalno otvoren za sve posjetioce, a njegovi sadržaji besplatni. Međutim, kao i svi projekti kulture u Bosni i Hercegovini, a posebno oni koji se ne odvijaju u velikim gradskim centrima ili nemaju etno-nacionalni predznak, i "Slovo Gorčina" se suočava sa kontinuiranim problemom finansiranja. 

Zbog toga pokrećemo ovu kampanju, u nadi da će svi zaljubljenici kulture, ovog pitoresknog gradića i poezije Maka Dizdara, kao i Stočani u zemlji u inostranstvu podržati realizaciju ovogodišnjeg festivala i doprinijeti realizaciji Makove vizije Stoca i Hercegovine.

Pozivamo vas da nam se pridružite u Stocu od 27. do 29. jula!

Program festivala: 

 

Petak, 27. juli

19:00 Otvaranje festivala: recital poezije Maka Dizdara 

19:30 Otvaranje izložbe: Stećci u savremenoj umjetnosti 

20:30 Književna večer: gost-autor Oto Tolnai, Proglašenje dobitnika nagrade “Mak Dizdar” 

21:30 Orfej sluša radio, radiofonijska predstava

23:00 After party: DJ Mili Sefic, DJ HigheR

Subota, 28. juli 

od 10:00 druženje i promocije knjiga u Šarića kući

18:00 Stolački ljetni univerzitet: Predavanje “Mak Dizdar i književni kanon(i)” 

19:00 Stolački ljetni univerzitet: “Žene u bosanskohercegovačkoj književnosti” 

20:00 Večer savremene književnost

21:00 Miroslav Tadić, solistički koncert

22:00 Balade Petrice Kerempuha, glazbena predstava, Veno Mušinović i Mokre Gljive

23:00 After party: DJ Mili Sefic, DJ HigheR

 

Nedelja, 29.juli 

10:00 Promocija knjige Lutanje Aleksandre Jovičić, dobitnice nagrade “Mak Dizdar” 2017. godine 

18:00 Stolački ljetni univerzitet: “Mak Dizdar iz pjesničke perspektive” 

19:00 Stolački ljetni univerzitet: “Život Maka Dizdara” 

20:00 Večer stolačkih pjesnika 

21:00 Gitarijada (program U.G. Iskra)

story:
Our goal is to give local poets a chance to share their words and represent their local poetry community at one of the most exciting poetry events in the country.

Unfortunately traveling is not cheap, so help is needed in covering transportation and lodging. By helping Rock Slam, donors will receive perks and have the knowledge that they are helping a wonderful group of poets travel to Chicago in order to make strangers feel things with their words.

Rock Slam’s 2018 team includes Nick Yuk, Fiefie LaColla, Adam Biggs, Sean O'Reilly, and Greg Bassell. They earned spots on our team by competing in our monthly slams at Casa del Sol in Nyack, NY, and by impressing the audience at our end-of-the-season slam in late April.

Meet the Team

Adam Biggs lives in Chestnut Ridge and has been writing poetry for over 14 years. This is his second time representing our area at the National Poetry Slam. In addition to being an active participant in our events, he is also one of our organizers. His writing focuses primarily on current events, love, and heartbreak. 

Fiefie LaColla is a 19-year-old Nyack native. They've been involved with Rockland Poets for a few years, both as a performer and as an organizer. You might see Fiefie around Nyack, working at a restaurant or cafe or playing music in front of Starbucks. Fiefie's work deals with identity, death, love, and body image.

Greg Bassell lives in Nanuet with his wife, Nikki. He's a physical therapist and has been a member of Rockland Poets since it was founded as Suffern Poetry in an art gallery in Suffern back in 2011. This is his first time competing at the National Poetry Slam as a team member. His work is often silly, accessible, and bird. 

Nick Yuk is from New Jersey. Sad. He's been a part of our poetry scene for over three years and is one of our organizers. He's been to NPS both on our team and on Advanced Slam (the Staten Island team). When he's not performing, he manages a 7-11. His work is primarily about depression, alcoholism, and self-harm.

Sean O'Reilly is a relative newcomer to our slam scene. He also lives somewhere in New Jersey. In addition to doing performance poetry, he is also a rapper and a cartoonist. His work deals with mental illness, religion, sexuality, and anger.
story_txt:
Our goal is to give local poets a chance to share their words and represent their local poetry community at one of the most exciting poetry events in the country.Unfortunately traveling is not cheap, so help is needed in covering transportation and lodging. By helping Rock Slam, donors will receive perks and have the knowledge that they are helping a wonderful group of poets travel to Chicago in order to make strangers feel things with their words.
Rock Slam’s 2018 team includes Nick Yuk, Fiefie LaColla, Adam Biggs, Sean O'Reilly, and Greg Bassell. They earned spots on our team by competing in our monthly slams at Casa del Sol in Nyack, NY, and by impressing the audience at our end-of-the-season slam in late April.
Meet the Team

Adam Biggs lives in Chestnut Ridge and has been writing poetry for over 14 years. This is his second time representing our area at the National Poetry Slam. In addition to being an active participant in our events, he is also one of our organizers. His writing focuses primarily on current events, love, and heartbreak. 
Fiefie LaColla is a 19-year-old Nyack native. They've been involved with Rockland Poets for a few years, both as a performer and as an organizer. You might see Fiefie around Nyack, working at a restaurant or cafe or playing music in front of Starbucks. Fiefie's work deals with identity, death, love, and body image.
Greg Bassell lives in Nanuet with his wife, Nikki. He's a physical therapist and has been a member of Rockland Poets since it was founded as Suffern Poetry in an art gallery in Suffern back in 2011. This is his first time competing at the National Poetry Slam as a team member. His work is often silly, accessible, and bird. 
Nick Yuk is from New Jersey. Sad. He's been a part of our poetry scene for over three years and is one of our organizers. He's been to NPS both on our team and on Advanced Slam (the Staten Island team). When he's not performing, he manages a 7-11. His work is primarily about depression, alcoholism, and self-harm.
Sean O'Reilly is a relative newcomer to our slam scene. He also lives somewhere in New Jersey. In addition to doing performance poetry, he is also a rapper and a cartoonist. His work deals with mental illness, religion, sexuality, and anger.

story:
New WallSt Associates build and manage luxury co-working spaces for businesses to create career opportunity, and drive profit! :

  • We are "New WallSt Associates" the leader in  building a thriving business community!
  • This is important to us, because we are providing a way for the the community to empower its self, build wealth, and instill a since of pride. 
  • The most important part of this process is the power of the people. We want each individual to put there personal contribution as a unique stamp on what we are building.
  • Our Model is about unity  and innovation.
  • Website Link: newwallsta.com

What We Need & What You Get

All contributors will receive Loyalty perks from the business!

  • We are seeking to raise $50,000. Reaching our goal will allow us to renovate the space to make it an open concept. Provide Multiple office spaces. As well as provide a boardroom space. Finally the Grand opening 
  • If the goal is not reached then the plans will still come to life with funds that have been raised.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will be the spark, that builds the urban core as a thriving place in all cities across the United States.
  • This building will be a safe heaven for ambitious honest business owners. The community that we build will be the community one stop shop! Come be apart of the process!

Risks & Challenges

Our Biggest challenge will be to insure that the building is up to code.

  • Our team is spear headed by two outstanding visionary business leaders; Janay White, Rodney Cooper! They have an impeccable track record of building businesses up and inspiring others to do the same. Their number one rule is; to do good business and spread positive energy!
  • Our team specializes in problem solving. Any challenges that we face will be over come with passion, strategic planning, determination and consistency.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to funding goal, you are still just as important:

  • We need everyone to share the information of this campaign to there friends and family. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

The Vision of the DIGITAL CYPRUS project is to create a digital space where practically everything related to Cyprus is hosted and/or documented and/or linked in order to facilitate optimal dissemination, exchange and exploitation of relevant and important information.

The Mission of the DIGITAL CYPRUS project is to engage all possible stakeholders interested in Cyprus from any perspective to publish their content online harnessing the potentials of “crowd-sourcing” thus facilitating the digitalization of practically everything related to Cyprus.

Platform: The system utilizes the advantages offered through peer-review by using the MediaWiki™ (i.e., the same open source system that runs Wikipedia™) as its platform. The experimental version has been launched atwww.digital-cyprus.euand anyone interested to contribute is invited to create an account and join the team of editors. 

What is it: Digital Cyprus is an online platform aiming to provide all there is to know about Cyprus and its inhabitants making this the most popular site when it comes to any content request about the island. The platform’s information will be authored and edited by the public, offering the opportunity to share knowledge thus its success depends on the people who love to learn and share knowledge and have a great appreciation for the island. Digital Cyprus’ mission is to create and empower an online volunteer community who will help to gather this knowledge and make it available for everyone to read. 

Who Created it: The Digital Cyprus project is inspired and promoted by Future Worlds Center and will be eventually owned and maintained by the Digital Cyprus Foundation, a Cyprus based nonprofit organization who is currently under formation. The platform can be accessed at www.digitalcyprus.eu(currently available to the working teams with the aim to go live by November 2014). The platform has been created utilizing the free software open source wiki package, originally created and used on Wikipedia. 

For reasons that our beyond the purpose of this document, Cyprus has not managed to fully exploit the power of digital technologies and, except for some cases, join the digital revolution.

The project falls within the Europe 2020 EU's growth strategy for the coming decade, the European Commission’s Digital Agenda[1], the Onlife Manifesto[2], as well as Cyprus 2020 strategy. It has been envisioned by Dr. Yiannis Laouris[3]of Future Worlds Center[4](also member of the Onlife Initiative[5]of EC’s Digital Futures) and is under the Auspices of Dr. Stelios Himonas[6], Digital Champion of Cyprus[7].

The creation of the system will take advantage of both the vision and the technical expertise of Future Worlds Center, which has been responsible for at least two relevant “digital agenda” projects.

 

[1]http://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/en

[2]https://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/en/onlife-o...

[3]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yiannis_Laouris

[4]http://futureworlds.eu

[5]https://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/en/onlife-i...

[6]https://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/node/10635

[7]http://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/en/digital-c...

 

What We Need & What You Get

The platform was launched to the public just a few months with the generous support of a small grant by the Ministry of Energy, Commerce and Industry of Cyprus. Its success will, however, totally rely on the work of volunteers and donors. This is our first public campaign. Help us succeed. Your name will be published on line at:
http://www.digitalcyprus.eu/w/List_of_Donors

 

The Impact

Digital Cyprus is not interested only about subjects that are encyclopedic interest (and thus mostly historical), but also about contemporary issues. Serves as focal point for those interested in something to connect and get involved.

Digital Cyprus’ second most important goal is to contribute towards rendering the people of Cyprus technologically fit for the digital era. To achieve this, it introduces and teaches the basics of coding: to draft or edit a page, one has to use and learn MediaWiki’s markup language; a language that is easy for anyone.

Digital Cyprus’ third most important goal is to cultivate openness and acceptance of a different point of view within the Cyprus public. To achieve this goal, in some cases debates will not only be allowed but also kindled; e.g., within sensitive sections such as politics and religion.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You will be helping us a lot more of you decide to join and create and/or improve articles. Please contact us.

If you are "owner" of any type of content, contact us to discuss about strategic collaborations.

story:
[images of works by Yoko Ono, Masami Teraoka, David Medalla]

As a medical caregiver and international contemporary art curator since the 80s in Honolulu, Los Angeles, and New York City, I've worked directly with many of you, with friends of friends, as well as friends-to-be on projects from Santiago to Yokohama, from Beijing to Split, from Vienna to Dubai, and points between. These museum, gallery, and pop-up exhibitions have touched hundreds of families and individuals and I entreat your assistance with making Artropocene: iBiennale 2019 a reality.

Our iBiennale team consists of Assistant Director Jennifer Francis, Artistic Director Betty Martin, Project Manager Amber Kahn, and Co-Chairs David Medalla and Adam Nankervis from the London Biennale. We are grateful to our primary advisors Sherrill Kazan of the World Council of Peoples for the United Nations, Elizabeta Betinski of LA Bardo, and Eric Shiner of White Cube. We are very thankful to Jian Jie Ji and Yida Wang for the use of their stunning venue, Ycenter for Visual Arts.

This inaugural iBiennale presents the urgent issues of our humanity and environment, highlighting the essential role of artists in the age of social responsibility and activism. Among the critical topics, cultural preservation, nuclear proliferation, forced migration, global warming, interpersonal violence, and gender equality are addressed.

Artropocene presents opportunities for international cultural exchanges as artists from the Pacific region and Honolulu gain prominence. There are sixty-four artists from seventeen countries with more than a third of the artists from Hawai'i.

iBiennale acknowledges, builds on and supports the efforts of the numerous individuals who have gone before us who championed the arts and cultures of the Hawaiian islands for the last several decades.

iBiennale is a sustainable model that will highlight how island cultures can serve as catalysts that generate new discussions and art practices. Originating in the Hawaiian archipelago, this inaugural art and culture summit will pilot new artistic expressions. Future iterations of iBiennale will be similarly inspired by the nature of their host islands.

iBiennale is a grassroots upstart startup, We are striving to meet our goal of raising $9,000 to initiate this international event of which Hawai'i residents can be proud. If we don't meet our entire goal, the funds will be proportionately paid out to those who unsparingly gave us their time, efforts, and in-kind services.

Your vital contributions will allow us to ultimately succeed in mounting a world class international art and culture summit presenting artists who will interface with Hawaii's creative communities through their artwork, performances, and workshops. In addition, the itinerant nature of iBiennale will take the concept of aloha beyond our Hawaiian shores with future iterations on other islands around the globe.

Mahalo nui for your generous and much needed support!! Your perk is a commemorative Artropocene: iBiennale MMXIX poster or card signed by the participating artist of your choice (with a few exceptions).

For more information, please go to the website www.ibienale.org, please like us on Facebook (ibiennale) and Instagram (ibiennale) and repost in your networks, thanks! Email: kjb@ibiennale.org

Malama pono,

Koan Jeff Baysa, Director - Artropocene: iBiennale MMXIX
