story:
Our Story

In 2017, we launched Hapa Mag, inspired by our Editor-In-Chief’s former blog called Me So Hapa. 

For many of us, it has come to represent a space for us to express our mixed racial heritage with Asian/Pacific Islander ancestry. To be Hapa is to be part of a diverse and growing community with many perspectives. In 2021, we made the decision to move to a broader future by re-naming ourselves 

MIXED ASIAN MEDIA (MAM) is a collective created by multiracial, mixed Asian/Pacific Islanders Americans (APIA's). We seek to build a community within this group through conversations of what it means to be of mixed Asian/Pacific Islander descent and find intersectionality in our search for our ever-evolving place in society.

 

What We Do

We provide a platform to explore pertinent experiences, build powerful relationships, and discover sought-after clarity in the mixed-Asian narrative. We believe that representation and diversity matters in all mediums. From every issue of the magazine to an annual creative festival, we strive to capture mixed Asian/Pacific Islander American (APIA) stories and experiences throughout all of our current and future mediums.

 

Why Are We Crowdfunding?

Last year we were featured as one of three online magazines in the Nielsen Consumer Report on engaging Asian American consumers. Our publication has featured such notable mixed Asians as Apolo Ohno, Jessica Henwick, Midori Francis, Jason Tobin, and Andrew Koji, to name a few. We also had over 1.1 million impressions from Google search results the past year.

We have been a volunteer-based organization since 2017. With the name change and re-brand, our hope is to be able to financially cover our business operation, including but not limited to, paying our staff and magazine writers, purchasing a password manager, and upgrading our email suite. We will also be able support our larger projects such as the Mixed Asian Media Festival in September 2021 and cover Mixed Asian Media’s photo and video production costs for the remainder of 2021.  

 

Your donation is tax-deductible. 

Thank you to Leviathan Lab, an award-winning not-for-profit creative studio whose mission is the advancement of Asian and Asian American (A/AA) performing artists and their work, for supporting us as a fiscal sponsor.

Tax receipts will be issued from Leviathan Lab once the campaign has concluded. 

 

Mixed Asian Media Festival 

This September, we will be hosting our first-ever Mixed Asian Media Fest (MAM Fest). A 5-day virtual festival featuring Asians of mixed heritage in film and various entertainment mediums. It is our goal to continue to create space and community through representation in the media. 

We estimate having around 200 attendees and over 50,000 digital impressions.

 

Our Budget

Funds will be first and foremost allocated to the Mixed Asian Media Festival. ​

MAM Q2-Q4 2021 BUDGET

Admin Fees: $1,500

Email Upgrade & Password Manager: $500

Staff: $2,500

Writers: $2,500

Photo Production: $1,500

Video Production: $1,500

Total: $10,000

 

MAM FEST 2021 BUDGET

Speaker Fees: $3,000

Staff Fees: $3,000

Awards: $2,500

Merchandise: $2,500

Marketing: $2,500

Overages: $1,500

Total: $15,000

 

TOTAL 2021 BUDGET

MAM: $10,000

MAM Fest: $15,000

Total: $25,000

 

By the Numbers

1.1M Impressions from Search Results on Google in 12 months

25.2K Clicks from Search Results on Google in 12 months

131 Monthly Impressions on Google

79K Annual Website Traffic

79K Annual Website Page Views

459 Current Newsletter Subscribers

 

What Our Community is Saying 

Thank you for your insightful & helpful words. The whole “white passing” issue made the hair on the back of my neck stand up! This is a topic worth discussing further... Thank you also for organizing a creative project. Grateful for this.

I’m SO stoked about this. All my life I’ve always felt like it was hard to navigate my identity and find other Hapa people in my community, so grateful that this platform exists and people like you are creating a sense of community and safe space for us.

Thank you for writing this. As a child of mixed race and as a mother of a child who “looks just like his dad,” thank you.

I love this so much and is especially important to me today of all days. Thank you for this. ❤️

This is the crossover we all needed!!...you’re all inspirational~

Yessss! I’m a Hapa stand-up too I can’t wait to see this!!

I've never felt something to be more true.

Love what you all are doing!

The content we need. ❤️

The story of my life.

This made my cry!

 

Risks & Challenges

Due to COVID-19, our volunteer-based staff is still running Hapa Mag, but now without stable salaries from other jobs. 2020 was a year of exponential growth in terms of our readership, recognition, and business developments. We’ve been putting in extra hours to develop and strategize our business plan. We continue to work because we believe in our mission, and we believe our efforts have developed a viable product and will lead to profits and recognition as a leading mainstream mixed Asian franchise.

Without funding, MAM and MAM Fest will continue, but we will need to continue to rely on our volunteer staff. Our founder will have to continue to pay expenses out of pocket, and the organization will continue to be in the red for the remainder of 2021. 

COVID-19 also affected us in a completely different aspect. The current pandemic gave rise to a strong wave of anti-Asian sentiment and blatant acts of racism. We at Hapa Mag soon to be MIXED ASIAN MEDIA, along with the rest of Asian American society, have worked hard to combat this, and we’ve pushed through harmful stereotypes to portray the ever-growing, diverse, Asian demographic as a positive and beautiful community. #STOPAAPIHATE #STANDWITHASIANS

 

For Your Support

  • Thank You Note 
  • Free Year Long Subscription to MAM 
  • Meet & Greet with the Staff
  • Names in MAM Fest Program
  • Signed MAM Fest Posters
  • VIP Tickets to MAM Fest
  • Discounts on APIA owned businesses
  • Hapa Mag Merch 
  • New MAM Fest Merch

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We aren’t just looking for funding support!

1) Be a part of the MAM Community by following us on social media @thehapamag @mixedasianmediafest

2) We are also looking for speakers, sponsors, and community partnerships, so feel free to reach out mixedasianmediafest@gmail.com 

3) You can also get the word out about our Indiegogo campaign using the share tools below or our specially made outreach package.

MAM Fest: $15,000
Total: $25,000
 

By the Numbers
1.1M Impressions from Search Results on Google in 12 months
25.2K Clicks from Search Results on Google in 12 months
131 Monthly Impressions on Google
79K Annual Website Traffic
79K Annual Website Page Views
459 Current Newsletter Subscribers
 
What Our Community is Saying 
Thank you for your insightful & helpful words. The whole “white passing” issue made the hair on the back of my neck stand up! This is a topic worth discussing further... Thank you also for organizing a creative project. Grateful for this.
I’m SO stoked about this. All my life I’ve always felt like it was hard to navigate my identity and find other Hapa people in my community, so grateful that this platform exists and people like you are creating a sense of community and safe space for us.
Thank you for writing this. As a child of mixed race and as a mother of a child who “looks just like his dad,” thank you.
I love this so much and is especially important to me today of all days. Thank you for this. ❤️
This is the crossover we all needed!!...you’re all inspirational~
Yessss! I’m a Hapa stand-up too I can’t wait to see this!!
I've never felt something to be more true.
Love what you all are doing!
The content we need. ❤️
The story of my life.
This made my cry!

 
Risks & Challenges
Due to COVID-19, our volunteer-based staff is still running Hapa Mag, but now without stable salaries from other jobs. 2020 was a year of exponential growth in terms of our readership, recognition, and business developments. We’ve been putting in extra hours to develop and strategize our business plan. We continue to work because we believe in our mission, and we believe our efforts have developed a viable product and will lead to profits and recognition as a leading mainstream mixed Asian franchise.
Without funding, MAM and MAM Fest will continue, but we will need to continue to rely on our volunteer staff. Our founder will have to continue to pay expenses out of pocket, and the organization will continue to be in the red for the remainder of 2021. 
COVID-19 also affected us in a completely different aspect. The current pandemic gave rise to a strong wave of anti-Asian sentiment and blatant acts of racism. We at Hapa Mag soon to be MIXED ASIAN MEDIA, along with the rest of Asian American society, have worked hard to combat this, and we’ve pushed through harmful stereotypes to portray the ever-growing, diverse, Asian demographic as a positive and beautiful community. #STOPAAPIHATE #STANDWITHASIANS
 
For Your Support

Thank You Note 
Free Year Long Subscription to MAM 
Meet & Greet with the Staff
Names in MAM Fest Program
Signed MAM Fest Posters
VIP Tickets to MAM Fest
Discounts on APIA owned businesses
Hapa Mag Merch 
New MAM Fest Merch

 

Other Ways You Can Help
We aren’t just looking for funding support!
1) Be a part of the MAM Community by following us on social media @thehapamag @mixedasianmediafest
2) We are also looking for speakers, sponsors, and community partnerships, so feel free to reach out mixedasianmediafest@gmail.com 
3) You can also get the word out about our Indiegogo campaign using the share tools below or our specially made outreach package.

story:
CAKES is run by Emily and Clara: both working class sex workers in the Seattle area.  Emily is a second generation sex worker with a history of legislative  activism, Clara is a former social worker with a history of labor unionizing. With those powers combined - They are coffee drinking rabble rousers!

CAKES was born out of the need to fill the service gaps in both the Seattle/Tacoma sex work scene and  also nationally.  

We have worked hard to get where we are now. We have 

-Hosted solidarity meetings 

-Created our own Etsy store 

-Created an national (soon to be international) rape/sexual assault helpline 

-Hosted a small fundraiser 

-Maintained website/social media  

With your help we can not only continue to do these things -and  also expedite our other projects!

We have run CAKES by ourselves and our own money + a few donations since August 2016. Due to the shift in political climate, our customer base is not as generous - neither are our donors.   

A typical monthly CAKES budget is $700. This includes the monthly bills from our rape/crisis hotline, rental hall meetings, volunteer food, website fees. This also averages the amount spent on marketing materials and venues.  

Our ask of $10,000 is roughly the amount (after fees) we need to keep CAKES going for a year.  This influx will help us plan for the future and be more effective in lending assistance. 

If we do not receive the full amount- we will of course continue to self fund the best  we can- but services and scope will be smaller.  

 

We have some amazing perks for you! -->

If you can’t donate a large amount now 

-Please share on social media!

-If this crowdfunding goes well we might be opening a Patreon for our monthly bills. 

Prefer to Donate Anon? 

You don't have to use your legal name to get perks! 

We will hand deliver Seattle/PDX/Chicago Perks if you do not want to share your mailing address. 

-We also take cash. Email us to arrange. 

Also Amazon GC send to info@pnwcakes.com are great! (no perks unless over $100) 

We get supplies for our Outreach and other things there. 

You can send Square donation to https://cash.me/$PNWCakes 

in the notes write your name,email  and perk you want! 

Questions/Comments/Concerns? 

Email is at info@pnwcakes.com

story:
WHAT IS ANNO DOMINI?

(In basso trovi la versione in italiano  )

With Anno Domini 568, reenactment, reconstruction and research entwine and combine for two days in the Dukedom capitol, Cividale del Friuli.

Two days of conferences and seminars about Lombard and early medieval history and archaeology.
Two days of meetings and demonstrations with reenactors coming from all across Europe.
Two days of living history, story telling and reenactment.

The Spirit Of ANNO DOMINI 568

Past Editions

Anno Domini was born with a little encampment and a handful of didactic meetings and later evolved, increasing in quality during the years and developing a cooperation with the Museo Archeologico Nazionale in Cividale del Friuli.

During the years our target moved forward and defined a new way to communicate history and thirst for knowledge.

At every event, we have been honoured by the presence of new and veteran groups coming both from Italy and from abroad, bringing their skills and allowing us to make comparison between Lombards and other contemporary cultures.

2016 was a game changing year: Anno Domini 586 took place entirely in the Museo Archeologico Nazionale’ s premises, with the museum itself  actively cooperating with La Fara in the event organization.

2017 Edition

In 2017 the event will be focusing on jewellery and goldsmithing; gathering reenactors, reconstruction experts and researchers from across Europe.

Why do we need your help?

Anno Domini 568 is funded up to 80% by La Fara members.

passionate reenactors who 365 days per year bring a new way to share their love for history among people, at school and in museums.

For this year’s edition of Anno Domini 568 we would like to go bigger, offering a congress with renowned scholars from across the English Channel and some of the best Early Medieval European reenacting companies.

With your contribution a high quality, immersive experience will be possible; ranging from scholar lectures, to crafts demonstrations, storytelling and much more.


We need your help to make it unique!

 

La Fara Keychain

La Fara t-shirt

(girl not included)

A day with La Fara

(learn, eat, sleep, reenact)

 
FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK!

 

 

 

COS'E' ANNO DOMINI 568

(Scroll Up for English Version )

Con Anno Domini 568 rievocazione, ricostruzione e ricerca storica si intrecciano e amalgamano per due giorni nella Capitale del Ducato Cividale del Friuli.

Due giorni di convegni e conferenze sulla storia e sull'archeologia Longobarda ed altomedievale.

Due giorni di dimostrazioni ed incontri con rievocatori da tutta europa.

Due giorni di living history, story telling e reenactment.

Lo spirito di ANNO DOMINI 568

Le edizioni passate

Anno Domini è nato con un piccolo campo storico e qualche incontro didattico per poi evolversi in qualità nel corso degli anni fino a definire uno stretto legame con il Museo Archeologico Nazionale di Cividale del Friuli.

Nel corso degli anni il nostro target si è spostato ed ha definito un nuovo modo di comunicare la storia  la voglia di sapere.

Ad ogni evento ci hanno onorato della loro presenza gruppi nascenti e veterani sia del suolo italico che provenienti dall'estero, portando la loro cultura e permettendoci un confronto tra i Longobardi e le popolazioni coeve.

Il 2016 segna la svolta, con un Anno Domini 568 con un evento ospitato interamente dentro Museo Archeologico Nazionale di Cividale del Friuli, oramai collaboratore ufficiale dell'evento e del gruppo La Fara. 

L'edizione 2017

L'edizione 2017 verterà sull'oreficeria ed i metalli preziosi, richiamando da tutta europa rievocatori ricostruttori e ricercatori.

Perché abbiamo bisogno di voi

Anno Domini 568 è un evento autofinanziato per l'80% dai membri del gruppo La Fara.

Rievocatori appassionati che per 365 giorni l'anno portano un nuovo modo di insegnare la storia tra la gente, le classi ed i musei.

Per questa edizione di Anno Domini 568 vorremmo fare le cose in grande, con conferenze di professori d'oltre manica ed alcuni dei migliori gruppi di rievocazione altomedievale in Europa.

Con il vostro contributo sarà possibile offrire un’esperienza immersiva di alta qualità, che spazia dal convegno, alle dimostrazioni artigianali, allo storytelling ed altro ancora.


Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto per renderla unica!

Portachiavi La Fara

Maglietta La Fara

(ragazza non inclusa)

Una giornata con La Fara

(mangia, impara, rievoca, dormi)

 

 
SEGUICI SU FACEBOOK!

story:
Why Paris?

Hi, I'm Clive Matson, a poet who cut his literary teeth in 1960's New York City among the Beats.   In September 2017, the European Beat Scholars Network will hold their annual conference in Paris.  This group of scholars and fans of Beat literature help to promote the reading, critiquing and study of the last great American literary movement, which occurred over 50 years ago.  Today that movement has regained its relevance in an age of global crisis, when people do not trust government to solve their problems, when we are faced with the possibility of extinction of the human race, along with many other species.  Young people are turning more and more to the arts, and specifically poetry, as an expression of our dismay, our hope, our possibility of a future.

Paris is a significant site for this conference, not only because some of the most prominent and well-known of the Beats, Allen Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Jack Kerouac and Gregory Corso, sojourned in Paris, but because it is also the city of the Climate Accord.  In Paris, in conjunction with the conference,  I will perform the World debut reading of  Hello Paradise, Paradise Good-Bye, my long poem on the threat to human existence posed by current world conditions.

In addition to myself, the EBSN Conference will host three other people with personal connections to the Beat Generation: Bonnie Bremser, memoirist of the Beat Generation, Eila Kokkinen, art editor of the Chicago Review when the Regents censored the publication of works by Burroughs, Ginsberg and Dahlberg in 1958, and Jerome Poynton, friend and excecutor of the literary estate of Herbert Huncke, progenitor of the Beats. 

Our attempt to raise airfare, accommodations and related expenses will make possible  a direct communication with a past in America that has been neglected and suppressed.  The development of the Summer of Love in 1967, the Hippies, the protest against the Vietnam War and all subsequent war protests, human rights campaigns, the threat of species extinction and climate change, and the hope for a better world stem from the honest and authentic questioning of who we are and what is important in life, first posed by the Beats.  Now that history and that proposition formulated by the Beat authors, artists, and film makers is relevant again.  The dialogue that will occur in Paris in September will profoundly frame the issues we face today. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately 20,000 dollars to do this right.  Airfare, accommodations, food and other expenses for the participants is essential.  No-one gets rich as an artist.  Be it poetry, literature, art, film, most artists barely get by while dedicating their life to their art.  Without them, what kind of world would we live in?  Today, that struggle is even worse, given the cost of housing and the other necessities of life.  The recent Ghost Ship fire in Oakland, CA, where we are based, is an example of the struggle artists face every day to survive and continue their work.  

In addition, we hope to create a short film on the Beats for showing in France, an after-Paris poetry tour of Germany, a possible CD of poetry readings and jazz, a form revived by the Beats in the 1950's and gaining popularity now.  But first and foremost, help us present to the Europeans some of the last survivors of the Beat Generation, with the opportunity to tell their first hand stories of a remarkable time in American letters.

This tour is sponsored by WordSwell, a 501(c)(3) corporation, committed to the advancement of the written word and opportunities for anyone to test their creative urges through low cost writing workshops.  All donations are tax-deductible and, where available, matching funds are provided by employers.

The obstacles to achieving our goals are many, but that should not stop anyone from promoting the truth, authenticity and honesty, as did the Beats in their day.  America and, indeed, the World are gravely in need of such approaches to life, as we face crises that can seem insurmountable globally.

There are many risks and challenges for us today, particularly in America where Federal funding for the Arts appears under threat.  We have politicians who cannot see the essential need for support for creative expression throughout our society, but the need exists nonetheless.  That includes our history as a people, and the significance of the various Bohemian art movements that created new attitudes and awareness through their exploitation of what seemed to be the outrageous.  Without those challenges to authority and conformity, we would be a poorer nation.

We can understand if you are unable to contribute at this time.  We only ask that you share our campaign with your friends and like-minded individuals.  Please help us, in this time of new threats to our creativity and freedom, to spread the word.  Help the Beats to, once again, share their experiences and observations in Paris and in the Greater World.  Share our Indiegogo campaign with friends!

For every donation over 50.00 USD you get a choice of one of the following books and videos by Clive Matson: Squish Boots, The Chalcedony Songs: Books One and Two or a DVD of Clive's performances with Gael Alcock, cellist.

story:
Pourquoi nous aider?

Le festival s'est toujours démarqué par son caractère non-commercial et par ses alternatives vis-à-vis l'industrie. D'ailleurs, un des piliers de sa réussite est sans contredit l'implication bénévole et collective. Le temps d'une fin de semaine, c'est des gens funky de partout dans le monde qui se réunissent pour faire du bruit et échanger. Malheureusement, tout ça coûte quand même quelque chose. Les dépenses sont minimes, mais sortent de la poche de l'organisation et nous sommes tristement pauvres ! 

Pour nous aider, c'est vraiment très très simple et tu verras à ta droite tous les cadeaux disponibles ! En passant d'un simple coup de pouce à l'achat d'un autobus à ton nom, tout est là. Si on parvient à notre objectif, on te promet une folle édition et notre éternel respect.  

 L'impact

L'an dernier, 10 000$ ont été amassés avec la vente d'alcool seulement. C'est beaucoup d'argent diriez-vous, mais il en manque encore un peu pour couvrir : l'achat de 120 caisses de bières pour votre plaisir, la tente du SHAMAN, la location de l'Auberge, l'équipement sonore, les verres réutilisables, les permis, le site web, les assurances et autres platitudes administratives. Bref, 2500$ pour nous représente ni plus ni moins que l'autonomie de l'événement. 

    D'autres façons d'aider

    Tu peux contribuer en faisant un don et tu peux aussi aider...

    AVANT

    En parlant de l'événement 
    (motive ta gang à venir du 1er au 4 juin!)

    En nous suivant sur Facebook et sur Instagram
    (aime et partage les posts et la campagne de socio-financement!)

    En te mettant en mode festif et collectif
    (tu craches du feu, tu aimes construire des trucs, tu as des choses à donner, du covoiturage à offrir, etc...)


    PENDANT

    Propose ton aide comme bénévole
    (pour ramasser la scrap ou pour les imprévus)

    Fais du bruit
    (va aux shows, regarde des performances, parle à tout le monde, rêve!)

    Bois la bière du Grand Tintamarre à Tadoussac
    (5 consommations moyennant 20$ et paf, le tour est joué!)

    APRÈS

    Dors......
    (oui, dors!)

    Découvre en profondeur les artistes de l'édition
    (aime leur page et va à leur prochain show!)

    Reste avec nous
    (aime les photos de l'événement, reviens-nous l'an prochain)
     

    Ça sonne bien?

    Oui il existe la marge de crédit, mais on préfère ton aide !

    Article paru dans Le Ricochet l'an dernier:
    https://ricochet.media/fr/1187/les-defis-dun-fe...

En passant d'un simple coup de pouce à l'achat d'un autobus à ton nom, tout est là. Si on parvient à notre objectif, on te promet une folle édition et notre éternel respect.  

 L'impact
L'an dernier, 10 000$ ont été amassés avec la vente d'alcool seulement. C'est beaucoup d'argent diriez-vous, mais il en manque encore un peu pour couvrir : l'achat de 120 caisses de bières pour votre plaisir, la tente du SHAMAN, la location de l'Auberge, l'équipement sonore, les verres réutilisables, les permis, le site web, les assurances et autres platitudes administratives. Bref, 2500$ pour nous représente ni plus ni moins que l'autonomie de l'événement. 


D'autres façons d'aider
Tu peux contribuer en faisant un don et tu peux aussi aider...AVANTEn parlant de l'événement (motive ta gang à venir du 1er au 4 juin!)
En nous suivant sur Facebook et sur Instagram(aime et partage les posts et la campagne de socio-financement!)En te mettant en mode festif et collectif(tu craches du feu, tu aimes construire des trucs, tu as des choses à donner, du covoiturage à offrir, etc...)
PENDANT
Propose ton aide comme bénévole(pour ramasser la scrap ou pour les imprévus)Fais du bruit(va aux shows, regarde des performances, parle à tout le monde, rêve!)Bois la bière du Grand Tintamarre à Tadoussac(5 consommations moyennant 20$ et paf, le tour est joué!)APRÈSDors......(oui, dors!)Découvre en profondeur les artistes de l'édition(aime leur page et va à leur prochain show!)Reste avec nous(aime les photos de l'événement, reviens-nous l'an prochain) 
Ça sonne bien?
Oui il existe la marge de crédit, mais on préfère ton aide !Article paru dans Le Ricochet l'an dernier:https://ricochet.media/fr/1187/les-defis-dun-fe...

story:
Downtown Soul 2017

In 2016, a new avenue for fresh, original, local and regional talent entered the Elkhart, Indiana entertainment scene. The Downtown Soul Art and Music Series hosted diverse visual and musical artists, and connected them with a diverse audience. The 2016 Downtown Soul Art and Music Series provided a unique space to host local and regional talent. Our strong commitment to diversity is evident in the selected artists and performers on our lineup, which in turn attracted the vibrant mix of people who enliven our city. The 2017 season returns to The Electric Brew coffee shop and features a new lineup of rising and established talent. The new series will run from July through November, and we need partners to keep the creative energy flowing!

Downtown Soul is for everyone.

Downtown Soul is a small-but-mighty volunteer effort that supports the creative expression of our neighbors. That means that every hour of organizing and every dollar collected goes into celebrating the aspirations and abilities of the artists we feature and providing a platform for their gifts. Through our partnership with The Electric Brew and collaborations with other downtown businesses, we also (re)introduce people to one of our city’s entertainment hubs and invite neighbors from across the city to be part of its renewal. Beyond hosting concerts, Downtown Soul invests in the people that make Elkhart beautiful, in the folks who want an enjoyable, affordable night out close to home, and in the small businesses who help make downtown a great place to be.

Downtown Soul needs your sponsorship.

The last season of Downtown Soul relied heavily on borrowed audio equipment, which made preparing for each show a tightrope dance. Our commitment to low tickets costs, while highlighting the best of original local and regional talent, also meant using personal funds to cover performer's fees. This season, we plan to purchase equipment to ensure excellent sound for any size band. We are also eager to have guaranteed payment for the artists who give us shows to remember. This campaign will not only take this season to the next level: it will also set us up for the future as dollars collected at the door this year will give us a foundation for 2018.

Downtown Soul directs funds where needed most.

Dollars raised here will be used to develop the Downtown Soul Art and Music Series. Said plainly, we will use the funds to pay our performers, purchase better equipment, and offer a very modest honorarium for our sound technician and in house DJ. Everything we take in from ticket sales at the door will cover any unanticipated costs and be banked for our third season. Thanks to the generosity of The Electric Brew in Elkhart and our marketing strategy, proceeds have not gone toward space usage, Brew staff or event publicity.

Fair pay for all our musicians: Downtown Soul is dedicated to paying musicians. This commitment is especially important because we require performers to play all original music (no covers) at our shows. That means our artists are compensated, not only for the night they play, but also as a token for the countless hours of creativity they put into each lyric and every note. Our team has no bigger priority than making sure our musicians receive what they deserve for all they bring to our stage.

Solid sound equipment for an excellent listening experience: With your help, we can purchase crucial pieces of a sound system robust enough to support a wide variety of performers at The Electric Brew and beyond. The system will include 16 channels and enough power and projection to fill a medium sized venue. While the coffeehouse is small, we anticipate growth over time and want to stay ahead of demand.

Support for our sound technician and house DJ: Good equipment requires skilled hands and a trained ear to meet the needs of every musician during their set. The series also features a house DJ who entertains the crowd before the show begins and during intermission. We want to honor them for all they do to make our series great.

Altogether, the campaign goal of $2465 gives us what we need for this second season.

Downtown Soul quick facts:

Schedule and tickets: Every second Saturday, July-November | $8 per show
Location: The Electric Brew in Elkhart, 113 Lexington Avenue, 46516
Organizers: Nekeisha Alayna Alexis, Dorothy Jean Carter and Jason Brewer
Website: www.facebook.com/downtownsoulelkhart
Read about us: Downtown Soul in Gateway Mile Magazine

Season one musicians: After Ours, Can of Bliss, The Go Rounds, Good Edgar Oak, Imaginary Friends, Infinite Buffalo, Lady Sax, Seth Martin, The White Oaks.

Season one visual artists: 4am Art Loft, Mikayla Bedward, Pam Blair, Jason Brewer, Dorothy Jean Carter, Teresa Cox, SaeJin Lee, Rachel Thompson, Jake Webster and George Williams.

Downtown Soul invites you to join the team.

Giving to the Downtown Soul Art and Music Series not only strengthens our local art and music scene. It also offers people from different cultural and social backgrounds a lively monthly experience, uncovers the richness of our community, and increases awareness of all Elkhart has to offer in our downtown and across our city. We hope you’ll join Team Soul—and pick up a few perks along the way!

story:
Hello, Dear Friends!

Let me first introduce myself. My name is Mohamed Swaleh Ali, but most people know me by my nicknames, “Moody,” “Moodyblooz,” or “King Mohamed.” I was born here in Kenya, in the southern coastal village of Matondoni just north of Lamu on the Indian Ocean. I am currently living in Old Town Mombasa where I work as a tour guide. I also have an apartment (my friends call it “The Penthouse”) overlooking the harbor that I rent out to friends and guests who want to stay here in Old Town Mombasa while on holidays.

My Paradise Dhow Dream

It has been my dream, ever since I came to Mombasa and started working in the tourism industry, to own a Lamu-style dhow — a traditional sailing ship. You see hardly any traditional dhows in the old town harbor, as most of the boats here are made from fiberglass and belong to the fishermen. Although there are one or two large dhows kept by large hotels for their guests, there are no small dhows for taking locals or other tourists around Old Town harbor. Hence my dream was born — to be the first person to have a traditional dhow which would take foreign and local tourists around the harbor and parts of Mombasa Island, and showcase the beauty of the traditional coastal culture.

The traditional Lamu-styled dhow I want is known as a “Kasa” dhow. I opted for this choice, as it is relatively small and can be made of local materials. The dhow itself will be built by traditional craftsmen in one of the coastal villages here in Kenya. This will not only create employment for the locals, but the dhow, once completed, will serve as a model, showcasing local craftsmanship and hopefully acting as a catalyst in helping to revive the local boat-building industry. The dhow will also be crewed by local lads from the coast of Kenya.

Paradise Dhow Budget

The dhow will cost $20,000 to build, and another $10,000 is needed to supply the rigging, life jackets, a small motor, licensing fees, and other startup costs. After consulting with friends, crowdfunding seemed the best possibility for raising this amount, and I very much appreciate any and all contributions toward turning my dream into a reality!

Our Target of $30,000 includes the following (estimated):

  • Cost of Building Dhow = $20,000
  • Interior Finish Details = $1,500
  • Small Outboard Motor = $3,000
  • Life Jackets = $1,000
  • Team Member Salaries (6 months) = $2,000
  • Advertising = $500
  • Licensing Fees = $500
  • Transfer Dhow to Mombasa = $500
  • Miscellaneous = $1,000

Paradise Dhow Dream Team

Needless to say, I could not possibly take on making my Paradise Dhow Dream come true without knowing I have a solid, creative, dedicated team to help me put it together. I'm delighted to introduce you to my team members.

My dear friend and cousin, Warda Swabu, who I have known all my life, is a teacher and the busy mother of two small children. She is also from the coastal community of Mombasa. Warda is an excellent cook, especially of traditional Swahili food, and is looking forward to providing many special cultural delights as part of the offerings available to those taking a Paradise Dhow cruse.

Fadhil Albakre,is my old and very good friend, who I have known since childhood. Fadhil, who studied for some time in Poland, is extremely adept in the organizational aspects of creating a business. I know I can count on him to help me carry out the many details that will be involved as my Paradise Dhow Dream becomes a reality. With much knowledge, many years of experience, and much enthusiasm, Fadhil has signed on to take care of the business end of my dream, which could not come true without him.

Meet our computer whiz Jacob Cobb. Jacob was born in Mombasa, but schooled in Nairobi. As a foster child, his dreams were built in the streets of the slum known as Kibera. After studying computer applications in college, Jacob scored a job in our local cyber café, helping those with little knowledge to submit online applications, print photos, or just read their emails. He found his purpose helping others with little technical knowledge get along on computers. Jacob is also a rap musician, having grown up with and been inspired by Kenyan Rap king, "Octopizzo."

Our Paradise Dhow Captain, Shee Obo, was literally born and bred at sea. Shee is a jolly chap, whose friendly face, charming smile and lively personality can fool you into thinking he isn't cut out for the sea. But he is a true sea dog, born on a dhow and brought up on the island of Lamu. He started to crew on a dhow when he was just eight years old. With twenty-five years of experience of sailing under his belt, you can relax, take in the scenery, and perhaps enjoy our delightful homemade Swahili cuisine while Shee takes command of the dhow.

Paradise Dhow Dream Setting: Mombasa, Kenya

Visiting Mombasa is an exciting experience. This centuries-old city sits on an island in the Indian Ocean off the main shore of Kenya, and is recognized as Kenya's main tourist destination.

Mombasa was founded between the 1st and 5th century and was originally ruled by native Swahili. Its strategic position on the Indian Ocean and its very functional harbor made it an historical trading center as well as a much sought after and fought after location. Throughout its history it has been occupied by many groups, most prominently the Portuguese, Arabs, and British. The occupation of these various groups has left its mark in the richness of Mombasa's culture, and architecture especially in the Old Town section of Mombasa. Here one sees a melding of Islamic, European, and East Indian architecture and cultures with that of the original African Swahili.

Fort Jesus is Mombasa's most famous historical landmark and is a Unesco World Heritage treasure. Built by the Portuguese in 1593, it changed hands at least nine times between 1631 and the 1870s, finally falling under British control until Kenya's independence in 1963.

Mombasa's location on the Eastern Coastline of Kenya provides many beautiful beaches. Its historical and cultural heritage is enhanced by the beauty of these tropical beaches, both on its South Coast and its North Coast. The warm emerald waters are inviting to both tourists and locals and have helped to make Mombasa a major center of the East African coastal tourism industry.

The main religions of Mombasa are Islam, Hindu, and Christianity, with approximately 70 percent of the inhabitants practicing the Islamic religion. Mombasa's religious diversity is reflected in its many beautiful mosques, Hindu temples, and churches. The echos from one mosque to another of the Islamic call to prayer five times a day adds a calming and magical element to this city of rich and colorful diversity.

For those who desire to experience African wildlife, the Mombasa vicinity offers Haller Park and Simba Hills National Reserve. These locations provide lush tropical vegetation and an abundance of giraffes, hippos, elephants, monkeys, antelopes, and reptiles to observe.

Historical sites, craft and spice markets, beautiful beaches, wild animals, and fascinating people: Mombasa offers something truly special for everyone who wants to experience Africa.

Swahili: People, Religion, Language, Culture

The word Swahili means "coastal people." Historically it is believed that Swahilis emerged from the coastal part of the African Great Lakes region, mainly from areas that are now Kenya and Tanzania. Swahilis originated from the Bantu peoples who settled on the East African Coast and developed agricultural and fishing communities. These coastal sites gave rise to an ever stronger and more diverse Swahili culture through sailing and trade.

Due to their advantageous coastal location, Swahilis have evolved into a very mixed stock of people who have historically been greatly influenced by foreign trade, domination, and control. Beginning in the 12th century, the strong presence of Arabs and Persians resulted in an ever increasing Islamic influence. This has continued to the extent that today the Islamic religion and traditions govern nearly every aspect of the Swahili tribes' lives, although it is generally a much more liberal version than that practiced in the Middle East.

Swahili as a language has quite a fascinating history. It also developed out of the coastal location of the original Swahilis. It was originally adapted from the African Bantu language and enriched from the Arabic, Portuguese, and Hindu languages. It became solidified as the main language of the area as it spread through East and Central Africa along the great trade caravan routes. Today it is the national language of Kenya and of Tanzania, and is spoken in more countries and by more people than any other language in sub-Saharan Africa.

Many aspects of the Swahili culture reflect the influence of many diverse groups of people who have traded and settled in the coastal areas. Swahili cuisine has influences from India and Arabic cultures. Their main foods of fish, rice, and tropical fruits are often prepared with exotic spices. Multicultural influences can also be found in Swahili art, furniture, and architecture, although it is recognized that the original, local population were chiefly responsible for the development of the art and architecture of the Swahili coast.

story:
The female universe in the changing Africa

  • Voci Globali is an online independent magazine and a network of citizen journalism, in which journalists, activists, aid workers and scholars contribute in spreading stories related to Africa, human rights and social justice. 
  • Our fundraising campaign is designed to support the project AfroWomenPoetry (https://afrowomenpoetry.net/) : the main aim is to meet women, poets, African people who describe their surrounding environment, their struggles, their hopes through their verses. Our goal is to address the issues of the female world in Sub-Saharan African countries by giving women the opportunity to speak up. Voci Globali wants to be simply a link, ensuring a personal narrative without mediation. We believe this is an outstanding opportunity to listen to the society of African women, involving no prejudice and going beyond their ethnicity, age or social position.

You can be part of this project 

  • As you may have noticed on our website, we really believe in the value of this project, and we have launched it through self-financing. We have gotten in touch with a few Ghanaian poets, meeting them in their homes, at their workplaces, in their own communities, and willing to create a relationship. It is thanks to poetry that they let us enter their lives and those of many other women. Several topics have emerged: domestic violence, the effects of colonialism into African culture, feminism, the desire for independence, the fight against socio-cultural conventions and the rebellion against certain traditions. We are sure that, by pursuing this path, we will discover a submerged world and stories that rarely appear in the press with the actual spontaneity, the drama or the joy of those who live there. And we are sure that AfroWomenPoetry can make an accurate and original contribution to the knowledge of African women.
  • The amount of money collected will be used to cover the costs for the continuation of the project, mainly supporting travel, transport, food and accommodation costs on the spot, as well as the necessary technical equipment. Our intention is to broaden our scope to other sub-saharan African countries. We already are on our way to Togo, while the next step will take place in the East Africa.
 

L'universo femminile nell'Africa che cambia

  • Voci Globali è una testata e una rete di giornalismo partecipativo. Giornalisti, attivisti, cooperanti, studiosi che raccontano storie legate al continente africano, ai diritti umani, alla giustizia sociale.  
  • La nostra campagna di raccolta fondi è pensata per sostenere AfroWomenPoetry (https://afrowomenpoetry.net/). Il progetto si propone di incontrare donne, poete, africane che attraverso le loro parole descrivono la realtà che le circonda, le loro lotte, le loro speranze. Il nostro obiettivo è di affrontare le tematiche del mondo femminile dei Paesi dell'Africa Sub-Sahariana dando alle donne stesse la possibilità di raccontare. Voci Globali vuole semplicemente essere un tramite e far sì che la narrazione sia personale e senza mediazione. Pensiamo che sia un'occasione rara e preziosa di poter ascoltare senza pregiudizi la società delle donne africane, al di là della loro appartenenza etnica, dell'età e della posizione sociale.

Puoi far parte di questo progetto 

  • Come avrai visto dal nostro sito crediamo davvero molto al valore di questo progetto. Tanto da averlo avviato attraverso autofinanziamento. Abbiamo incontrato e conosciuto alcune poetesse ghanesi. Le abbiamo incontrate nelle loro case, sui luoghi di lavoro, nelle loro comunità, con lo spirito di creare una relazione. Attraverso la poesia ci hanno fatto entrare nella loro vita e in quella di tante altre donne. Violenza domestica, gli effetti del colonialismo nella cultura africana, femminismo, voglia di indipendenza, lotta alle convenzioni socio-culturali e ribellione a certe tradizioni: sono alcuni dei temi emersi. Siamo sicuri che continuare ci porterà a scoprire un mondo sommerso e storie che raramente compaiono sulla stampa con la naturalezza, il dramma o la gioia di chi le vive. E siamo sicuri anche che AfroWomenPoetry  possa dare un contributo attento e originale alla conoscenza delle donne africane
  • La cifra raccolta servirà a coprire le spese per la continuazione del progetto. La nostra intenzione, infatti, è di allargare lo sguardo ad altri Paesi dell'Africa Sub-Sahariana. I fondi sosterranno principalmente le spese di viaggio, trasporto, vitto e alloggio in loco, ma anche spese per la necessaria attrezzatura tecnica. Siamo già impegnati in un nuovo viaggio, in Togo, e la prossima tappa si svolgerà nell’Africa Orientale.
story_txt:
The female universe in the changing Africa

Voci Globali is an online independent magazine and a network of citizen journalism, in which journalists, activists, aid workers and scholars contribute in spreading stories related to Africa, human rights and social justice. 
Our fundraising campaign is designed to support the project AfroWomenPoetry (https://afrowomenpoetry.net/) : the main aim is to meet women, poets, African people who describe their surrounding environment, their struggles, their hopes through their verses. Our goal is to address the issues of the female world in Sub-Saharan African countries by giving women the opportunity to speak up. Voci Globali wants to be simply a link, ensuring a personal narrative without mediation. We believe this is an outstanding opportunity to listen to the society of African women, involving no prejudice and going beyond their ethnicity, age or social position.



You can be part of this project 

As you may have noticed on our website, we really believe in the value of this project, and we have launched it through self-financing. We have gotten in touch with a few Ghanaian poets, meeting them in their homes, at their workplaces, in their own communities, and willing to create a relationship. It is thanks to poetry that they let us enter their lives and those of many other women. Several topics have emerged: domestic violence, the effects of colonialism into African culture, feminism, the desire for independence, the fight against socio-cultural conventions and the rebellion against certain traditions. We are sure that, by pursuing this path, we will discover a submerged world and stories that rarely appear in the press with the actual spontaneity, the drama or the joy of those who live there. And we are sure that AfroWomenPoetry can make an accurate and original contribution to the knowledge of African women.
The amount of money collected will be used to cover the costs for the continuation of the project, mainly supporting travel, transport, food and accommodation costs on the spot, as well as the necessary technical equipment. Our intention is to broaden our scope to other sub-saharan African countries. We already are on our way to Togo, while the next step will take place in the East Africa.


 
L'universo femminile nell'Africa che cambia

Voci Globali è una testata e una rete di giornalismo partecipativo. Giornalisti, attivisti, cooperanti, studiosi che raccontano storie legate al continente africano, ai diritti umani, alla giustizia sociale.  
La nostra campagna di raccolta fondi è pensata per sostenere AfroWomenPoetry (https://afrowomenpoetry.net/). Il progetto si propone di incontrare donne, poete, africane che attraverso le loro parole descrivono la realtà che le circonda, le loro lotte, le loro speranze. Il nostro obiettivo è di affrontare le tematiche del mondo femminile dei Paesi dell'Africa Sub-Sahariana dando alle donne stesse la possibilità di raccontare. Voci Globali vuole semplicemente essere un tramite e far sì che la narrazione sia personale e senza mediazione. Pensiamo che sia un'occasione rara e preziosa di poter ascoltare senza pregiudizi la società delle donne africane, al di là della loro appartenenza etnica, dell'età e della posizione sociale.


Puoi far parte di questo progetto 

Come avrai visto dal nostro sito crediamo davvero molto al valore di questo progetto. Tanto da averlo avviato attraverso autofinanziamento. Abbiamo incontrato e conosciuto alcune poetesse ghanesi. Le abbiamo incontrate nelle loro case, sui luoghi di lavoro, nelle loro comunità, con lo spirito di creare una relazione. Attraverso la poesia ci hanno fatto entrare nella loro vita e in quella di tante altre donne. Violenza domestica, gli effetti del colonialismo nella cultura africana, femminismo, voglia di indipendenza, lotta alle convenzioni socio-culturali e ribellione a certe tradizioni: sono alcuni dei temi emersi. Siamo sicuri che continuare ci porterà a scoprire un mondo sommerso e storie che raramente compaiono sulla stampa con la naturalezza, il dramma o la gioia di chi le vive. E siamo sicuri anche che AfroWomenPoetry  possa dare un contributo attento e originale alla conoscenza delle donne africane
La cifra raccolta servirà a coprire le spese per la continuazione del progetto. La nostra intenzione, infatti, è di allargare lo sguardo ad altri Paesi dell'Africa Sub-Sahariana. I fondi sosterranno principalmente le spese di viaggio, trasporto, vitto e alloggio in loco, ma anche spese per la necessaria attrezzatura tecnica. Siamo già impegnati in un nuovo viaggio, in Togo, e la prossima tappa si svolgerà nell’Africa Orientale.

story:
Le cose illuminate

  • SassiScritti crede che tutto accada nella relazione. Con l'altro, con il paesaggio, con l'invisibile. Per questo ogni nostro appuntamento è pensato per favorire incontri che siano possibilità di stringere legami, e diventino ricordi della vita di ciascuno.
  • Teniamo molto a portare di nuovo a Pistoia, dopo un periodo di assenza, la nostra idea di cultura. Farlo per una ricorrenza tanto importante come ricordare Sergio Salabelle, persona che ha creato un centro di cultura e aggregazione importante come la libreria Les Bouquinistes, è un moto di gratitudine per chi in città ha sempre messo l'amore per i libri e l'arte al centro, diventando fulcro per la comunità.
  • Per poter realizzare al meglio e in modo condiviso il progetto, abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto, anche piccolo!

I nostri doni

  • Il ricavato della raccolta andrà a finanziare l'evento e a sostenere i progetti dell'associazione. 
  • Per ringraziarvi riceverete per ogni contributo un dono-ricordo: piccoli oggetti fatti a mano, unici, preziosi. Collane, portachiavi, quaderni, segnalibri, manifesti e tantissime cose 'piccole ma buone', come è nel nostro spirito. Tutti i doni potranno essere ritirati (lasciando il proprio nome al momento della donazione) presso la libreria Les Bouquinistes di Pistoia. In questo modo, potrete entrare, conoscere Elena se ancora non la conoscete, fare due chiacchiere e lasciarvi conquistare dalla bellezza dei libri esposti!

 

Non dimenticare...

Di condividere in tutti i modi la campagna! Illuminiamo insieme la città!

 

 

 

 

Fotografia di Guido Mencari

Le foto dei doni sono di Beatrice Bruni

story:
“Life is Living [is] like a homecoming… we can come home, see our people across generations, and celebrate one another in safety and in all our various beauty.”

- Marc Bamuthi Joseph, Life is Living Co-Founder and Chief of Program & Pedagogy at Yerba Buena Center for the Arts.

Since 2008,

Life is Living has grown from a festival that uses art to foster environmental justice to a mobilized campaign much larger in scope. Currently led by the Life is Living Cohort, Co-Founders Hodari B. Davis, Chinaka Hodge, and Producing Director Joan Osato, Life is Living serves as an incubator for a multigenerational community of local and national artists including Brett Cook, Theaster Gates, Estria Miyashiro, and a host of others.

Commitment to the Community

Each year the festival brings together over 7,000 people to West Oakland’s historic DeFremery Park, a community undergoing rapid transformation as Oakland experiences rising real estate costs and shifting racial and class demographics. At the same time, long-time residents continue to struggle to overcome decades of disinvestment.

"Life is Living has a very meager margin of institutional support… it's a free gift to the city." - Marc Bamuthi Joseph, LIL Festival Co-Founder

Even with the tireless support of the community, the biggest challenge is continuity in funding to keep the festival free and accessible, while also sustaining the momentum of our growth over the last 10 years.

That's Where You Come In

This year we are rallying the support of our community in the Bay Area and beyond for the 11th Annual Life is Living Crowdfunding Campaign. We’re even teaming up with some incredible supporters to help us reach this goal; L. Clifford and Macpherson East Bay Performing Arts Fund at the East Bay Community Foundation have made a commitment to match each dollar that supports this campaign.

"Support all of the labor that goes in to celebrating yourself, and celebrating the community that loves you." - Marc Bamuthi Joseph, LIL Festival Co-Founder

So where exactly is your dollar going?

Your contribution to this campaign will cover:

  • Festival Production Costs including staffing, city permits, facility fees, equipment, marketing, and everything in between that powers Life is Living.
  • Campaign Costs and Processing Fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

And as a token of our gratitude, we’ve also conjured up some donation perks like exclusive Life is Living swag, VIP entry, and more.

Run By the Community, For the Community

The festival is produced by a wide swath of proud Oakland residents, artists, community organizers, and activists who comprise the Life is Living Cohort. The Cohort commits to a year-long planning process that activates over 200 Oakland-based community groups and artists who collaborate on the day of the festival, reflecting the voices of an emerging cultural majority and sustaining the lives of the communities we engage. Cohort members include:

  • Brett Cook
    Artist
  • Emily Butterfly
    Kid Zone
  • Candice "Antique" Wicks-Davis
    Beauty Zone
  • Delina Brooks & Madelyn M'baye
    Africa in Oakland Dance Zone
  • Kaitlin McGraw, Tommy Shepherd & The Alphabet Rockers with the Oakland Public Library
  • Destiny Arts Center in Collaboration with Alphabet Rockers
    Dance Battle at the "4 Elements Stage"
  • Cal Shakes and Youth Speaks
    Theater Zone, The Black and Brown Resistance Stage
  • (1st Amendment Gallery)
    Graffiti Arts
  • The Crucible
    Maker Zone
  • TownFuturists Korise Jubert, Hodari B. Davis, Refa1
    Dark Star Universe
  • People's Kitchen Collective
    Free Community Breakfast
  • OAKHELLA
    Co-hosting the Main Stage and Hosting the Life is Living Afterparty
  • Youth Speaks & the UCSF Center for Vulnerable Populations
    The Bigger Picture Project
  • Karen Seneferu and Melorra Green
    The Black Woman is God
  • Artists Bethanie Hines & Camille Safiya
    Photographic Exhibition
  • Andrew Wilson
    Artist
  • BAOBOB (Bay Area Organization of Black Owned Businesses)
    The Marketplace
  • Mandela Grocery
    Life is Living Basketball Tournament
  • K-Dub
    Town Park
  • And many more!

story:
Peaceful, Compassionate, and Traditional

 We are thrilled to invite you to join our exciting Indo-Iranian Festival Online brought to you by UNESCO Body & Mind Wellness. The program will take place on June 21st at 3 PM EST.

Uplift your mood of joy through our Folk Festival filled with beautiful music and dance.

This is one of our online events that will take place until we are able to host in-person Indo-Iranian Folk Festivals in Fredrick Maryland. While we wait for COVID-19 cases to drop, UNESCO Body & Mind Wellness has decided to have a variety of ONLINE engaging events to bring joy to your homes in these dark times.

Our first Online Festival:

When: June 21, from 3:00 pm to 4:00 pm

Where: on ZOOM, YouTube, Facebook and Instagram

Book Now Your Online Space:

Email: unescobmw@gmail.com

Website:unesconmw.org

Please financially support this Online event for the Upmost in quality entertainment.

How to contribute in a safe and seamless manner: Just go to https://Igg.me/at/my-unescobmw-url to be a part of our Indiegogo campaign that is hosting the fundraiser for UNESCO Body & Mind Wellness Folk Festivals.

Also, please support UNESCO Body & Mind Wellness in ALL of its outreach activities by liking us on Facebook and Instagram:

https://www.facebook.com/unescobodymindwellness...

https://www.instagram.com/unescobmw/

It’s up to you to make this happen. A world with bliss and passion!

story:
If you would have seen the look on my 7 year old’s face when he woke up that morning to find that he was visited at night by camels and kings and that they had left him gifts…

 

My name is Mathew and I have a son named Josiah.  He’s a pain in my butt sometimes but I adore him.  He is your typical child – always hungry, funny, energetic, and curious.  At this age, he is soaking up information (He knows every Bruno Mars song on the radio word for word) so I try to teach him as much as I can.  I want, more and more, to be able to teach him things I was taught and to pass down traditions that were passed down to me.

 

Recently, I shared with Josiah the amazing story of the 3 Kings.  His eyes were HUGE as I told him of the adventure of the 3 Wise Men and their journey to bring gifts to baby Jesus.  I mentioned to him why the holiday is important, and how to celebrate it.

 

So we began looking for items around the house to celebrate 3 Kings day appropriately (Mom wasn’t very happy with the mess we made).  We had so many questions.  What grass should we use?  Where would one get hay?  Where would we get a box?  Would a shoebox work? Could we color it?  Where do we put the water? 

 

Well, we finally made it work.  We accomplished our 3 Kings Day offering and if you would have seen the look on my 7 year old’s face when he woke up that morning to find that he was visited at night by camels and kings and that they had left him gifts…

 

Our mini excursion into 3 Kings Day got me thinking - this is a holiday that kids would LOVE.  Why isn’t there an all-in-one resource for this amazing holiday?  And this is where the idea for the My3KingsDay Kit was born.

 

I’ve created a Kit that allows us to pass the traditions, share the magic, and spread the joy.  The My3KingsDay Kit is a kit that will be just for kids and offer a convenient, fun, and educational look into the wonder of Three Kings day or Dia De Los Tres Reyes.  

 

Each Kit comes with a My 3 Kings Day story Booklet, Customizable Hay Box with Activity Section, A My3Kingsday Water Bowl (FOR THE CAMELS, DUH), 45 grams of 100% Authentic Timothy Hay, 8 acrylic paint pots and paint brush.

 

Awesome RIGHT?!

 

“SO WHAT DO YOU NEED FROM ME?”

 

I’m asking for your help in developing this kit.  $3,000.00 is needed to develop it from start to finish, develop the business entity, and to provide some preliminary marketing.

 

Your contribution will be designated as follows:  

 

Production of 200 Kit:

Customizable Hay box – $500.00

My 3 Kings Day Booklet - $400.00

Timothy Hay – $50.00

Acrylic Paint Sets – $240.00

My3KingsDay Water Bowl – $300.00

Shrink wrap System – $200.00

Packaging Print and Graphics – 250.00

----------------------------------------------$2,000.00

 

Marketing

Graphic Design: Logo, Social Media, Online

Business Cards

Website

Fliers

Marketing and Promotion
Promotional Video --------------------$500.00

 

Business Incorporation

----------------------------------------------$500.00

 

“AND IF YOU DON’T GET THE HELP YOU NEED?”

I will not be your friend anymore!  Just kidding, of course that would be a shame but with the money that is raised we will of course continue all efforts to fulfill our budget.  All proceeds will go to creating these kits.

 

“AND IF YOU GET MORE THAN YOU ASKED FOR?”

In the event that we surpass our goal we will use the remaining funds to enhance the actual kit itself and then a large percentage of the remaining balance will be donated to Child Welfare organizations throughout the Chicagoland area. 

 

“WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?”

Aside from the fact that you’ll be a part of something huge and helping spread culture, love, joy, and faith to kids everywhere there are some perks to contributing.  Please review the PERKS section of the campaign to review what's in it for you when you contribute!

 

11 reasons why My3KingsDay Kit is AWESOME!

 

#1 There’s nothing like it!

No, really!  Nothing exists like this product.  Believe me! I’ve looked!  This is the only 3 Kings Day kit that is specifically catered to children.

 

#2 The Joy it brings is priceless!

Let’s be honest.  Gifts always make kids happy.  But gifts delivered to them by 3 Kings and camels?...

 

#3 Build New Traditions with your loved ones.

Children will fondly remember their 3 Kings Day the same way they remember their Christmas holiday.  It will create lasting memories that bring families closer together.

 

#4 It encourages, strengthens, and educates

Growing up Christian has offered me a path of light and faith.  Early exposure to the my faith at an early age has guided me throughout my childhood and continues with me today.  Items like the My2KingsDay kit strengthens faith, educates children , and encourages them further to seek and understand our faith. 

 

#5 It’s another Holiday!

Something else to celebrate!  Celebration is always great!

 

#6 Cultural Identity

As children get older or as they assimilate more and more to American ideals and values sometimes they may lose sight of who they are and where they come from.  Cultures throughout the globe celebrate 3 Kings Day differently.  Some equate the importance of 3 Kings Day with that of Christmas or Easter.  Some see it as a small reminder of our faith.  The My3KingsDay kit will offer children an opportunity to learn more of their culture and build within them a sense of belonging and identity. 

 

#7 Quality time with the Family

Each kit comes with a customizable My3KingsDay kit Hay Box.  Children and families are encouraged to customize the box to their own liking.  As I sat with my own son and hand painted his box with him not only did we learn a bunch about each other, and have a blast painting together, I also finally realized that maybe I should take some art classes…I’m pretty bad at drawing.

 

#8 All-in-one resource for your child’s 3 Kings Day Experience

As I educated my son about the 3 Kings or 3 Wise men he had some questions.   Nothing Google couldn’t answer of course but then I realized that I should learn a bit more about this holiday if I planned to make this a family holiday tradition.  So I educated myself and learned everything I could about the 3 Wise men.  When I was finished educating my son about this holiday I realized that we have arrived at the execution phase.  Now it’s time to make this story come to life!  Some basic items are needed in order to celebrate 3 Kings Day: A box, a bowl, and grass.  Sounds easy enough, right? WRONG!  It took forever trying to find exactly what we needed.  It even took a trip to the local big Box store (I won’t say their name here but let’s just say it rhymes with Shmarget).  A Shoebox, cereal bowl, and front lawn grass would eventually do the trick.  I thought there had to be an easier way!  NOW THERE IS!  Now I can educated my child (and future children) about this awesome story and I’d have all the items needed to celebrate it.  No trips to the store, no fumbling through Google, no emptying out closets in search for boxes, and definitely no grassless patches in my yard!

 

#9 Baby Jesus

Really…Do I have to elaborate?

 

#10 $15.00 is VERY reasonable

It starts at a great price point!  $15 is a good amount for EVERYTHING that comes within the kit.  It’s worth every cent.

 

#11 It makes a great gift!

Awesome RIGHT?!
 
“SO WHAT DO YOU NEED FROM ME?”
 
I’m asking for your help in developing this kit.  $3,000.00 is needed to develop it from start to finish, develop the business entity, and to provide some preliminary marketing.
 
Your contribution will be designated as follows:  
 
Production of 200 Kit:
Customizable Hay box – $500.00
My 3 Kings Day Booklet - $400.00
Timothy Hay – $50.00
Acrylic Paint Sets – $240.00
My3KingsDay Water Bowl – $300.00
Shrink wrap System – $200.00
Packaging Print and Graphics – 250.00
----------------------------------------------$2,000.00
 
Marketing
Graphic Design: Logo, Social Media, Online
Business Cards
Website
Fliers
Marketing and PromotionPromotional Video --------------------$500.00
 
Business Incorporation
----------------------------------------------$500.00
 
“AND IF YOU DON’T GET THE HELP YOU NEED?”
I will not be your friend anymore!  Just kidding, of course that would be a shame but with the money that is raised we will of course continue all efforts to fulfill our budget.  All proceeds will go to creating these kits.
 
“AND IF YOU GET MORE THAN YOU ASKED FOR?”
In the event that we surpass our goal we will use the remaining funds to enhance the actual kit itself and then a large percentage of the remaining balance will be donated to Child Welfare organizations throughout the Chicagoland area. 
 
“WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?”
Aside from the fact that you’ll be a part of something huge and helping spread culture, love, joy, and faith to kids everywhere there are some perks to contributing.  Please review the PERKS section of the campaign to review what's in it for you when you contribute!
 
11 reasons why My3KingsDay Kit is AWESOME!
 
#1 There’s nothing like it!
No, really!  Nothing exists like this product.  Believe me! I’ve looked!  This is the only 3 Kings Day kit that is specifically catered to children.
 
#2 The Joy it brings is priceless!
Let’s be honest.  Gifts always make kids happy.  But gifts delivered to them by 3 Kings and camels?...
 
#3 Build New Traditions with your loved ones.
Children will fondly remember their 3 Kings Day the same way they remember their Christmas holiday.  It will create lasting memories that bring families closer together.
 
#4 It encourages, strengthens, and educates
Growing up Christian has offered me a path of light and faith.  Early exposure to the my faith at an early age has guided me throughout my childhood and continues with me today.  Items like the My2KingsDay kit strengthens faith, educates children , and encourages them further to seek and understand our faith. 
 
#5 It’s another Holiday!
Something else to celebrate!  Celebration is always great!
 
#6 Cultural Identity
As children get older or as they assimilate more and more to American ideals and values sometimes they may lose sight of who they are and where they come from.  Cultures throughout the globe celebrate 3 Kings Day differently.  Some equate the importance of 3 Kings Day with that of Christmas or Easter.  Some see it as a small reminder of our faith.  The My3KingsDay kit will offer children an opportunity to learn more of their culture and build within them a sense of belonging and identity. 
 
#7 Quality time with the Family
Each kit comes with a customizable My3KingsDay kit Hay Box.  Children and families are encouraged to customize the box to their own liking.  As I sat with my own son and hand painted his box with him not only did we learn a bunch about each other, and have a blast painting together, I also finally realized that maybe I should take some art classes…I’m pretty bad at drawing.
 
#8 All-in-one resource for your child’s 3 Kings Day Experience
As I educated my son about the 3 Kings or 3 Wise men he had some questions.   Nothing Google couldn’t answer of course but then I realized that I should learn a bit more about this holiday if I planned to make this a family holiday tradition.  So I educated myself and learned everything I could about the 3 Wise men.  When I was finished educating my son about this holiday I realized that we have arrived at the execution phase.  Now it’s time to make this story come to life!  Some basic items are needed in order to celebrate 3 Kings Day: A box, a bowl, and grass.  Sounds easy enough, right? WRONG!  It took forever trying to find exactly what we needed.  It even took a trip to the local big Box store (I won’t say their name here but let’s just say it rhymes with Shmarget).  A Shoebox, cereal bowl, and front lawn grass would eventually do the trick.  I thought there had to be an easier way!  NOW THERE IS!  Now I can educated my child (and future children) about this awesome story and I’d have all the items needed to celebrate it.  No trips to the store, no fumbling through Google, no emptying out closets in search for boxes, and definitely no grassless patches in my yard!
 
#9 Baby Jesus
Really…Do I have to elaborate?
 
#10 $15.00 is VERY reasonable
It starts at a great price point!  $15 is a good amount for EVERYTHING that comes within the kit.  It’s worth every cent.
 
#11 It makes a great gift!

story:
Who We Are:

Of the Wolves is a global resource and platform focused on stories, stewardship, sustainable consumption, workshops and retreats, and services. We exist:  in service of something far more important than creating and selling “content," something ancient: sharing stories with the intent to pass information, preserve tradition and art, and to connect. Also the abolition of shame, the open discussion of sometimes private challenges like sobriety and mental illness, and celebration of earthly magic.  We forge on: to facilitate real ways to consume sustainably, be stewards on this planet, and to provide practical tools for a higher quality of human experience for a global audience. We’ve no interest in a picture-perfect life, just the real stuff – substance over show – and uniting like-minded people around the world as technology and global strife seem to divide us.

Our Wolf Pack, our team of over 20 contributors, consists of actresses, entrepreneurs, clairvoyants, clinical psychologists, certified life coaches, wildlife conservationists, poets, writers, musicians and more. Magically one of a kind, Powerfully part of the pack. That’s who we ALL are.

How We Can Help Each Other:

You know the saying - “having an idea is not enough”? That’s true, so we took an impassioned idea and turned it into a unique, global community (almost 50% internationally based) with the dollars and pennies we could scrape together, and less than a year later we sit before you – with countless hours, tears of joy and heartache, and bouts of fear of the unknown enmeshed in our creation. The “saying” should also continue: “executing an idea without any resources is sometimes not enough." So we now humble ourselves and ask for some assistance to continue giving back to you and to reach even more people around the globe.

We’d really rather be beholden to you, our global Pack, than indentured to disinterested investors. With you as our benefactors, we can continue to create for you and with you. Let’s make Of The Wolves the ultimate online co-op, yeah? Right now, we are a team of two (with outside careers) with over 25 dream contributors and freelancers, and would like to focus on this full time. To be a reflection of you means to not skirt stories of heartbreak and pain, shame and grief, loss and joy, trauma and life but to tell them often and bravely, and that takes work. That’s the modern howl!

What Your Donations Help Us Do:

SUSTAINABILITY AND PARTNERSHIPS:
Sustainability: Through storytelling, soon a refined shopping collection, and eventually product development, Of The Wolves is a global go-to resource for affordable, sustainable living. This is one of the most important tenets of our organization, and the resources we’ll raise here will help us immensely.
Education: You’ll be helping us finalize our research and development of proprietary videos, retreats and workshops (online and in-person) - curriculums for living a better live in the modern age, in partnership with experts (e.g. psychotherapists, esoteric practitioners, etc.).
Stewardship through Partnership: As a soon-to-be B Corp, we aim to substantially grow our for-profit company so that we can meet “rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency” and transparently relay that work to you. In this, we’re focused on expanding our storytelling around partnerships with global NGOs, non-profits and progressive companies - beyond interviews and into larger scale campaigns and activations of our network. Measurable impact that we can share with you.

WEBSITE AND STORYTELLING:
Website improvements: We seek to build out our existing, self-funded online storytelling platform to be able to reach more people around the world through content and videos that matter, including adding a community portal and designing a phone app to make access from any device a breeze.
Educational video channel: We’ve already begun plans for our ongoing interview series mirroring the focuses of our written content. Free and paid workshops and travel videos will soon hopefully populate our “Wolf Channel” on the website. We need to be able to pay for bare bones camera equipment, an editor, and basic production.
Expanding categories to Green tech and Science: We would like to bring in a Green tech and/or Science writer with the background and expertise to delight and inform our readers about these verticals.

COMMUNITY FACILITATION: 
Online: We’ll soon be creating an open but moderated online forum around topics mirroring our website, enabling our global community to have more two-way conversations.
In-person facility: Any carry-over funds we raise from this initial drive will go towards the bones of our first retreat facility in the high desert of Southern California, a destination for healing, camaraderie, and howling at the moon. Also, a facility where our proprietary programs and one-of-a-kind retreats will be taught and quiet, healing stays can be booked.

EXPANDING OUR GLOBAL PACK:
Our current audience has been one of truly grassroots marketing, gathered exclusively through our own storytelling and word of mouth through our beloved Wolf Pack all over the world. We need an actual marketing budget to reach more of our unknown Pack around the world – from the mountains of the Andes to the lakes of (where). The reality is – without a digital advertising budget, our work is algorithmically buried. Help our Pack find us and us them!

Other Ways to Help:

  • Help us spread our howl by sharing Of The Wolves on your socials and with friends and family who you think could benefit from the work we are doing!
  • Sign up for our Monthly Newsletters! We promise we won't flood your inboxes.
  • Howl with us on Instagram and on our website!

Our Mission Statement:

To create stellar educational and storytelling content in various forms that innately adds value to the Pack, even if focused on life’s challenges. To normalize what already is normal but under discussed, by presenting various viewpoints and approaches. To model positive community support for our global Pack, present tangible ways to lessen our ecological footprint, and to provide our work (content, services, seminars, education and sustainably-made items) at a reasonable rate, with little to no barrier to entry.

Meet the Founders:

Lulu Brud is the wild woman behind the brand Of The Wolves. She is a part of the whole. A piece of the movement back into the wild. She finds inspiration in the quiet of the desert, sunrises/sunsets, sacred geometry, patterns and colors in nature, the lunar cycle, synchronicities, dance and movement, stillness and quiet, the mountains, the pulse of the ocean, wolves and birds, communities and tribes. Lulu is an actress (Pretty Little Liars, Ray Donovan, Entourage), artist, writer and home sanctuary maker and sustainable lifestyle promoter. She lives and loves on the east side of Los Angeles with her husband, Justin, and their little dog Paixley. Of The Wolves began in 2014 and has evolved and expanded naturally over the course of the last two to three years as a way to share stories, brands, recipes and more.

Micha Thomas is the other half, the other wild woman leading the Of The Wolves community. She’s a creative director, entrepreneur, and trained life and executive coach. Micha has carved out successful marketing, content, branding and communication initiatives for clients across culture, music, innovation and technology industries for over 13 years. She is the creator of The MiA (Made in America) Project and is certified in Executive and Organizational Coaching via Columbia University and in NLP-based life assistance and hypnotherapy. Micha has contributed stories and interviews over the years to Elle Magazine, High Snobbery, Mind Body Green, and multiple regional culture blogs…she’s lived a few places. She’s a trained dancer, alleviates angst by regular boxing sessions, and adores photography, the desert, communes, and her gaggle of pet pals.
