story:
The Project

The new Kungfu Family Martial Arts Academy is located beside Mulan Mountain in the lush ranges of Sichuan Province, and includes 200 acres of unspoiled natural beauty.  A temple dedicated to "Sichuan's Mulan," a famous woman who disguised herself as a man in order to fight in the wars for her country, is visible from the academy grounds. Birds sing, trees sway, flowers bloom; it's a serene, classically Chinese setting.

Perfect for martial arts. 

But this rural martial arts academy is not only be a center for traditional kung fu training, but also a hub for cultural, lingual, and philosophical exchange. People from all over the world can live, learn, and train together on these grounds, and from this interaction Master Li seeks to foster a whole new understanding of who we are and what our purpose is in this world. 

This isn't your neighborhood McDojo: The vision is clearly one of self-cultivation and enlightenment, not just kicking stuff.

So Why the Campaign?

What we need right now are the funds to complete this dream and make it reality. Master Li and his Kung Fu Family have already invested more than $50,000 and countless hours into the project. We've secured the land and the rights to build up a school; we have renovated much of the space, and we're ALMOST THERE.

The money we raise will be used for a spanking new dorm for the students to stay in, a sparring ring for all manner of martial arts, and some more modern training equipment, including MMA dummies, more bags, and other tools.

The bare minimum to make this happen is $8000.

We need your help to reach this goal. Share this page with people you know, email your friends, and back this worthy project. 

Kung Fu thanks you. 

About Master Li

Master Li Quan’s passion for traditional Chinese kung fu began when he was just a small boy growing up in the frigid northern tip of China. He watched his grandfather train his graceful movements was the most beautiful dance the boy had ever seen. Like any good grandson, he imitated his grandfather’s kicks and punches. Soon the boy was receveing more formal training from the old military man, who taught him the basic kung fu skills by age 10.

Years later however, after getting into a fight at school and hurting another boy, Li Quan’s parents forbade him from continuing his training. So began training himself in secret. He made a punching bag so heavy he could hardly lift it up into a tree, and each day after returning from school he would remove it from its hiding place, hit it 200 times, and then bury it in the hay again afterwards.

Upon leaving school, Master Li decided to join a kung fu school, though he dare not tell his parents. He worked hard, training in the morning, moving bricks and cement during the day, and training again at night. He made less than $2 a day, saving all he could. By his 17th birthday he had enough for the tuition fees and left home for the first time.

Master Li went to Hebei and entered the Chinese Wushu Academy. By 1991 he was captain of the North East China Amateur Wushu team. Two years later he left for Sichuan province, first teaching at the Gong Fu Research Academy in Deyang, and later coming under the tutelage of Grandmaster Dai at the Dai Shi Men Wushu Institute in Hanyuan.

Studying under Grandmaster Dai, Li quickly reached the rank of Master, and began training more and more students, including foreigners. In his leisure time he earned an English degree from Sichuan University. From time to time he would take part in wushu competitions, including a championship run in the 78kg weight class of the prestigious San Da Wu Shu in 2005..

Among Master Li Quan's other achievements are:

  • Head of Security for Beijing 2008 Olympic Torch Relay across the People’s Republic of China
  • Security liaison during Beijing 2008 Olympics for Holland House, coordinating security for Dutch dignitaries, including the Prince and Prime Minister
  • Training Chinese police in combat fighting and apprehension tactics
  • Training Airline Security guards in self-defense and martial arts techniques for airport and in-flight security
  • Training People's Liberation Army troops in hand-to-hand combat

 

About Kungfu Family

Traditional kung fu has found itself  left by the wayside in China as other martial arts moved onto the scene, principally Taekwondo, Karate and Thai boxing.  Commercially these forms have become more profitable, marketing themselves as more accessible and offering quicker results. As a result, traditional Chinese kungfu has fallen out of popularity, leaving many Masters with no means to continue their craft.

In these times of difficulty, Master Li’s dream has always been to have his own kung fu school, a place of simple beauty surrounded by a natural environment to create an inspirational atmosphere. He set up a small school in Chengdu’s Flower Town, San Sheng Xiang in 2009 and after its creation it immediately attracted attention from kung fu enthusiasts around the world. Since then students from America, England, France, Germany, and various other countries have come to China to study under Master Li.

His is a holistic approach which incorporates not only physical exercise, but also meditation technique, combat strategy, how to nurture your Qi, studying how the body operates, the medicinal properties of herbs and their healing effects, in addition to placing a strong emphasis on the virtues and philosophy of the “gentleman warrior scholar”. Since the schools creation however Master Li has always continued in his search for a permanent home in a more ideal environment, and in 2016 he settled on Mulan Mountain.

 

For more information on classes and training programs please visit http://www.kungfu-family.com/

You may contact Master Li at liquan@kungfu-family.com

The schools address is: (Wo Niu Villa) Kungfu Family Training base, Mulan Mountain ecological Park, Xindu District, Chengdu

Chinese address: 中国成都新都区木兰山生态园武道之家国术官训练基地（卧牛山庄内

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Master Li and his Kung Fu Family have already invested more than $50,000 and countless hours into the project. We've secured the land and the rights to build up a school; we have renovated much of the space, and we're ALMOST THERE.The money we raise will be used for a spanking new dorm for the students to stay in, a sparring ring for all manner of martial arts, and some more modern training equipment, including MMA dummies, more bags, and other tools.The bare minimum to make this happen is $8000.We need your help to reach this goal. Share this page with people you know, email your friends, and back this worthy project. Kung Fu thanks you. About Master LiMaster Li Quan’s passion for traditional Chinese kung fu began when he was just a small boy growing up in the frigid northern tip of China. He watched his grandfather train his graceful movements was the most beautiful dance the boy had ever seen. Like any good grandson, he imitated his grandfather’s kicks and punches. Soon the boy was receveing more formal training from the old military man, who taught him the basic kung fu skills by age 10.Years later however, after getting into a fight at school and hurting another boy, Li Quan’s parents forbade him from continuing his training. So began training himself in secret. He made a punching bag so heavy he could hardly lift it up into a tree, and each day after returning from school he would remove it from its hiding place, hit it 200 times, and then bury it in the hay again afterwards.Upon leaving school, Master Li decided to join a kung fu school, though he dare not tell his parents. He worked hard, training in the morning, moving bricks and cement during the day, and training again at night. He made less than $2 a day, saving all he could. By his 17th birthday he had enough for the tuition fees and left home for the first time.Master Li went to Hebei and entered the Chinese Wushu Academy. By 1991 he was captain of the North East China Amateur Wushu team. Two years later he left for Sichuan province, first teaching at the Gong Fu Research Academy in Deyang, and later coming under the tutelage of Grandmaster Dai at the Dai Shi Men Wushu Institute in Hanyuan.Studying under Grandmaster Dai, Li quickly reached the rank of Master, and began training more and more students, including foreigners. In his leisure time he earned an English degree from Sichuan University. From time to time he would take part in wushu competitions, including a championship run in the 78kg weight class of the prestigious San Da Wu Shu in 2005..Among Master Li Quan's other achievements are:
Head of Security for Beijing 2008 Olympic Torch Relay across the People’s Republic of China
Security liaison during Beijing 2008 Olympics for Holland House, coordinating security for Dutch dignitaries, including the Prince and Prime Minister
Training Chinese police in combat fighting and apprehension tactics
Training Airline Security guards in self-defense and martial arts techniques for airport and in-flight security
Training People's Liberation Army troops in hand-to-hand combat
 About Kungfu FamilyTraditional kung fu has found itself  left by the wayside in China as other martial arts moved onto the scene, principally Taekwondo, Karate and Thai boxing.  Commercially these forms have become more profitable, marketing themselves as more accessible and offering quicker results. As a result, traditional Chinese kungfu has fallen out of popularity, leaving many Masters with no means to continue their craft.In these times of difficulty, Master Li’s dream has always been to have his own kung fu school, a place of simple beauty surrounded by a natural environment to create an inspirational atmosphere. He set up a small school in Chengdu’s Flower Town, San Sheng Xiang in 2009 and after its creation it immediately attracted attention from kung fu enthusiasts around the world. Since then students from America, England, France, Germany, and various other countries have come to China to study under Master Li.His is a holistic approach which incorporates not only physical exercise, but also meditation technique, combat strategy, how to nurture your Qi, studying how the body operates, the medicinal properties of herbs and their healing effects, in addition to placing a strong emphasis on the virtues and philosophy of the “gentleman warrior scholar”. Since the schools creation however Master Li has always continued in his search for a permanent home in a more ideal environment, and in 2016 he settled on Mulan Mountain. For more information on classes and training programs please visit http://www.kungfu-family.com/You may contact Master Li at liquan@kungfu-family.comThe schools address is: (Wo Niu Villa) Kungfu Family Training base, Mulan Mountain ecological Park, Xindu District, ChengduChinese address: 中国成都新都区木兰山生态园武道之家国术官训练基地（卧牛山庄内Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
You can read the story behind this project below.

 

 

 

Introduction

A few months ago when I graduated from university I returned to my hometown in Bulgaria. A beautiful small town deep within the Rhodope mountain (Southern Bulgaria). There were some that questioned my choice. Why would someone return from London to a small town offering  few opportunities?... I see great potential.

The women here, have skills that are specific to this region. With a bit of help they could earn extra while working from the comfort of their homes. Some live with income of less than € 150 a month.  Furthermore the craft is almost forgotten as younger generations fail to appreciate it. This is why now is the time to act. With your assistance we can help some very nice ladies to continue doing what they enjoy and feel that their craft is appreciated around the globe.



 You can be a part of the creation of an opportunity, where there was none until now. While studying in the UK I created and successfully completed a crowdfunding campaign. I believe that the skills acquired and improved during that time (and your help) will aid me to successfully start this venture.

 

Funding

A small amount will go for expences such as post and packaging. After expences 50% will go to the women for the slippers. The other 50% along with some savings of mine will go towards starting the social enterprise.

The perks you get are unique, handmade and have been crafted by artisans.

Challenges

Slippers of bigger sizes are harder to find. This will take a bit more time. However, after searching I have found some of the remaining women who are able to craft them and we will work together to get you some comfortable and socially beneficial footwear.


P.S. Feel free to message me with any questions. If you really love them, but your size is not listed feel free to message me, I can't guarantee I will find a pair, but I will try really hard. :)
The products are handmade so please keep in mind that they will be unique and do allow for some minor differences.

Colourful High Knitted Socks - exclusive to the 'Three Different Models - 24 cm' perk

High Knitted Socks - Black & White. Classic.

Low knitted socks in dark red and bright blue.

 https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f6/Shoesize-adult-en.svg - a link to a size conversion table. However I recommend you measure your feet before ordering just to be sure. :)

Share with your friends and get a perk!  Thank you.

story:
Eyelevel Gallery is seeking funds and new members to support our organization!

Pick up your merchandise at Kitchen Sink, an indoor yard sale with music by DJ DIRTY DISHES, raffle prizes, an art service auction, and even a lemonade stand! Save your stuff to contribute to our sale! 31 March and 1 April, Saint Georges Round Church.
 

 

Eyelevel Gallery is a charitable artist-run centre dedicated to the presentation, promotion, and development of contemporary art. As a gallery without a physical space, we do this by hosting projects in unexpected places. Eyelevel Gallery has provided a forum for the discussion and education of contemporary visual art for 43 years.

With your support, we will be able to bring in more artists and foster local artistic practices, increasing engagement in the arts in Halifax.
 

 

Your membership contributes to our ongoing free public programming initiatives such as exhibitions, performances, artist's residencies, internships for emerging artists, curatorial opportunities, public lectures, and more. As a member-based organization, your input into Eyelevel’s programming and activities is critical to our future success. Members can participate on our committees, vote at our general meetings, and be nominated for our Board of Directors. 
 

 

Our perks have been designed specifically to highlight the model of Eyelevel as a spaceless gallery. In addition to becoming a member, you can purchase Eyelevel merchandise and support our offsite programming in unique ways. 

Note: This site does not allow for multiple perks to be added to one transaction. If you would like to purchase multiple "perks" at once (such as a membership and a merchandise item or incentive), please take a moment to make multiple transitions. We appreciate it!

 

Thank you so much for stopping by and for your support! 

Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions at fun@eyelevelgallery.ca.

 

Visit www.eyelevelgallery.ca to learn more about us!

story:
Getting Back to The Land, and to Each Other

 

Hello Friends, Family, and IndieGoGo Community,

Our world is in crisis. Our current levels of consumption are not sustainable. The results of this overconsumption are the loss of farmland, growing urbanization, the destruction of the environment and a global food crisis. Simultaneously, social isolation is taking hold and we are growing more and more disconnected from each other with dire consequences to our physical, mental and emotional health. We need powerful solutions that we can integrate into our everyday realities that enable us to address these issues together.

This is what we are creating at Abundance Community Farm. We have developed a Community Agriculture model that bridges the gap between the city and the country and enables city dwellers to become farmers. It can be replicated  around the world to grow local organic food and create thriving communities that can better withstand the challenges and uncertainties of our global economy. Our model aims to improve quality of life for all by strengthening our connections to each other while reducing our ecological footprint through sharing resources.

We’ve had an amazing journey with implementing this model. It has allowed us to grow our in season produce and develop a deep sense connection to land and food. It has also enabled us to build rooted community and a sanctuary that kids and adults can come alive. This is truly providing us a better life with less, which is exactly what our world needs.
 

“Visiting Abundance Community Farm is a coming home every time, home to the land and to the community. Just a few days there recharges me and reminds me of what is really important in life.” ~ Bettine Rothe, Community Agriculture Member


We need your support to be able to spread this model and inspire others to take similar initiatives. We express our sincere gratitude for taking the time to consider supporting this campaign.

Much Love and Gratitude
Amir & the Abundance Team

 

MAJOR NEWS! ***

We have been receiving some incredible donations and offerings to assist in our construction project including 80 bunk beds donated from Samesun Vancouver, and donations of building & labour for our barn renovations! This means we can manage the project with a lower budget of $80,000 - which we have now reflected on our campaign goal. THANK YOU SO MUCH to Samesun & community for the huge support! 
 

 

 

What is "Community Agriculture"?


Community Agriculture (CA) is a system that bridges the divide between farmers and consumers, and between the city and the country. In the CA model we ARE the farmers AND the consumers, and we are city dwellers AND country lovers! Each of our 50 CA members come to the farm one weekend a month throughout the planting, growing and harvesting season. We work together to grow food for ourselves and contribute to the broader community. We also build community by sharing meals, telling stories around the fire, creating art, playing music and dancing

As the vegetables and fruits ripen, members harvest each weekend and the ripe, fresh, organic food is delivered to drop off points in the city for the other members to pick up. In the 2017 growing season our 1 acre garden fed over 70 people weekly and provided fresh food donations to a variety of community organizations. In addition, our community had an oasis in which to leave behind the stress and isolation of the city, recharge, reconnect, and have fun!

It’s an extraordinary dream coming true!

Community Agriculture is a replicable model that allows city dwellers to use nearby land to grow food and build community. Join us in the movement towards food sustainability through community-led agriculture. We would love to share the experience and inspire other communities to create their own version of Abundance Community Farm. 
 

​“My family and I LOVE Abundance farm! We go as often as possible in the spring and summer weekends to get deeper into nature. We can relax, unwind, get our hands in the earth, learn to grow our own food, swim in the river with friends and family, dance in the barn, share our talents, develop new skills and come together in supportive community. Children are growing up here and lifelong friendships are strengthening. Our dreams of building sustainable models are manifesting at Abundance Farm.”~ Maggie Blue, Community Agriculture Member

 

 

Who Are We?

The founder of the farm, Amir Niroumand, sold his house in Vancouver, BC, Canada in 2016 and bought the land that became Abundance Community Farm. He was part of a community of cultural creatives in Vancouver that grew local organic food in their backyards and created cultural activities and events in their living rooms. He trusted that having land close to the city would inspire his network to take their care for the environment and passion for culture and community to the next level. The response has been greater than he’d ever imagined!

The farm is located on 40-acres of land in Agassiz, BC, 1.5 hours east of Vancouver. There are 5 permanent residents living on the farm, and a network of Community Agriculture members who live in the Metro Vancouver and farm-share one weekend monthly to grow food, connect to nature, and build community. We care about our footprint on the planet and believe that our local community-based action is a powerful path to global change. We strive to model a new cultural paradigm that is based on collaboration, sharing resources, and healthy relationship to the land.

 

 

 

Our Recent Successes
 

“For me, the Abundance Community Farm is dream come true!  A welcoming place where community gathers to work with the land, learn to grow, savour and preserve food and celebrate with laughter and dance. My participation in the CA program at the Farm has enabled me to slow down and nourish my body and spirit.” ~ Jenna Card, Community Agriculture Member
 

We’ve had a wild success in our first season in 2017. Our garden has been bountiful and our community has thrived to an extent beyond our imagination. Here are some highlights:
 

Organic Farming

  • Cultivated one acre of veggies and planted a one-acre food forest comprised of 150 fruit and nut trees
  • Grew over 40 varieties of vegetables and harvested thousands of pounds of food
  • Provided delicious ripe organic produce to ~100 members, neighbours, and community organization every week of the growing season
  • Hosted several canning and preserving events


Community Development

  • Operated our farming activities with a community living in the city
  • Created an oasis for members and visitors to reconnect and recharge
  • Provide a safe space for children to play and explore nature
  • Created decision making processes based on Nonviolent Communication and Restorative Circle practices
  • Had a farm initiation ceremony with a local indigenous chief

 

What Your Contributions Will Fund!

Our vision for the future is beautiful and ambitious and we need your support to make this dream come true, Your contribution will enable us to expand our community facilities and share our experience and knowledge with the world.
 

Your contribution today will help us build:

  • Event spaces to host skills workshops and healing retreats
  • A commercial kitchen to process and preserve the produce of the farm
  • A walk-in cooler to preserve the freshness of our harvest for distribution
  • Dormitory accommodation to provide shelter for members and visitors

Our expanded  facilities will allow us to grow our membership and expand our local reach. They will also enable us to host retreats, workshops and tours for people from all over the world to develop skills and be inspired to create their own version of Abundance Community Farm. Our vision for the future is ambitious, and we need support to make this dream come true.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    New initiatives always come with risks and ours is no exception. The main challenge with community-based initiatives is navigating through the conflicts that arise. One of our farm residents is a communication facilitator. He takes the lead on resolving our conflicts. We're proud of how we have moved through our differences and have made collective decisions that everyone supports. It's not always easy to work through conflict, but we accept that conflict is a normal part of community, and we are committed to addressing it to the best of our abilities.

    Regulatory issues are another challenge. There are no bylaws for our model of Community Agriculture where a group of people live in the city and farm on weekends. We are trying to fit our model as much as possible to established bylaws, and also work with regulatory bodies to incorporate new regulations that are more supportive of Community Agriculture. We are not yet financially sustainable. We have sources of funding that have supported our operation, and we have created professional partnerships for hosting retreats as part of our income. This fundraiser is a critical step that enables us to upgrade our facilities in order to become financially sustainable.

     

    Our Offerings to You

    We have created offerings for you to come experience our journey at the farm and also learn about methods, tools, and the philosophical thoughts for creating such a project in your community. Our offerings are in two categories!:
     

    1) Farm Based

    We invite you to come spend a weekend with us and experience our Community Agriculture program for yourself. Some of these are:

    > Come for a weekend and experience it for yourself
    > Come for our harvest festival to celebrate the season
    > Come as our special guest and learn about the ins and outs of the farm
    > Invite us to hold workshops for your community
     

    2) Online Workshops

    These workshops are designed to give your deeper insight into the theoretical and practical aspects of Community Agriculture as a path for enriching our lives while transitioning towards a sustainable future. More specifically, you will learn:

    > How to deal with emotions and challenges that arises when working in community
    > How to plan your farming practices to provide for your community 
    > How could transition to a culture rooted in community values change our lives and our society

     

    Other Ways You Can Help!

    Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. The following actions can make a HUGE difference for us, and therefore ultimately, for the world!:

    • SHARE this campaign page via your facebook page! 
    • Find a perk that lights you up and CONTRIBUTE what you can!
    • Join our Facebook ALLIES page and help out where you can! 
    • Tell everyone you know to come check us out :))) 

     

    Meet the Team

story:
For over 14 years, the Lao Heritage Foundation (LHF),  a nonprofit 501(c)(3)  organization, has promoted the Lao culture through the appreciation for the arts. The foundation focuses on fostering and developing the next generation of young, Lao-American leaders who understand the importance of cultural preservation and continued community advocacy. LHF was founded in Washington, DC, and now currently has partners in Rhode Island, Illinois, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Pennsylania, North Carolina, and California. 

This summer of 2018, LHF is partnering with DFW Lao Heritage and will be extending its program to the southwestern region of the United States, launching its first summer camp in Dallas-Forth Worth, Texas! With Texas being one of the largest Lao populated states in the nation, we believe it is now time for the DFW and surrounding areas to have a program like LHF for the youth. Through the learning of Lao traditional instruments and dancing, we believe the Lao youth of Texas will come to find a new found appreciation for the arts and their heritage. 

To make this dream become a reality, we are asking for everyone's help in funding this one week summer camp. From August 13-18th, the students will attend classes from 9AM-5PM at Wat Thepnimith in Saginaw, Texas. The money raised will go towards providing Lao traditional instruments, airfare for the teachers from Laos coming to teach the youth, food for lunch, and other miscellaneous expenses. Please, join us in making this camp happen for our youth in Texas by donating through the link down below! Thank you so much!  

All Donations are tax deductible to the extent of the law. LHF will provide each donor with a donation receipt.
story_txt:
For over 14 years, the Lao Heritage Foundation (LHF),  a nonprofit 501(c)(3)  organization, has promoted the Lao culture through the appreciation for the arts. The foundation focuses on fostering and developing the next generation of young, Lao-American leaders who understand the importance of cultural preservation and continued community advocacy. LHF was founded in Washington, DC, and now currently has partners in Rhode Island, Illinois, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Pennsylania, North Carolina, and California. 
This summer of 2018, LHF is partnering with DFW Lao Heritage and will be extending its program to the southwestern region of the United States, launching its first summer camp in Dallas-Forth Worth, Texas! With Texas being one of the largest Lao populated states in the nation, we believe it is now time for the DFW and surrounding areas to have a program like LHF for the youth. Through the learning of Lao traditional instruments and dancing, we believe the Lao youth of Texas will come to find a new found appreciation for the arts and their heritage. 
To make this dream become a reality, we are asking for everyone's help in funding this one week summer camp. From August 13-18th, the students will attend classes from 9AM-5PM at Wat Thepnimith in Saginaw, Texas. The money raised will go towards providing Lao traditional instruments, airfare for the teachers from Laos coming to teach the youth, food for lunch, and other miscellaneous expenses. Please, join us in making this camp happen for our youth in Texas by donating through the link down below! Thank you so much!  
All Donations are tax deductible to the extent of the law. LHF will provide each donor with a donation receipt.

story:
WHY TLRC?

The Lazy Rose Cafe is Tender Love Rest'n Care. We live in a nonstop fast-paced community and TLRC has the goal of putting wellness in our community forefront. We foster community connections and wellness support over your favorite tea and coffee beverages. This is more than a location this is a lifestyle!

Our founders have been inspired by military service, travel, and their personal experiences to create The Lazy Rose Cafe, Brand, and Lifestyle. Keep reading to find out more!

  • Meet our Founders: Erdavria was born and raised in Los Angeles, went to Hamilton High and was a cheerleader, dancer, and Girl Scout. Building collective enthusiasm, motivation and community service was always a part of her life. While earning a Bachelors from CSU-Fullerton she decided to join the US Navy Reserve which placed service once again in the forefront of her life. After training and graduation, she served as an Analyst for the City of Los Angeles under Mayor Garcetti while earning a Masters of Business and Masters of Science from USC Marshall School of Business. Outside of class she was a Crisis Response Team Volunteer and supported Veteran-Wellness initiatives for LA City and many non-profits.  Erdavria is filled with passion for community service and dedicated to building cultural and social wellness.
  • Meet our Founders: Antonio is from a small town on the East Coast, after High School graduation he decided to serve in the US Navy and he developed a passion for business which led him to Los Angeles. He is a community Leader and co-owner of The Debonair Cigar Lounge and a President of a Nonprofit that focuses on Homelessness policy. Wellness has always been a priority and focus for him and he aims to increase wellness practice in black and veteran communities. He loves spending time with his two beautiful kids and his goal is to leave a legacy of community impact. 
  • Meet our Founders: You!! If you have aligned mission and see value in the Lazy Rose Cafe join our team!! Keep Reading and reach out to us!
  • Mid-city LA needs a cultural wellness cafe that serves a growth mindset and is center to events, community connections and beautiful relaxing aesthetic all over a cup of your favorite tea or coffee beverage. Having a supportive space to nurture a blossoming community is key to moving forward and building lifelong connections. 
  • Our product line features tea and coffee blends, while we work on developing some innovative coffee products to make your life simple and provide great quality coffee blends.
  • The Lazy Rose Cafe is more than a cafe and brand it is a lifestyle. To embrace your lazy days, reflect on wins and losses, growth and refresh to bloom into your next level and best self. We aim to nourish and nurture a blooming community.

What We Need & What You Get

We currently have a fully operation E-commerce site that features our premiere Sleepy Roses  and Unwind Time organic teas featuring Chamomile and Rose Petals. We sell whole coffee beans and decaf Coffee blends like our Pretty Brown Eyes that features Cacao and Cinnamon. Our goal is to build out our product lines and integrate into stores and our own cafe sharing the Lazy Rose movement with everyone.

Your generosity would help to fund:

* Coffee Brewing Equipment
* Licensing / Legal fees
* Marketing + Branding
* Website Development
*Improving Logistics
* Industrial Appliances
* Café Inventory
*Hiring Employees

It would also allow us to work on additional innovative products to support wellness through hot comforting beverages.

The Impact

We are both Black Veteran Entrepreneurs who aim to have a significant wellness impact in our community. Our mission is motivation through wellness and nurturing the growth mindset.

  • From encouraging Lazy days and rest, we support individuals and communities blossom into their best selves and you will too!
  • Our product line features innovative coffee concepts that will change the world and offer coffee lovers convenience.
  • This has always been our dream and if COVID has shown us anything it is that we should take time to slow down, reprioritize our health and wellness over the nonstop hustle and grind. We are determined, hard- workers that will stop at nothing to make our collective community-oriented dreams into a reality and create an impactful social venture.

Challenges - Fall Open!

At best we reach our funding goal and open in FALL 2021! If we do not reach our goal we will continue to build out eCommerce operations and a mobile cafe with pop-up capability and attend Farmer's Markets to continue building brand awareness and sharing our products and mission with the community.

  • The Lazy Rose cafe has built a network of amazing mentors and guides throughout this journey, we want you to join us!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to find out more about who we are and what we aim to accomplish feel free to follow us on Facebook and Instagram @lazyrosecafe, email lazyrosecafe@gmail.com to set up a call or reach out via email.

  • Please share our goals with your friends and families, and social media
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

We appreciate you!! Thank you!!!

story:
Are You Ready for Real Change?

Racebridge LLC is a brand new online media publishing company that offers premium content on cultural diversity, equality, and unity in America. We represent a huge step toward the next generation of leaders who believe in equality and moreover, want to put action behind those beliefs.

Our mission is to connect people from various cultures and subcultures through the use of shared stories, personal connections, and experiences. We will primarily feature, highlight, and promote people of color and women, but our main purpose is to bridge the gap between the human race as we head toward total fairness in America.

Our content will entail initiatives, statistics, news, solution-oriented proposals, healthy debates, inspiring stories, celebrations of cultures, and more. We are at the most critical point in world history. We ask that you help Racebridge positively influence American's hearts and minds, as we continue to progress by taking unprecedented action!

 

What We Need & What You Get

As a contributor to our startup launch fund, you will provide the core foundation to uplift our mission and push our media into the world. Your generosity supports Racebridge’s ability to advertise and promote media, produce high quality content, and hire team members.

*Contributors who donate $50 or more will receive a Racebridge bumper sticker to show your pride as an advocate.

*Contributors who donate $100 or more will receive the bumper sticker, plus a Racebridge hat, plus the option of being listed as a Racebridge Hero on our website once it’s live.

Our goal is to raise $25,000+, and if this is accomplished, we will be able to produce a larger volume of content, add operational expenses (i.e. software), hire virtual assistants, and advertise during the startup phase of the company.

We appreciate all supporters and every contribution makes a difference.

 

The Impact

Here is the difference your contribution will make:

1. People Are Tired of Divisive Content - Some media companies have a business goal of acquiring attention at all costs, even at the cost of negatively portraying certain cultures. They may be unaware, or they may not care. Either way, Racebridge promotes diversity even when it's uncomfortable in order to showcase cultural differences as a valuable thing to cherish.

2. Media Shapes Perceptions - A white mother in the suburbs is scared of black people because she has no black friends. A black person in the hood is uncomfortable around white people because they automatically assume white people don't care about them. Bridging the cultural gap between officers and communities, men and women, black and white, gay and straight, are all a part of our mission. We make the effort to show positive relationships, so that people become comfortable with others who are different than themselves.

3. The Topic Of Race Will Never Disappear - Avoiding race makes it more of a sensitive topic, because at the end of the day, we all know it’s there. So instead, let’s talk openly, honestly, and respectfully. That’s when we understand how to create actionable change, so everyone feels comfortable and accepted.

4. Every Side Has A Story - People are quick to judge without seeking to understand first. We push the opposite agenda. You’re free to judge and completely disagree after a person explains their story, but it’s important to put emotions aside and think with logical empathy first.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Our biggest challenge at Racebridge is the lack of capital to expand our reach and operations. We’re determined to improve the quality and volume of content in regard to cultural connections and making a difference in America’s perception of race, gender, sexual orientation, and more. 

If you are unable to donate, we just ask that you help promote our mission by following our social media accounts @racebridge and sharing our page!

Finally, we ask that you share the link to this campaign with your loved ones. Thank you!

story:
Dandy Con 2020 is an online pop culture convention for LGBTQ+ people and their kin of all ages! Come, be aggressively yourself, and find your geeky community!

 

So...wait...what’s Dandy Con?


Dandy Con is aiming to help fill the gap in all ages queer events. While we originally planned to launch as a physical event in Denver later this year, given current events, we decided to shift gears to a virtual platform. We want to create space for community, especially during Pride month, while enjoying the unique opportunities provided by technology. See your favorite cosplayer transform before your eyes! Watch an artist create a masterpiece on your screen! Hear a bunch of cool cats talk about nerdy gay stuff right from your comfy couch—whether you’re here with us in Colorado or staying up late to catch the action in Alice Springs, Australia. We’d all love to be together in person, but technology has its own advantages for a con experience to explore!

We plan to launch on Saturday June 27th, 2020 with 3 channels: Main Programming, with speakers presenting about all sorts of nerdy subjects and how they overlap with the LGBTQIA+ community; artists streaming from our Makers Market; and table top and video gaming. If we reach our funding goals we will be adding an extra day (Sunday the 28th), unlocking additional channels of programming, and making the con a better experience for everyone! We will also have an active Discord server leading up to and during the con, a market place of hand selected nerdy wares from queer artists, a community area for non-profit queer and nerdy organizations, and more!

Come join us, let loose, and be yourself. We got you. 
 

TIMELINE AND BUDGET

 

This is happening, even if it’s just us and our five friends showing up to talk about how gay She-ra is, BUT we want this to be so much more. We want this to be for everyone. Because of that, while we are taking anything y’all want to donate, we do have some specific goals! 

 



$500

At $500 Dandy Con will be upgraded to a 2 days event. Have a full weekend of celebrating your aggressively authentic, nerdy gay self!


$1000

At $1000 we will be expanding our programming openings, adding a stream for cosplay specific programming (the contest will still be in main events), splitting gaming into a dedicated video game AND a dedicated table top stream, and adding a devoted chat to stream LGBTQ+ content on Hulu/Netflix led by various hosts!


We will also add a commemorative badge, based on The Gorgonist’s design, into the package for every con-goer!



PERKS

All of the programming for Dandy Con will be provided free, however, backers will receive special access and con merch!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

At $10 we will send you one (randomly chosen) high quality Dandy Lion sticker from either Visi Color, Atomic Pixies, or The Gorgonist! (approx 3 inches).

You will also be considered an "attendee," earning you access to question submission (for applicable panels—speakers will choose from submissions), a backer-only Discord channel, and 24-hour early access to the Dandy Con exclusive Makers Market sales!  

 



A $20 donation gets you all 3 sticker designs, a Dandy Lion acrylic charm, and the same access to question submission, early access, and Discord as the Attendee tier.
 


Our highest tier, for those who really want to see this happen. Only 10 of these gift sets are available.

You support us; we spoil you. You’ll get a set of Dandy Lion stickers, an acrylic charm, a Dandy Con vinyl sticker, a limited edition Dandy Con Mini poster designed by The Gorgonist, a pair of Magical Pride (backer’s choice) enamel pins from Atomic Pixies, and a high quality silk rainbow face mask from Vady Makes.

In addition to being a con attendee and the access that brings, you will have a guaranteed question spot (for applicable panels.) And if the world is still here and we're still going next year, you have tickets for Dandy Con 2021!
 

Don’t have money now? 

I get it. We are doing this on a shoestring budget because neither do we! But there are non-monetary ways to help this happen too!


SHARE SHARE SHARE! We have a twitter, FB, and IG! Add them, share them, talk about the show, point your friends our way.

Volunteering! We need volunteers, especially moderators for panels (sit quietly and paste in links!) Head over to dandycon.com to find out more. 

We also need content creators! Want to run a panel, a table top game, stream your favorite queer indie media, or enter your passion projects to the Maker Market or Community Garden? Check out Dandycon.com for those opportunities and more. Maker Market and Community Garden open Sunday, May 17th for submission.

All presenters will also have Ko-fis available where you can tip them directly during the event if you appreciate their content!
 


 

Where did this idea come from?


If you have blissfully been in the woods for the last 6 months or so, well, thank you for checking out our campaign first thing, and I’m very, very sorry. The COVID-19 pandemic has destroyed the con scene, especially the small creators who depend on it for income. 


We have always wanted to create a safe, all-ages-friendly queer space for people from all over the LGBTQIA+ spectrum. As nerds and con kids since we were knee high to a grasshopper, we felt we’d be best at making that space for the nerdy side.


Te and Be from the Atomic Pixies started talking with friends, especially their queer friends in the nerdy art community, about laying the grounds for a new convention in 2017. We chose the name Dandy Con both for the historical reference to Dandies, fashionable men of a certain mindset, and because dandelions are an amazing analogy—They’re a beneficial weed that provide food and medicine, make their (biological) community better, bring brightness, beauty, and resilience everywhere they go...and never get the respect they deserve.


Seems fitting.


We want this to be a place for all. The queer community is amazing, but we still lack a lot of places that aren’t tied to the night scene. Places that are welcoming to all ages, families, and anyone who might not feel comfortable in a bar. And recently the nerd community, on every level, has been exploring new life and new horizons...of course we want to take that journey with it, with these two communities, intertwined. While we were planting these seeds...the world turned on its head.

 

Now we want to make something new. To dig those roots deep into the soil and create Dandy Con as something unique.
 

Help us make Dandy Con blossom!

story:
Short Summary

The ‘Spit it Out’ Project is a series of screenings, exhibitions and inspiring talks about sex, consent and healing from trauma, organised in collaboration with Rape Crisis Scotland and BBC Scotland.

In 2019, we made the documentary ‘Spit it Out’, which tells the story of rapper Bee Asha Singh as she is confronted by a dilemma: antidepressants helped her deal with her sexual trauma but made her numb and prevented her from creating. The film follows her when she finds the strength to stop her medication. She realises her spoken words have the power to inspire her audience to open up about their experiences of sexual assault and mental health.

‘The Spit it Out’ project will continue the momentum of the film, organising the events in over 17 cities and towns in Scotland and the UK; starting with Bee Asha Singh’s poetry and Nisan Yetkin’s illustrations, and opening the call to other artists who would like to share their work.

We are hoping to start a conversation around topics that are too often taboo in our society. We want the next generation to be able to talk about sex, consent and mental health without shame !

Our first event will be in Edinburgh College of Art in January and in Paradise Palms in February. 

 

What we need & What You Get

We are starting the project and we need funds to organise awareness events and travel with The Spit it Out Project. 

You can donate money (without asking for any perks)  or buy one of our original creations.

We designed a collection of perks based on the art we made for the documentary. The goal is to raise money and start helping more and more people in Scotland and in the UK. 

With the money we will be able to pay the artists for their work and start organising more events in universities, cultural centres ad more secluded areas in the country. 

We will also give 30% of the profits  will go to Rape Crisis Scotland in order to support them in their new campaign.  In Scotland this year over one thousand survivors of sexual violence are waiting for specialist support from Rape Crisis Centres. Let's try to help.!

The perks are locally produced (Dunbar and Edinburgh) and originally designed by Nisan Yetkin, the animator of the film. 

 

The " Aye Consent" Tee Shirts

They are all gender neutral and ecological ! Designed by Nisan Yetkin, based on original illustrations.  

 

The "Breathe" Totebag

The illustration is based on one of Bee's poem called "Breathe". 

"Heart slowing. Breathe.

Stomach settles. Breathe.

Birds crowing. Breathe.

Eyes level. Breathe.

You ain't feeling right.  It's given you a real fright.

But mate that's totally alright.
Cause the next step is in sight.

Don’t forget to Breathe."

(Excerpt  of  by Bee Asha Singh) 

 

The Prints & postcards

 We printed 5 copies and 60 postcards of Nisan's original illustrations  based on the animation and the poems of the film. They don't come framed but here is an example of presentation.

I trusted you 

"At first I thought to let you . As I've done for many men.  

Then it begins to hurt . And I couldn’t do it all again.

I asked you - Please, to Stop

As I cried out in pain,

My pleas were just not heard,   

Not until you came."

(Excerpt  of  Grotty by Bee Asha Singh)

 

Isolation 

"I’m grotty and I’m snotty .

I’m full of fuckin’ cum.

Sitting naked on the toilet .

With it dripping down my bum.

I feel so disgusting.
That wasn’t  fucking  fun." 

(Excerpt  of  Grotty by Bee Asha Singh) 

Dissociation  

"Heath asked what I needed,  Knowing he couldn't do much 

I told him a smoke. Reverting back to my crutch 

So he rolled us a joint . And we spoke of our homes 

We sat on the doorstep. And I told him to go

Whenever he wanted . To party and pai

He said there's no rush .

So we sat for a while. " 

(Excerpt  of Heath by Bee Asha Singh)

 

Breathe

"I cried with happiness
For someone else's joy last week, 

Fuck me did that feel good.  To laugh so hard with my pal...

The numbness has subdued."

(Excerpt of Breathe by Bee Asha Singh) 

 

The Impact 

When met we Bee, she showed us that you could overcome the trauma by refusing to let it define you in a negative way and helping others. During the making of the documentary, an amazing team was created to bring it to life and spread her message. Today, we want to organise these events in order to spread the message that it’s possible to heal. Today more than ever, it is vital to break the taboo around sex, consent and mental health. We believe it's the only way to empower people and push them to define their boundaries and  express what they want, need and feel. 

We want to engage not only with women, but also with men; not only with a young audience but also with older listeners. This film is part of the current global movement for gender equality and for mental health. Our goal is to allow people from different social and political background to start talking about consent. We are hoping the events will bring families, different generations brought together in order to find concrete solutions to the rape and depression pandemic that has no age or gender limits.

This project will benefit the public by allowing them to express themselves after the screenings / performances. Working closely with Rape Crisis Scotland, there is evidence that when a trauma survivor hears another’s story, it shows them they are not alone. The world becomes one step safer. By normalising the discussions around consent, sex and mental health we might save lives. If people find the confidence  to open up about their struggles to each other and stop being ashamed of it, it could have a great impact on the communities we are willing to reach out to.

Thanks to the film and Bee’s performances, we realise that this story had a great impact on the viewers, by allowing them to listen and relate to someone who is not afraid or ashamed to talk about her experience of rape and depression. We were amazed by the power of words on the audience. Many people reached out to us after, telling us the film helped them open up about their own trauma or believe they could heal and stop relying to medication to cope with what they went through.

This film will show that despite the pain and the suffering one experiences, there is always a way to reach out to others and be part of someone’s recovery! We wish the next generation will never have to deal with shame or denial the way most people dealing with bad mental health do today. Let's talk about these subjects and break the taboo around them !

More infos on our Instagram and Facebook Page!

story:
About the Exhibit

Imagine the Angels of Bread  is a visual exploration by Leo Herrera of the experiences of gay Latino men. We stand proudly in the tradition of art to protest injustice and imagine a better future for ourselves, our brothers, and our queer familia. Queer men of color are seldom represented in a queer fine art and this exhibit is an opportunity to showcase an established artist in a setting (the Museum of Photographic Art) the subject matter deserves.

(Pictured) "Cornucopia of Backbreak"  explores immigration and farm labor with a visual nod to a Caravaggio painting. The pieces in the exhibit explore themes relevant to the Latino queer experience (HIV, femininity, racism, labor and love) in visual styles that are not associated with Latino bodies, such as renaissance paintings, American pop art and Tom of Finland drawings. The pieces will combine these aesthetics to showcase the magical realism of the artist's Mexican heritage.

Elevate Revolutionary Art (a non-profit) has already paid for the creation of the work and payment to the talent. We need funds ($7500) to finish the printing and framing of 8 pieces for the show's debut in San Diego on October 26,2017. The exhibit is made of 8 individual pieces that explore themes central to the gay Latino experience: HIV, Love, Environmental Racism, Immigration, Labor, Religion and Gay Spaces.

About Leo Herrera

Leo Herrera is a multimedia artist and activist focusing on queer anthropology. Leo is a self taught, first-generation Mexican immigrant and the themes of HIV stigma, the preservation of gay history, gay male sexuality and nightlife are central to his work. Leo’s work has been featured in international publications such as Vice, Slate, Huffington Post, New York Magazine, The Advocate and Out and his viral art film pieces have been seen by millions online, featured in global AIDS conferences and exhibited in museums including Leslie Lohman, American University Museum and the GLBT Historical Museum.

About Elevate Revolutionary Art & The Program

Elevate Revolutionary Art’s mission is to “Build power and solidarity by producing art centered on gay men of color and by supporting movements that fight for their lives and dignity.” We accomplish our mission through our two main programs. Our fine art photography program provides annual financial, logistic, and creative support to a gay fine art photographer of color in order to create an exhibit. Our visual talent program supports the men in front of the camera. Visual talent program participants go through 30 hours of class time where they learn about a range of social justice issues and engage in multiple activities. Through a combination of financial support, leadership training, mentoring, and educational programming, the men who move through our visual talent program receive the holistic support that gay Latino men deserve and emerge better able to work towards a more equitable and socially just world in their respective communities.

story:
In 2015, Irondale invited the New York Police Department to join them in developing a program that would use theatrical improvisation to build communication and empathy between officers and the communities they are charged to protect and serve.

This idea came to Irondale co-founder Terry Greiss after watching the video of Eric Garner's fatal 2014 encounter with police officers in Staten Island. Like so many of us - he felt enraged: 

"I kept seeing people not talking to each other, not looking at each other and the tragedy that evolved because of that. So, in my anger about this, I wrote a letter to the police commissioner and I said: This is what we do and I think you need it."    (NPR, Jeff Lunden). 

To the company's surprise - the NYPD replied immediately and "To Protect, Serve, and Understand" was born. 

 

Over a period of ten weeks, seven officers and seven community members come together to eat, talk, and play together. They learn to improvise, tell their own stories, and “step into each other’s shoes.”

The workshops culminate in original and spontaneous public performances that show what can come from mutual trust and empathetic understanding.    

 

Each workshop begins with the entire group sitting down together to have a meal. This is a vital part of the experience. How often do we really get to sit down and hear other perspectives on topics that are very hot in the world right now? Topics we need to hear another point of view on but rarely do.  

 

Take A Walk in My Shoes... 

 

After dinner, no matter how heated things get, the company jumps into the work.

The work consists of improvisation games and actor techniques all taught by Irondale's teaching Artists. We laugh, we sing, we get silly, and we confront difficult topics thru the art. 

We use these improvisation and storytelling techniques to help participants take on the roles of individuals who are unfamiliar to them. Participants are asked to interview people in their communities and to use their personal stories. Cops interview civilians; civilians interview cops.  And then they play each other. By speaking, moving, and thinking as another person, and ultimately making someone else’s story their own, they develop true understanding that leads to a heightened level of trust and cooperation. Participants are given the tools to appreciate and honor the other person’s experience. 

 

 

We Believe Communication & Empathy is what the World Needs Now

This program addresses one of the timeliest issues in our society today: the relationship between police officers and the individuals they protect and serve. We believe that fear and misconceptions about the “other” stand in the way of achieving understanding between people who need to trust and respect each other in order for society to function safely and equitably. Unless an officer on the beat and an average citizen can learn to communicate and thereby establish trust, the gap that exists now will grow wider.

 

The Impact Of Our Work

 

We Need Funding! We Need You!

The NYPD has already committed to helping us, but their funding alone is not enough to cover our costs. We also believe that this project is for the people and by the people and must also have the people's backing as well in order to make it work. 

Funding will help us:

  • Pay the Artists and Facilitators who run the workshops. ($28,548 - Total Salaries & Benefits)
  • Rent rehearsal and performance space. ($11,200)
  • Pay stipends to Community Participants. ($7,000)
  • Project Coordinator ($5,000)
  • Fund Production Expenses including: Tech Crew, Lighting & Sound for performance. ($3,000)
  • A Documentary about the project. ($2,800)
  • THE FOOD - lovingly prepared by a community of volunteer cooks. ($3,000)
  • Live Stream Broadcast of performance - help us reach over 10,000 people! 

 

Together We Can Make A Change!

 

About Irondale Ensemble: 35 years of Arts Activism

Irondale Ensemble is one of the premier and longest-established companies of its kind in the United States. Since our founding, in 1983, we have created over 60 theater productions in New York City, including 13 original works created collaboratively by the company. Our work in theaters and in the community is held in the highest esteem and, as one of the pioneers in the field of arts education, we have used the art of theater to enhance teaching and learning for thousands of students, teachers and “at-risk” youth. Our STEM to STEAM program now reaches 400 high school science, math and engineering students, using theater to teach them presentation skills. Over the years we have toured to Russia, created programs for AIDS affected children in South Africa, and directed at the Drama Centre London, a premier British training program. Irondale is the recipient of commendations from the Brooklyn Borough President, the Otto Award for Humanitarian and Political Theater, and the CINE Award for Best Educational Video. The ensemble won the Grand Prix at the St. Petersburg International Theater Festival for its production You Can’t Win. We helped create the Network of Ensemble Theaters, now the preeminent association of artist-driven theaters in the country, and the Downtown Brooklyn Arts Alliance, and served as a model in the creation of five theater companies in the US and Canada.

PRESS:

We have been Featured by NPR, the New Yorker and the Wall Street Journal

              

 

MEDIA PARTNERS & DONORS:

Over the years we have toured to Russia, created programs for AIDS affected children in South Africa, and directed at the Drama Centre London, a premier British training program. Irondale is the recipient of commendations from the Brooklyn Borough President, the Otto Award for Humanitarian and Political Theater, and the CINE Award for Best Educational Video. story:
Growing up and going to school in Western Africa, our history and geography books highlighted European locations, folklore, histories. With African Guardians, I make my attempt at offering a form of alternative and accessible education for all ages to learn about Indigenous African cultures and people through film and visual art. When supporting this project, you help to provide this educational resource to all who wish they could learn more about unspoken stories and cultures throughout the continent, as we attempt to give a voice to Indigenous Africans who wish to share their stories and histories with us all worldwide.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this project, I am trying to raise $8000 which will help to provide the funds for production and transportation to produce the film as well as offset the cost of printing the books, making them more accessible to all at a subsidized price!

There are amazing perks of original hand drawn work by myself that I have worked hard over fro years of research and studying as well as opportunities to be recognized as part of our production team that helps to give jobs to indigenous African creatives.

 

The Impact of this project goes without saying. There is little to no representation on a large scale for Indigenous African cultural information and the representation is shown as a figment of nostalgia, fixated in time. We want to take these indigenous cultures to be as recognized as any culture internationally and share the beauty of such a vast continent.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if green pieces of paper cannot be given in support of this project but there are other ways that we would appreciate your help! Please share using Indiegogo's great campaign sharing tools!

story:
Who am I, the translator

  • Vasko Cvetkovski is a classical philologist and ancient greek and latin teacher.
  • His translations: Aristotle's Categories and Metaphysics.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $ 3000 for printing 500 hard copies, $ 1000 for shipping 250 hard copies abroad, $ 500 for shipping 250 copies in Macedonia, and $1500 for the translation work.
  • You get one of the most important history books for the Macedonian medieval history- 450 pages bilingual two column text (Ancient Greek- Macedonian).

The Impact

Macedonian historiography has a strong need for this book. Helping the publication of this book, you are helping not only Macedonian historiography, but also Macedonian culture and Macedonian identity in general.

story:
Short Summary

Attending Burning Man?  Send a postcard home to share your experience! Come to Automatic Subconscious (at 8:00 and Esplanade) on Thursday, from 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm to pick up a postcard.  Write whatever you want to whomever you want and we'll mail it anywhere in the world for you. Your postcard will have the elusive Black Rock City stamp on it. We provide writing utensils, postcards, and postage! 

Last year we provided over 2000 postcards (and postage) in our two hour event and we ran out of stamps and postcards. This year, we're planning on 2500! 

What We Need & What You Get

2500 postcards with around 35% needing global stamps, which are $1.20 a piece = $1050

2500 postcards with 65% of them needing domestic US stamps, which are $0.40 each = $650

Printing 2500 postcards = $350

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! If you sent or a received a postcard, tell your friends! Then tell your friends to donate!
  • Share this on Facebook, Reddit, Twitter, Snapchat, or whatever social media platform you love
story_txt:
Short Summary
Attending Burning Man?  Send a postcard home to share your experience! Come to Automatic Subconscious (at 8:00 and Esplanade) on Thursday, from 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm to pick up a postcard.  Write whatever you want to whomever you want and we'll mail it anywhere in the world for you. Your postcard will have the elusive Black Rock City stamp on it. We provide writing utensils, postcards, and postage! 
Last year we provided over 2000 postcards (and postage) in our two hour event and we ran out of stamps and postcards. This year, we're planning on 2500! 

What We Need & What You Get
2500 postcards with around 35% needing global stamps, which are $1.20 a piece = $1050
2500 postcards with 65% of them needing domestic US stamps, which are $0.40 each = $650

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! If you sent or a received a postcard, tell your friends! Then tell your friends to donate!

story:
WHO WE ARE

AIMS (Academia Internacional de Música de Solsona) operates in the field of classical music and education, providing activities which aim to serve as links between music and society. We strive to foster interaction between young musicians from any nation, introducing activities of comprehensive mentoring and guidance to young talents, especially to those whose origin or economic possibilities limit a proper development of their professional training.

We aim to create access to music for young musicians from all over the world. We want this music to reach everyone in society. We want to build a community, support artists and provide fair and equal access to the arts.

The contact with the public is particularly important to us. Therefore, our social program offers performances for those without access so that they can participate as well.

AIMS has been operating near Barcelona (Spain) for eighteen years, running three programs: 

AIMS Academy invites and unites highly talented young music students from around the world, and provides private and group mentoring with highly renowned music professors from well-known institutions. Naturally, creating great music starts by nurturing young musicians.

AIMS Festival provides an opportunity for students to express their talents and newly learned skills in front of large audiences. The performances at the music festival are the culmination of tutoring and mentoring that finally connects the students to the audience. This year, 47 performances are programmed within 18 days.

AIMS Social carries out social activities that link music with society.  The program brings live music performances to those who cannot come to classical concerts: to medical centers, senior living facilities, and homes for the elderly and the disabled.

 

WHAT WE WANT

We want to achieve a social benefit through and with our work in the field of music education. We carry this commitment in us and act as an independent and non-profit organization. 

Even though we are a non-profit organization, we still need financial resources to carry out our programs. These include scholarships, especially for those with limited opportunities for professional training, transportation costs, advertising, ...

We are steadily expanding our foundation activities and want to improve by offering more scholarships and access to music education and by expanding our social program all year round. For this we need your support! 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand that not everybody has the financial possibilities to help, but that does not mean you can't support us.

Spread the word! Tweet, Facebook, Instagram, tell people on the bus... however you like to let people know our work! Sharing the information is a big help!

Find us on:

Facebook: aimsfestival

Instagram: aimsfestival

Twitter: aimsfestival

Website: aims.cat

Or contact us: aims@info.cat

story:
Who We Are & What We Do

 

We're CYB 2017: a body-positive, radical runway.

 

Our mission: to transform the night into an enduring celebration of our bodies and ourselves.

 

 

Our runway centers POC and marginalized groups.

 

 

We are body positive. We are gender inclusive.

 

 

We love you masc, femme, big, small.

 

 

We love dresses. And we love shoes.

 

 

We love hair and makeup. We love suits.

 

 

We want you to have fun. We see how you do.

 

 

Come celebrate with us. We want to celebrate you.

 

What We Need

 

We're looking to raise funds to contribute to 48% of the cost of Celebrate Your Body, which is approximately $5,200. This amount does not include grant-funded paid time staff. The funding breakdown for the festival is as follows:

 

As we are a non-profit, we are completely reliant upon grants and individual donations from generous people in the community, so this fundraiser is especially important for us, and every dollar we raise will be put towards the festival.

Please note that our target for the campaign is far below our total cost; this ensures that every single dollar will be put toward making up the $5,200 we need to fund the festival, regardless of whether we come up short, meet our goal, or exceed it.

 

What You Get

 

Why Celebrate Your Body 2017?

 

We care deeply about representation in fashion. We care about featuring designers who design for all, for those of us whose bodies are marginalized by culturally imposed beauty standards. We care about our models who defy these standards, our musical and dramatic acts who defy these standards, our vendors and caterers. Everything we do is to empower ourselves and our audience, to empower you.

This will be Kearny Street Workshop's fourth Celebrate Your Body. Every year, we've continued to grow, to evolve, and to improve the show. This year, we hope to continue to this trajectory and make CYB 2107 our best show yet.

 

Whose work will be featured?

 

This year, we're pleased to announce our runway includes:

Kelly Williams: Kwill Design

AngeLi Clarisse: Sugardope

Dana Edgerly: HiM

Cherice Jackson: Ricee's Pieces Designs

Sasha Cardinale-Weinberg: Rocket Ready Designs

Jessica Hinkle: Proud Mary Fashion

Ivory Albizo: LivExquisite

Performance by desi pop and electronic artist, Kohinoorgasm!

And our distinguished host of the evening will be Janae Johnson, 2015 National and Women of the World Poetry Slam Champion!

 

What is Kearny Street Workshop?

 

Kearny Street Workshop (KSW) is the oldest Asian Pacific American multidisciplinary arts organization in the country. Since 1972, our mission has been to present, produce, and promote art that empowers Asian Pacific American artists and communities.

 

How else can I help?

 

Do you love CYB but don't have the funds right now? That's fine! We'd love for you to:

  • Talk to your friends about us!
  • Share our campaign on Facebook!
  • Attend the event on June 17th!
  • Hit us up on Facebook or email!
  • Volunteer at the event!

Thank you! We love you!

story:
Celebrating Diversity...

The Boulder Dance Coalition - the group that runs the Avalon Ballroom - knows that dance is not only good for our well-being but can also be a powerful bridge to better human understanding. Our mission is to promote public participation in dance and music which is realized through the annual Boulder International Festival. Communities can pass laws intended to curb xenophobic attitudes. Groups can have candlelight vigils, stand in solidarity at protests, and write editorials. But when people hold hands and dance with one another, attitudes can change within individuals.

Each year, we depend on donations from festival goers and various grants to help offset the cost of the festival that has become a Boulder tradition since the original Folkfest in 1981. (click here for more history) As a 501(c)3 non-profit, our budget has limitations and so we are reaching out to the public in hopes of raising funds to help sustain and grow the Boulder International Festival.

At the Boulder International Festival you’ll find some of the best talent in the state representing many flavors of dance and music, with performances, dance teaching and an emphasis on participation. The festival also hosts a world market featuring local artists and fair-trade art, jewelry, and handmade goods from around the world.

Check out the list of 2017 performers!

 

But we can't do it without you...

The Boulder International Festival is a 3-day event, free and open to the public and all ages. Each half hour features a different dance performance, some with live music, ranging from cultural traditions of "village" life around the world to tango, waltz and Zumba demonstrations.

The festival kicks off with a public square dance led by Scootbacks Square Dance Club on Friday night followed by participatory international folk dancing with music by Barbelfish Balkan Band on Saturday evening with a variety of dance lessons and demonstrations from performers throughout the weekend.

To put this all together requires a budget of just over $10,000. We are hoping to raise $2,000 through crowdfunding to:

  • Provide the flexibility we need to focus our efforts on expanding the festival to include new audiences.
  • Ensure that we can continue to produce the festival.
  • Allow us to keep the festival FREE!

Here is a breakdown of the festival budget:

  • Location – space rental, electricity, restroom cleaning, permits $250.00
  • Advertising – flyer/poster design and editing, event promotion efforts $700.00
  • Printing – flyers, site maps, signage $650.00
  • Supplies – print/copy materials, postage, food $750.00
  • Staff – manager, staff, crew $3,500.00
  • Rentals – tent and chairs $1,650.00
  • Audio – systems, technicians, Saturday night band $1,800.00
  • Security – 2 security personnel for 2 nights $960.00

Each year local business and organizations help support the festival. The Boulder Dance Coalition thanks those who have already pledged to support the 2017 Boulder International Festival:

  • Boulder Body Wear
  • Boulder County
  • Boulder Daily Camera
  • City of Boulder
  • City of Boulder Human Relations Commission
  • Downtown Boulder
  • KGNU 88.5FM
  • Eldorado Natural Spring Water
  • Romanian American Freedom Alliance

 

Perks

BDC Friend – Everyone who contributes to the campaign will have their name added to the thank you display at the festival.

 

The Impact...

The Boulder International Festival promotes openness, diversity, inclusivity, and exploration - things that are good for our psyches and our communities, just as dancing is good for the body. Communities around the world are in need of unity, even in Boulder which has an educated, world-traveled, left-leaning population. There have been threats called in to the Jewish Community Center and racist tagging around town among other overt expressions of prejudice. Many of these intolerant opinions stem from lack of opportunity to get to know people from other cultures, and therefore we feel the festival is more important than ever.

We believe that if people hold hands and dance; actually experience the energy generated by participating in the brief experience of being inside the culture the change of attitude will happen from within the individual.

 

Other Ways You Can Help...

Even if you can't donate, please help us spread the word! Share this link and let people know about the Boulder International Festival and be sure to come to the Pearl Street Mall and dance!
